title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.*
**Why Rebtel?**
 At Rebtel, we build complex, high-performing applications that power global communication. Our backend development is structured yet flexible—an environment where agility, creativity, and technical excellence are not just encouraged but expected. We maintain an agile workflow, prioritize clean, maintainable code through regular refactoring, and champion knowledge-sharing through code reviews. If you're looking for challenging problems that will stretch your skills and ignite your creativity, you’ll feel right at home.
   

  

**About You**
 As a Senior .NET Developer who not only loves solving complex problems but is passionate about code quality, and building scalable and testable solutions.
   

  

 You’ll be adequately self going, contribute to technical discussions, and aspire to deliver clean, robust code. You have a sharp eye for simplicity amidst complexity and pride yourself on thorough, thoughtful development—including writing tests for critical components. Whether working closely within your team or leading a project area independently, you’re confident, collaborative, and proactive.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Expertise in .NET Core, .NET Framework, and related technologies (e.g., ASP.NET)
* Strong knowledge of both SQL (MSSQL) and document-oriented databases like MongoDB
* Hands-on experience with DevOps practices and deployment tools (Git, Azure DevOps)
* Practical knowledge of containerization using Kubernetes
* Experience integrating with GraphQL and REST APIs
* Excellent communication skills in English
* We don’t evaluate skills by number, however we believe ideally you should have worked at least 7+ years to gain the right seniority
* Passionate about writing clean, structured, and testable code
* Puts really high weight on test coverage of their code
* Elevates the performance and mindset of the team around them
* Naturally curious, loves experimenting with new technologies
* Strategic vision for product and codebase growth


**Our Offer To You**
**Benefits**
 At Rebtel, you are the most important asset and we strive to provide a comprehensive package of benefits and perks that enhance your well-being and work experience. Here are some of the things you can expect from us:
   

  

* Pension Plan
* Health Checkups and Private Medical Insurance
* 10k Bucket (net) for wellness allowance and Travel (benefit taxed)
* Discount on gym memberships
* Bonus program
* Parental pay
* 30 days annual vacation
* Relocation Support, if you're joining us from afar, we'll assist you in making a smooth transition.


 Rebtel is an international workplace, and at the office, we speak English; therefore, high English proficiency is required.
   

  

*We are Rebtel. We come from all around the world to create products for anyone who has crossed a border. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.
   

  

 Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day—and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.

title: Gameplay Programmer
description:
Are you passionate about strategy games? Do you have a solid C++ background? Paradox Development Studio is offering an exciting opportunity for a Gameplay Programmer to join our dedicated team working on our latest grand strategy project, Victoria 3.
   

  

 At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.
   

  

 We invite you to contribute to Victoria 3, a game that simulates a transformative century, starting from 1836. Your input will directly impact the game mechanics and systems, bringing to life our representation of global population dynamics, industrial revolution, and diplomatic endeavors on a grand scale.
   

  

**The Skills We’re Looking For**
* Proficiency in C++, with the ability to develop and maintain well-engineered code, focusing on stability and performance.
* Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, with the aptitude to take full ownership of features from understanding the design to implementing the code.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken, to effectively collaborate in our international team.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills, capable of contributing positively to team dynamics and achieving project goals.


 Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.
   

  

 If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Victoria team!
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Senior Software Developer
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 In Getinge Digital Solutions we work with connectivity and remote services, modernizing how medical devices can be used. The team works with embedded software (C++20), creating and maintaining connectivity applications close to medical devices to facilitate remote services.
   

  

 We aspire to be modern and agile in our approach to software development using SCRUM, CI/CD pipelines, and modern ways of coding.
   

  

 Our team is diverse and consist of both developers and testers located in Solna (Sweden), and Bengaluru (India), with good communication across the borders. We are one team!
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In this role, your primary responsibility will be to design, develop and maintain embedded software together with the team as well as software interfaces towards other system parts. You will also help foster a constructive and learning environment for other members of the team.
   

  

 Examples of what you will do in your daily work:
   

  

* Design and develop embedded C++ code on application layer
* Take responsibility of CI/CD pipelines and development environment together with the team
* Be part of making decisions about and releasing the team’s products
* Take shared responsibility of the team’s test tools (E.g. in house developed test tool in Go (Golang)
* Contribute to good collaborative environment with other teams


 This position is based in Solna, Stockholm and offers a hybrid setup (3 office days, 2 remote days). Travelling is not expected in this position.
   

  

**You will bring**
 To be successful in this position, we believe that you have the following qualifications.
   

  

* University education or equivalent experience
* 5-years of experience of C++ and embedded software
* Experienced in software design
* Experience with Git
* Fluency in Swedish and English, orally and written


**Valued Qualifications But Not Required.**
* Experience with Go (Golang)
* Experience with MQTT
* Experience with Google Protocol Buffers


 In addition to your technical skills, we highly value your personality. We see that you are humble but willing to voice your opinions, and that you value differences in opinion. You are good at collaborating and communicating, with a social side. We also see that you are driven and can work independently in your work. We think you have an ambition for growth and an eagerness to keep up to date with the latest in software development.
   

  

 At Getinge we see ourselves as proactive and self-driven in learning and contributing to the continued development of our products and our organization's capabilities. We are Team Players, Forward Thinkers and Game Changers.
   

  

 We think you will thrive in a high-expectation environment and have an interest in our products.
   

  

**Why join Getinge**
 Getinge offers a job in a safe and informal work environment, where we appreciate close team collaboration. We keep an open dialogue between leaders and employees, as well as between teams. We are focused on developing people, and together we will create a plan for learning and competence development when you start your career with us.
   

  

 Getinge offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness allowances, generous family benefits and joint company activities. Everything to ensure we support your well-being and goals.
   

  

**Application**
 We ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the 'apply now' button. We wish to receive your application no later than 2025-09-20.
   

  

 Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Daniel Axelsson at Daniel.axelsson@getinge.com or Recruiter Sofia Ekstrand at sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired MedTech company.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
   

  

**But where does that take you?**
 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
   

  

**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
   

  

**We are looking for**
**Senior Software Engineer**
**to join our team at our location in Stockholm**
**(Y)our Mission:**
 Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We allow consumers to choose when and how they want to pay, guaranteeing merchants a steady and predictable cash flow. Our products make us proud, but not content, and we have high ambitions for our existing and upcoming products. We’re now modernizing and strengthening one of our key products with renewed focus in the Nordics — backed by the strength of a global group, but with the energy and ownership of a startup. You’ll join a newly formed product & tech team, helping shape how we work and how we grow as we double down on building sustainable, human-centric FinTech solutions.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* In this role, you will work as a full-stack engineer, primarily focusing on backend tasks and having smaller front-end responsibilities. You will join one of our products, and your daily tasks will be:
* Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, APIs, and other workflows.
* Attend regular scrum ceremonies as a member of an agile cross-functional team.
* Analyze, discuss and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create.
* Adopt, implement, and provide feedback on organizational and industry standards and practices that will positively impact on our engineering culture.


  

  

**What will help you to succeed in the role:**
* A university degree in the IT field
* Hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework.
* Experience in frontend development with any modern JavaScript framework (e.g., Angular).
* Some experience in developing, shipping, and maintaining cloud-based applications.
* A good understanding of RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with microservices and distributed architecture is a plus.
* Experience with relational databases, preferably SQL Server.
* Knowledge of cloud development and experience with Azure is a bonus.
* Written and spoken English proficiency to communicate and collaborate with our international team.


**About the technologies we use:**
 Our teams have autonomy regarding tech choices. The example below will give you some insights, and we look forward to discussing this further.
   

  

 All solutions developed cloud-native targeting Azure - Infrastructure defined using Terraform - Services deployed to Kubernetes clusters by default - A growing microservice ecosystem with event-based integration - Using latest .NET Core - RESTful API design - Single-page frontend apps served by CDN - Frontend tech using TypeScript, often Angular or standard Web Components (Stencil) - Automated tests in each layer - Design collaboration using Figma.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
   

  

 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Senior .Net Developer
description:
**Start date:** 
 October 2025
   

  

**Duration:** 
 Full time, 6 months with possibility to extend
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, hybrid
   

  

 Our client is a niche bank, and we are now looking for a
 **senior back-end developer** 
 with solid experience in
 **C#, .NET** 
 , and regulatory requirements within the banking and finance sector.
   

  

 The assignment involves supporting the client during a period of high workload to meet regulatory requirements. It is therefore important that you have the right experience and personality to quickly get up to speed and deliver high-quality results from the start.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 To succeed in this role, we see that you have:
   

  

* At least 5 years experience as a .Net developer
* Degree in computer science, software engineering, or similar.
* Experience with regulatory requirements within the banking and finance sector.
* Experience in CI/CD pipelines and REST APIs and event sourcing.
* Experience in .Net 8, event-driven architecture, ASP.NET MVC, and Web API.

* Knowledge in Azure/Git.
* Used to working in Agile/Scrum-like environments.

**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Senior Software Developer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Financial Services
description:
Here at Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That's why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers, improving their relationships. We’re looking for a talented Senior Software Developer to join our Stockholm team in a hybrid role and help us shape the future of billing!
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We’re looking for a Senior Developer who’s excited by the challenge of rethinking how billing gets done. If you love collaborating with a diverse team, finding new angles to solve problems, and making an impact on real customer experiences, you’ll fit right in. You’ll join a friendly crew of developers, product managers, and other stakeholders who share a passion for building a great platform to prove that great business grows from great relationships. This is a flexible hybrid role based in Stockholm, with no relocation assistance offered.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* **Standardize & Scale** 
 : Help shape a platform that’s ready to grow into new European markets. You’ll refactor, optimize, and test our systems so they can handle more transactions and delight more users.
* **Tackle Tech Debt** 
 : Fine-tune existing solutions so they run smoothly for larger clients, higher traffic, and increased complexity.
* **Create Real Value** 
 : Dive into coding, requirement analysis, and testing to build features that our clients and their customers will love.
* **Lead & Collaborate** 
 : Work side by side with other developers, share fresh ideas, guide technical decisions, and keep our platform moving forward.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 We want someone humble, hungry, and happy: eager to grow, curious about how things can improve, and excited about shaping the future of billing. You enjoy discussing big ideas but are also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to make them happen.
 



  





**Key Qualifications** 



* **Language Expertise** 
 : At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP or Python (ideally both, but strong in one with openness to learn the other works too), ideally working on products with real-world impact.
* **Adaptability** 
 : An openness to learning new tools in our stack (think AWS, databases, and more).
* **Product Mindset** 
 : Comfortable in a collaborative, product-focused environment, where everyone’s ideas matter.
* **Problem-Solver** 
 : A knack for breaking down complex challenges into clean, maintainable solutions.



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* **B2B & B2C Background** 
 : Experience building solutions for business and consumer needs.
* **Scaling Know-How** 
 : Exposure to international expansion or platforms that operate across borders.
* **Payments Experience** 
 : A couple of years (or more) dealing with payment systems, transactions, or other financial services.



  





**Why Work with Us?** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





 This recruitment process is managed internally, and we respectfully request no contact from recruitment agencies.
 



  





 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Software Engineer to Alva Labs
description:
The workforce is undergoing a massive transformation, with up to 50% of today’s jobs expected to require new skill sets within a few years. This shift makes evaluating talent challenging, and closing this skill gap is rapidly becoming the most critical issue for companies worldwide.
 



  





 At Alva, we believe you are more than just your CV. Traditional evaluations can't capture your full potential, especially in a world where roles evolve quickly. We're dedicated to building an inclusive product that gives everyone an equal opportunity to showcase their abilities and match efficiently with relevant job opportunities. By doing so, we empower companies to thrive and improve their performance through better talent alignment.
 



  





 We are currently looking for Fullstack Engineers to help us revolutionize how the world views talent, today and tomorrow.
 



  





**The company** 




 Alva Labs is a Stockholm-based SaaS company that offers a solution that is helping global organizations grow their team in a scientific way. Alva has created a unique candidate assessment platform that helps companies find the right candidate for them, and candidates to find their dream job. Combining state-of-the-art psychometrics, data science, and an obsession with candidate experience, it provides the needed tool for data-driven talent acquisition.
 



  





 Our current focus is on transforming our offerings to meet the needs of larger and more complex organizations. By targeting this segment, we aim to redefine how the market perceives talent management. We are embarking on ambitious product innovations and evolving our go-to-market strategies. In this dynamic environment, the engineering team will play a pivotal role in shaping the future success of our company.
 



  





**The role** 




 The day-to-day work in Alva’s engineering team is performed in product squads focused on different product surfaces. Currently, we’re divided into four different squads, each squad aims to be self-sufficient and consists of a Product Manager, Designer, and three to five engineers. Currently, we're hiring for our Product squads that build the core offering of Alva's platform.
 



  





 Within 1 month you have:
 


* Received the support you need in order to get a good start at Alva.
* Started to familiarize yourself with the product and the platform.
* Started contributing to the team’s work.



  





 Within 3 months you have:
 


* Been programming in all parts of the tech stack. All the way from frontend to backend and cloud infrastructure.
* Helped your team to build new features quicker than we otherwise would have - the velocity has increased significantly.



  





 Within 6 months you have:
 


* Impacted the quality of the product, getting to the point where we fix all bugs and improve performance metrics.
* Become a technical role model and informal leader within your team.
* Started to feel proud of the part of the product and the codebase you are working with.



  





**You** 




 We do not expect you to have prior extensive experience building recruitment solutions but we're rather interested in you being a skilled Fullstack Software Engineer and a colleague we could always rely on. Ideally, you have extensive experience working as a fullstack engineer and are used to leading technical discovery of complex problems.
 



  





 We would also be happy if you;
 


* Love solving complex problems and turning them into solutions that breathe simplicity.
* Are ambitious and structured.
* Are a prestigeless team player and enjoy supporting your coworkers.
* Our day-to-day language is English, so no need to know Swedish.
* Are able to spend at least 3 days/week at our office in central Stockholm.



  





**Your future colleagues** 




 We are a team of 60+ people, representing a wide selection of professional backgrounds. And all of that is absolutely fantastic, but the true beauty is the trust and warmth you will experience. You will most likely never be in a place where people are as nerdy about what we do, and have so many brilliant minds to learn from and ask for guidance. To quote our CEO during our last company trip, “It feels like hanging out with a bunch of old friends”.
 



  





**What we offer** 




 We strongly believe that experimentation is the best way of learning and making decisions about product and technology. Therefore, we try our best to keep the feedback loops short to iteratively improve our product and our system. For this to be possible, we need a modern system that is pleasant to work with. The core of our tech stack is;
 



  




* Python
* React, TypeScript
* Google Cloud Platform (GKE, Cloud Run, Pub/Sub)
* PostgreSQL, Firestore
* GraphQL
* Protocol buffers
* Event-driven microservices



  





 The problem we are solving is not just engaging and interesting (the combination of psychological science and statistics, with a large chunk of candidate experience obsession, what’s not to love?), but it is also something that has a tremendous impact on both people and businesses. You will have the opportunity to work with something that truly makes a difference.
 



  





 What else? We have flexible work hours in a hybrid setup, where you spend at least 3 days/week in the office. You will get six weeks of vacation, a flexible compensation and benefits package where you can make individual adaptations, a generous preventive care benefit, and a few other neat perks. You can read all about our benefits →
 
 here
 
 ← and our company values →
 
 here
 
 ←.
 



  





**The hiring process** 




 Given that we claim to be experts in hiring, you probably wonder what we have in store for you.
 


1. Objective screening with Alva’s own tests (and your first interaction with the product we build!)
2. First interview (focusing on who you are)
3. A coding challenge to complete at home (and your second interaction with our product) as preparation for the next round.
4. Live-coding session with your potential new colleagues.
5. System design interview with an Engineering manager
6. Final interview with CTO and deputy CEO
7. Background- and ID check (yes, we take security seriously)
8. Done deal!



  





**Come help us change the world of hiring! Welcome to Alva!**

title: IT Automation Developer
description:
Bravida söker en tekniskt nyfiken IT Automation Developer till teamet Integration & Digital Automation inom Business Technology. Här får du en varierad och utvecklande roll i ett mindre team med hög teknisk kompetens, i en verksamhet som befinner sig i en digital moderniseringsresa.
   

  

 Teamet består av 4–5 personer och arbetar med integrationer via Azure, automatisering av affärsprocesser och ITSMprocesser med plattformen FreshService.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som Digital Automation Developer bidrar du till att utveckla och automatisera de tekniska lösningar som får Bravidas interna system att hänga ihop. Du bygger integrationer, konfigurerar automatiserade flöden och skapar tjänster som effektiviserar repetitiva processer.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära både IT och kärnverksamhet och har en viktig roll i att förbättra produktivitet och användarupplevelse genom smarta tekniska lösningar. Ditt fokus ligger på automation, integrationer och vidareutveckling av arbetsflöden, men också på att förvalta och förbättra vårt ITSM-system Freshservice.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**
* Bygga interna tjänster och integrationer mellan system som ERP, HR och ärendehantering
* Arbeta med eventdrivna integrationer via Azure Integration Services
* Scripta och konfigurera olika tekniska lösningar
* Vidareutveckla arbetsflöden, portaler och användarupplevelse i ITSM-systemet (Freshservice)
* Hantera förändringsförfrågningar, onboarding och kontinuerliga förbättringar i ITSM-systemet
* Säkerställa driftsäkerhet, kvalitet och prestanda i automationslösningar
* Delta i teamets gemensamma planering och bidra till dokumentation av lösningar


 Vem vi söker
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med automation, integrationer och tekniska lösningar i interna IT-miljöer. Du gillar att lösa problem, har förståelse för teknik och trivs med att arbeta praktiskt nära kod, script och API:er.
   

  

**Du bör ha:**
* Erfarenhet av automation och/eller integration i interna IT-miljöer
* Kunskap i PowerShell eller liknande scriptspråk
* Förståelse för REST API:er, webhooks och autentisering (OAuth, SAML)
* Förmåga att tänka i helhet och samarbeta med både IT och verksamhet
* Goda kunskaper i engelska och minst ett skandinaviskt språk.


**Meriterande är:**
* Erfarenhet av ITSM-system som Freshservice, ServiceNow eller Jira Service Management
* Erfarenhet av Azure Integration Services eller annan integrationsplattform
* Grundläggande kunskaper i programmering (t.ex. C# eller Python)
* Erfarenhet av low code-verktyg eller RPA-lösningar (t.ex. UiPath)


 Ansökan och intresse
   

  

 Låter det intressant? Då vill vi veta mer om dig!
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bravida med Boxhill Recruitment. Vi hoppas få läsa din ansökan så snart som möjligt! Ansök genom att klicka här, vi lovar att det går enkelt och att dina uppgifter blir säkert hanterade. Om du har frågor om tjänsten kan du kontakta Petra Törnblom, rekryteringskonsult – petra.tornblom@bhill.se alternativt 076-003 60 80.
   

  

 Bravida som arbetsgivare
   

  

 Hos Bravida får du stora möjligheter att utvecklas och bidra till vår digitala transformationsresa. Du blir en del av ett sammanhang där kollegor stöttar varandra och där både erfarenhet och nytänkande tas tillvara. Här får du utrymme att påverka din roll, ta egna initiativ och vara med och driva teknisk utveckling som gör verklig skillnad för verksamheten och slutanvändarna.
   

  

 Bravida sysselsätter över 14 000 medarbetare i Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Finland och är Nordens största aktör inom installation och service av tekniska system i fastigheter och infrastruktur.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjligheten att vara en del av en verksamhet där system och digitala lösningar spelar en viktig roll i att effektivisera och utveckla våra affärsflöden. Vi eftersträvar en inkluderande och trygg arbetsplats där vi arbetar tillsammans för att skapa resultat.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om Vårt erbjudande och hur du kan utvecklas hos oss. När du växer, växer vi!

title: Integration Software Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 





 About Qurrent
 




 At Qurrent, we're accelerating the transition to a renewable energy future by transforming distributed energy resources—batteries, solar, wind—into flexible, revenue-generating assets. Our AI-driven virtual power plant optimizes assets in real time for customers and the grid. We’re ambitious, move fast, and love working with people who turn hard problems into high performing systems.
 



  





**The Role** 




 You’ll build the integrations that let our agent software talk to the physical world. Most days you’ll be implementing and hardening Modbus-based drivers against diverse hardware, while also extending the Go abstraction layer that sits above protocol adapters. You’ll work closely with hardware partners to get devices online reliably and securely.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Implement, test, and maintain integrations with Modbus servers (TCP/RTU) and other industrial/IoT protocols.
* Extend our Go-based abstraction layer that normalizes device capabilities across vendors.
* Diagnose protocol quirks, timing issues, and field bugs across serial, TCP/IP, and edge environments.
* Collaborate with partners and customers during onboarding; document capabilities and edge cases.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Hands-on with Modbus (must-have); familiarity with one or more of IEC 104, MQTT, or vendor SDKs is a plus.
* Comfortable on Linux at the edge ( logging, networking, security basics).
* Clear communicator; you enjoy calls and screen-shares with partner engineers to unblock integrations.
* Pragmatic, test-minded approach to reliability.
* Solid Go skills and production experience with protocol-level integrations.
* Conversational Swedish



  





**Nice to Have** 



* Experience with time-series data, offline-tolerant agents, or gateway hardware (e.g., RS-485, PLCs).
* Energy/DER, SCADA, or telemetry domain exposure.



  





**﻿
 
 Why Join Us** 



* Fast moving industry that is in the midst of major shifts.
* Your work unlocks entire classes of hardware for our platform—impact you can measure.
* Collaborative, low-ego team using modern tooling (including AI/LLMs) to move faster.

title: Engine Graphics Programmer
description:
Are you passionate about graphics technology and creating immersive gaming experiences? Do you have a strong C++ background and a deep understanding of 3D graphics and GPU technologies? Join our Engine & Tools team as an
 **Engine Graphics Programmer** 
 , where you’ll help build and enhance the technical foundation for our games.
   

  

 At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 As an Engine Graphics Programmer, you will help design, implement, and maintain advanced graphical systems that bring our games to life. You’ll collaborate with game programmers, artists, and content designers to optimize their workflows and ensure high-quality visuals across platforms.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Help design, implement, and optimize graphical features, shaders, and rendering backends.
* Work closely with technical leads, game developers, and artists to align engine functionality with creative goals.
* Ensure systems meet performance benchmarks and run efficiently across platforms.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 3+ Years of C++ Programming Experience, Preferably in the game industry.
* Expertise in 3D Graphics & GPU Tech with strong knowledge of rendering pipelines, HLSL, and compute shaders.
* Experience with proprietary game engines and rendering APIs like DirectX12 and Vulkan.
* Ability to diagnose and resolve complex performance issues.
* Comfortable working with multithreaded environments.
* Ability to explain complex technical concepts clearly in English.


 Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.
   

  

 If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Engine & Tools team!
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Fullstackutvecklare inom försäkring
description:
**Att jobba som fullstackutvecklare** 




 Som fullstackutvecklare hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i Skandias förändringsresa med fokus på pensionsutbetalningar, sparande och köpflöden. Vi genomför just nu en omfattande modernisering av hela kundupplevelsen till plattformen Lumera, vilket innebär att du får arbeta med både gränssnitt och underliggande system. I rollen finns det stora möjligheter att påverka och driva förändringen framåt.
 



 Du kommer att arbeta med utveckling och förvaltning av verksamhetskritiska system. Tillsammans med teamet är du med och designar nya lösningar och anammar ny teknik för att ligga i teknisk framkant. Det innebär också att bygga och underhålla integrationer med andra system i vårt ekosystem.
 







 Vår teknikstack består av:
 


* React & TypeScript


* Vite


* .NET Core och C#


* Vitest, Jest, React Testing Library


* SQL Server


* Git & REST-API:er


* Azure DevOps


* Octopus Deploy


* Splunk



 Du kommer bli en del av ett teamet som består av sju personer med roller som utvecklare, testare, mjukvaruarkitekter, scrum master och produktägare, där vi alla sitter i Stockholm. Vi jobbar nära varandra med bland annat par- och mobbprogrammering och har ett klimat där idéer, feedback och kunskapsutbyte är en naturlig del av vardagen. I vår kultur uppmuntrar vi innovation, ansvarstagande och långsiktigt lärande.
   





 Vi arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till närmaste gruppchef för IT maskinella flöden.
 



**För att lyckas i rollen** 




 Ser vi att du arbetat några år som fullstackutvecklare och trivs i både frontend såväl som i backend miljö. Du har erfarenhet av tekniker som React, TypeScript, .NET och C#. Ett grundkrav i rollen är att du ska kunna kommunicera på svenska flytande, både i tal och skrift. Har du erfarenhet av React Hook Forms, SQL Server eller pensions-/försäkringsbranschen är det ett plus, men inte ett krav.
 



 Vi har dessutom påbörjat vår resa med GitHub Copilot och ser det som en självklarhet att du vill ligga i framkant inom AI-stödd systemutveckling.
 



 Som person är du målmedveten, strukturerad och har en analytisk förmåga. Du trivs med att samarbeta med andra för att dela med oss av nya kunskaper både inom teamet och i kontakten med verksamheten.
 



**Vad händer nu?** 




 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
 



 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Majda Dervisevic på majda.dervisevic@skandia.se.
 



 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
 



 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



**Mer om IT** 




 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
 



 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
 



 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: BI-utvecklare, Stockholm
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du intresserad av en roll inom Business Intelligence-området där du får möjlighet att leverera i en komplex Data Warehouse-lösning? Vill du bli en del av ett av Sveriges härligaste BI-team och samtidigt bli erbjuden en trygg anställning där du får utvecklas? Då är denna tjänst helt rätt för dig!
   

  

 Vi utökar nu ett av våra team inom Data Warehouse med fler erfarna BI-utvecklare. Du kommer att ingå i ett växande team för att hjälpa en av våra bankkunder med sina Data Warehouse-lösningar.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I den här leveransen kommer du designa och implementera BI-lösningar med hjälp av SQL, SSIS och Cognos. En central del av rollen innebär att utveckla och underhålla dataflöden och ETL-processer samt skapa och underhålla datamodeller och rapporteringslösningar. Du kommer också använda dig av SSAS (kuber).
   

  

 En viktig del av vårt åtagande till kunden är att hantera och utveckla rapportering utifrån regulatoriska krav, till olika myndigheter. Vi ser det därför som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av bank och/eller annan kunskap om finansiella instrument eller ekonomi.
   

  

 Du blir en del av vår BI-community, där du får chansen att både hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom Business Intelligence och att dela med dig av dina egna kunskaper. Vi erbjuder även utbildning och support till kunder i BI-verktyg och teknologier.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Eftersom våra kunder och dokumentationen du kommer få arbeta med är på svenska, så är ett krav för denna tjänst god kommunikationsförmåga i svenska, både i tal och i skrift.
   

  

 Utöver detta ser vi gärna att du har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av rollen som BI-utvecklare
* Kunskap i SQL och erfarenhet av SSIS och Cognos
* Erfarenhet av datawarehousing och datamodellering


 Då våra kunder primärt är inom bank och finans är det meriterande med erfarenhet från banksektorn.
   

  

 Som person är du trygg i din yrkesroll, ansvarsfull och noggrann. Du är självgående i ditt arbete och trivs både med att arbeta individuellt och i team. Utöver detta ser vi att du är en person som är nyfiken och initiativtagande när det kommer till att lösa problem och du delar med dig av dina kunskaper och best practice.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vad roligt! Kontakta då gärna mig, Anna Osterman, som är rekryterande chef för denna roll. Du når mig på anna.osterman@cgi.com, 0761 01 31 13.Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Ansökningarna hanteras löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan i dag! Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?**
 Vi är mer än du tror - Vi är ett globalt företag där det finns flera möjligheter än att vara konsult och där work-life balance uppmuntras. Hos oss kan du jobba med våra egna produkter, Inhouse eller ute hos kund. Var du än befinner dig i livet finns det möjligheter för dig på CGI. Det som gör oss unika är att vi lyckas vara både globala och lokala på samma gång. Vi väljer att kalla det för ”Glocal:” Vad det faktiskt innebär är att det bästa ur två världar kombineras. Det globala sammanhanget och stabiliteten finns, samtidigt som varje kontor bygger sin personliga kultur med trivsel och välmående i fokus.
   

  

 Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar ut minst 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag om 4 000 kr
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI


 Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Open Source utvecklare inom integration
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 320 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på åtta kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping, Köpenhamn, Århus. Oslo och Trondheim.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi har mer än 10 års erfarenhet från integrationsområdet och är idag stora partners till organisationer som exempel WSO2 och RedHat. Vi har länge haft ett brinnande intresse för Open Source och nu söker vi vassa utvecklare med fokus på integrationslösningar.
   

  

 Är du en utvecklare som vill nischa dig mot integrationer? Har du alltid haft ett extra gott öga för Open Source? Kittlar det till lite i magen när du får sätta upp containerlösningar? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig.
   

  

 Vi har flera utbildade och certifierade konsulter i området och nu förstärker vi vårt team ytterligare. Vi söker dig som, liksom vi, brinner för att leverera lösningar som bygger på öppen källkod. Till denna tjänst söker vi både dig med lång erfarenhet av integration och dig som är ny men nyfiken på området.
   

  

**I det dagliga arbetet kommer du att:**
* Jobba med teknologier som REST, GraphQL, Kafka, Apache Camel, Kubernetes, MQTT, RAML och OpenAPI
* Implementera integrationsflöden med Open Source plattformar
* Utveckla dina kunskaper inom microservices, CI/CD, containerlösningar och molntjänster.
* Stötta kunder med utvecklingen av deras integrationsplattform och löpande säkerställa prestanda och tillgänglighet på applikationslösningarna


**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning i datateknik eller relaterat område
* Minimum 8 års erfarenhet av API-baserade integrationer och datatransformering
* Kunskap i Java eller andra Open Source relaterade verktyg
* Van att arbeta i agila team, gärna i en DevOps-setting
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska


**Meriter:**
* Erfarenhet och/eller certifiering i någon integrationsplattform
* Erfarenhet av att kommunicera direkt med verksamhetsansvariga beställare och kunder
* Erfarenhet inom cloud, säkerhet, IAM och mikrotjänstearkitektur


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Vara en del av en kultur där man varje vecka har nya interna tech talks
* Trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik och som verkligen lyssnar utvecklarna
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in seven offices with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Senior backendutvecklare .net med DevOps-ansvar
description:
**This is Everone**
 Vi är en agentur för duktiga och ambitiösa systemutvecklare. Våra utvecklare arbetar i
 **backend** 
 ,
 **fullstack** 
 ,
 **frontend** 
 och med
 **design** 
 . Med moderna plattformar och ny teknik bygger våra utvecklare digitala lösningar och innovationer för framtiden hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Vi förstår att du är grym på att koda, därför är det exakt vad du ska lägga din dyrbara tid på. Medan vi ansvarar för att förhandla ditt timpris och dina förmåner, sköta administrationen och hjälpa dig utvecklas i karriären.
   

  

**Senior backendutvecklare med DevOps-ansvar**
**Om uppdraget**
 Vi söker en självgående och erfaren
 **senior backendutvecklare med DevOps-ansvar** 
 till vår kunds förmågeområde
 *Reseplanering och bokning* 
 . Du blir en nyckelperson i teamet och kommer, tillsammans med en kollega med liknande profil, att ansvara för utvecklingen av nästa generations digitala reseupplevelse. Uppdraget omfattar bland annat vidareutveckling och modernisering av samtliga webbsajter inom kundens verksamhet, exempelvis sl.se och waxholmsbolaget.se.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett agilt team som ansvarar för förvaltning och utveckling av kundens webbplatser. Arbetet bedrivs i en modern teknikmiljö med stort fokus på testbarhet, kvalitet, prestanda och automatisering.
   

  

**Teknikmiljö**
* Backend: Mikroarkitektur i .NET
* Frontend: React i monorepo-struktur med eget komponentbibliotek baserat på Figma
* DevOps: Azure-pipelines och molntjänster
* Arbetssätt: Agila team, fokus på fristående och releasbara komponenter


**Obligatoriska krav**
 För att vara aktuell för rollen krävs att du uppfyller följande:
   

  

* Minst fem (5) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av backendutveckling.
* Minst tre (3) års erfarenhet av utveckling i .Net eller .Net Core under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst tre (3) års arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla mikrotjänster.
* Minst tre (3) års arbetslivserfarenhet under de senaste 7 åren av att utveckla med automatiserade bygg- och deployment-miljöer.
* Minst två (2) års erfarenhet av att utveckla och deploya på molntjänster i Azure inom de senaste 4 åren.
* Minst fyra (4) års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med containerteknologi (ex. Docker eller Kubernetes) under de senaste 7 åren.
* Minst två (2) års arbetslivserfarenhet av att använda enhetstester i utveckling.
* Minst två (2) års arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team med produktansvar, där erfarenheten inkluderar ansvar för leverans och uppföljning mot intern eller extern kund.
* Minst två (2) års arbetslivserfarenhet av att jobba agilt och/eller i tvärfunktionella team under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst två (2) års arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla och driftsätta lösningar som använder meddelandetjänster (ex. MQTT, RabbitMQ, Kafka, SignalR eller motsvarande).
* Minst ett (1) års arbetslivserfarenhet av att jobba med Terraform, Bicep eller liknande IaC-verktyg (Infrastructure as Code).


**Mervärdeskrav**
 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Minst ett (1) års erfarenhet av att förbättra prestanda, robusthet eller säkerhet i kod samt effektivisera integrationsflöden mellan system (ex. via API:er, meddelandetjänster eller ETL) inom de senaste 3 åren.
* Minst sex (6) månaders erfarenhet av att integrera mot EFA JourneyPlanner eller motsvarande reseplanerarsystem.
* Minst tre (3) års erfarenhet av att ha jobbat med Code Review.
* Minst två (2) års erfarenhet av att jobba med automatiserade integrationstester utöver enhetstester.


**Villkor**
**Uppdragsperiod:** 
 8 januari 2026 – 1 januari 2027
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid, ca 40 timmar/vecka
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Stockholm (Kungsholmen) med möjlighet till distansarbete enligt överenskommelse

title: IAM Saviynt Senior Developer
