You will be instrumental in designing core systems, APIs, and data flows, while contributing to the evolution of our infrastructure. You’ll collaborate across cross-functional teams to deliver robust solutions, audiovisual data processing, and modern AI/LLM systems and workflows.

### **Key Responsibilities and Qualifications**

* Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend services using one or more of: TypeScript, Node.js, PHP, and Python
* Design and build powerful REST APIs.
* Design and and take full cycle ownership of distributed microservices
* Familiarity with Generative AI technologies and Large Language Models
* Design, optimize, and manage relational and NoSQL databases including MySQL, DynamoDB, Redis, and Apache Druid
* Define and implement infrastructure as code using Terraform on AWS
* Build and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines
* 5+ years of professional software development experience
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning or similar field.
* Proven ability to work in fast-paced, cross-functional environments

### **Nice to have**

* Solid foundation in machine learning, AI, and statistical methods
* Hands-on experience deploying and managing both cloud-native and self-hosted services
* Experience with VOIP telephony stacks including Asterisk and Kamailio

**Our ways of working**
-----------------------


Each team has clear responsibilities and goals and the freedom to collaborate on the optimal design for the products and solutions we build. We want to hear your opinion!


We have an agile approach to processes and teamwork and we constantly evaluate and adapt. Our Product and UX teams are closely integrated with development. We use modern frameworks and the best tools available.


We work flexibly and have fun at work. Delivering customer value is as important as the wellbeing of our friends and colleagues. We value personal growth and encourage learning, and embrace every opportunity to share knowledge in the team.

**Where you’ll be and how you’ll work**
---------------------------------------


We have three offices: London, Uppsala and Paris. This role is based in the Uppsala office.


We work business hours, but we understand that life sometimes gets in the way.

**Kaisa Culture**


What makes Kaisa stand out? Our values, guiding us every day:

*Innovate with Agility* - We move fast, think creatively, and adapt seamlessly.

*Win Together* - Success is a team effort, and we celebrate it as one.

*Own It* - Accountability drives progress, and we take pride in our work.

*Champion Sustainability and Diversity* - We foster inclusivity and make responsible choices.

*Spread the Vibe* - A positive atmosphere fuels great ideas and connections.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
##### **Create Your Better Tomorrow**


With over 50 years of experience in the industry, Kollmorgen, a Regal Rexnord brand, is a technology leader in navigation and fleet control of automated guided vehicles (AGVs) and autonomous mobile robots (AMRs). In our continued effort to innovate and grow, we are now expanding and are seeking talents to join us and be part of our success story.


Our definition of success goes beyond customer satisfaction; it includes fostering the talent of tomorrow. At Kollmorgen, we cultivate a collaborative and inclusive environment where innovation thrives and every individual is valued. Our commitment to professional growth and development ensures that you will have the opportunity to advance your career while working on cutting-edge automation solutions.





##### **We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about making a difference in the world of AGVs and AMRs.**

##### **Position Overview**


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be part of our Engineering department, along with the other 70+ engineers working within embedded systems, system software as well as windows applications and web services.


In this position, you will be a key player in our System Commissioning team which develops tools that enable our partners to install and calibrate AGV & AMR systems at the customer sites. Your primary focus will be the development of our web & cloud-based tool, supporting tasks such as environment validation, vehicle calibration, drive path validation, and pallet positioning.


The mission of this position is to build intuitive and reliable tools that empower our partners to optimize system performance and reliability. To achieve this, you will work across the full stack, developing both frontend and backend components, from responsive user interfaces to scalable backend services and cloud integrations.

##### **Tech Stack:**

**Backend:** C# .NET 8+, ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework Core, REST API's

**Frontend:** React, TypeScript, JavaScript, Material UI

**Cloud:** Microsoft Azure (App Services, Functions, SQL, Storage, SignalR, Communication services)

##### **What does success look like in this position:**

* **High Code Quality:** Deliver clean, efficient, and well-tested code that meets functional requirements and supports continuous integration and automated testing goals.
* **Comprehensive Documentation:** Maintain detailed and up-to-date documentation for all projects, facilitating smooth onboarding and knowledge transfer.
* **Customer-Centric Delivery:** Prioritize building MVPs that deliver real value quickly, balancing technical feasibility with user needs to reduce time-to-market without sacrificing quality.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Work closely with product owners, UX designers, system architects, and other teams to align on requirements, solve integration challenges, and contribute to system-level planning.
* **Agile Leadership & Mentorship****:** Actively share knowledge, support junior engineers through pairing and code reviews, and help the team adopt agile practices that improve autonomy and delivery speed.

##### **To achieve the mission and success of this position, we believe you already have:**

* Educational background in Computer science, IT, Engineering, or equivalent;
* 10 years of experience in Software Development and/or working with AGV systems;
* Extensive knowledge in C# and .NET;
* Solid experience working with Azure cloud solutions;
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written;
* Strong collaboration and communication skills;
* Ability to anticipate, address, and solve complex problems;
* Commitment to high standards and continuous quality improvement;
* Drive to challenge the status quo to create breakthrough innovations;
* Flexibility and adaptability in changing circumstances;
* Experience working with AGVs and AMRs is considered beneficial.


We see that our ideal candidates are committed to personal & professional growth, and they share our core values and genuine enthusiasm for innovation.

  

* 

##### **Additional Information**


Full time employment | Based in Mölndal, Sweden


Selection takes place on an ongoing basis, so be sure to apply early. We're excited to hear from you!


Please submit your application in English.

##### **Kollmorgen - Autonomous Mobile Solutions**


We offer a complete automation solution for AGV and AMR providers. Our NDC Solutions platform is a proven platform that enables efficient and reliable vehicle automation with increased performance. It includes all hardware, software, and navigation technologies necessary to automate a vehicle fleet. The platform has been installed in a vast variety of material handling sites and vehicles across the globe.

title: Product Designer - Design Platform
description:
We’re looking for a Product Designer to join Spotify’s Developer Portal team. In this role, you’ll design tools and experiences that empower engineers, streamlining how they work, improving efficiency, and extending solutions that reach beyond Spotify. You’ll help shape the future of our developer platform, bringing ideas to life with thoughtful design and finding smart, practical ways to make complex engineering tools clear, intuitive, and delightful to use.
   

  

 You care deeply about product and interface design, and have experience launching real products that balance usability with strong visual craft. You thrive in cross-functional teams, collaborating closely with engineers, product managers, researchers, and data scientists, and you bring a proactive approach to solving problems and leading projects. You thrive on contributing to and scaling design systems, raising the bar for design quality across the company.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design end-to-end experiences for core plugins, tools and external-facing touchpoints of the Developer Portal.
* Help build and scale our design system (Backstage UI) to ensure consistency across tools and smooth collaboration between designers and developers.
* Work closely with product managers, engineers, researchers, and data scientists in a cross-functional team to bring ideas from concept to launch.
* Take ownership of projects with autonomy, making design decisions and solving problems proactively.
* Explore how AI can support both our design workflows and the product itself, contributing ideas and best practices.
* Partner with senior product designers to develop and improve styles and patterns.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have 4+ years of product design experience and a solid record of launching products, whether B2B or B2C. You work collaboratively with product, engineering, research, and data science partners.
* You have strong UI design skills, with great attention to detail and a solid understanding of visual design principles.
* You have experience contributing to or building design systems.
* You are confident working in cross-functional teams and quick to learn new technical domains.
* You are comfortable prototyping with Figma or AI tools, and can adapt your approach to the needs of the project.
* You apply AI thoughtfully to design experiences that make tools easier to use and workflows more effective.
* If you have experience in branding, motion design or designing for B2B products/technical platforms, that would be a bonus!


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London (UK) or Stockholm (Sweden).
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Product Designer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re looking for world-class product designers to help shape Lovable. You’ll lead projects end-to-end, collaborating closely with engineering. We expect a broad range of design skills, and exceptional taste. You’ll join a team at the forefront of AI, enabling anyone to create software.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* A track record of working in high performing, fast-paced startup environments
* A portfolio showcasing successful product work loved by users and produced in high-velocity teams
* Talent for simplifying complicated user journeys into intuitive experiences
* Strong prototyping abilities with emphasis on clear visual communication
* Fluency with design systems and technical implementations
* Outstanding command of visual design, UI patterns, and interaction principles
* High aptitude for shipping and learning extraordinarily quickly
* Bonus: You ship to production, perhaps with a little help from AI
* Bonus: Experience designing AI products


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Design Lovable, making it the most Lovable piece of software ever.
   

  

* Craft detailed user flows and high-fidelity mockups for new features
* Own design projects from conception to delivery, collaborating with engineering or ideally implementing yourself with AI (we'll train you)
* Be scrappy and hands on with any design assets needed
* Establish scalable design processes that uphold quality standards
* Champion quick wins and impactful improvements
* Contribute to improving the design quality of Lovable's AI
* Help set the bar for design quality and the culture for how design works at Lovable


**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* We'll send you a quick take-home asking to present your best work over a loom video presentation.
* Join us for a round of interviews to discuss your experience in more depth
* Join us for trial work lasting 1-2 days remote or on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**Important Note** 
 :
   

  

* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: Senior Product Designer - Stockholm
description:
**Come and build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Product Designer at Tandem, you'll be instrumental in shaping our user experience. You’ll collaborate closely with our brilliant Engineering team, and company leadership to craft intuitive, elegant, and impactful experiences.
   

  

 We’re a fast-moving team, so this role is a great fit if you thrive in ambiguity, can make progress with imperfect information, and is energized by rapid iteration. We work in short cycles: ship, learn, improve. Perfection isn’t the goal - momentum and learning are.
   

  

 What You will Do
   

  

* Lead end-to-end design work - from research and ideation to execution
* Conduct user interviews and distill insights into actionable product decisions
* Partner with engineering to ensure design aligns with technical constraints
* Share early work regularly (from sketches to prototypes) to gather feedback
* Collaborate across teams to inform design and product direction
* Contribute to product strategy while delivering polished interaction and visual design


 What You Bring
   

  

* Proven experience designing digital products with a strong user-centered focus
* Strong visual design skills and a compelling UX/UI portfolio
* Proficiency in Figma and design systems
* Experience leading user research and usability testing
* Comfort working cross-functionally and managing diverse feedback
* Ability to think strategically while sweating the design details
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and evolving problem spaces


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Experience in early-stage startups


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* First interview & Portfolio review with our Product Design Lead
* Follow up interview with our CTO and Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
📍Stockholm
   

  

 📆 As soon as possible
   

  

 👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week
   

  

 📚 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
   

  

 Are you curious to learn more about us? Read more about us here. For insights into what life is like at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
   

  

*We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.*
**What You Will Be Doing**
* Independently execute and optimise SEO tactics, ensuring they are aligned with the set strategic direction.
* Handle day-to-day operational tasks, including analysis, optimisation, and reporting, to ensure high-quality execution and optimal organic performance in standard search and search generative experiences.
* Extract and analyse data to uncover trends and insights that can guide tactical decisions and continuous improvement efforts.
* Conduct in-depth SEO analysis and audits to identify opportunities for improving brand strength and performance metrics.
* Implement testing initiatives, analyse results, and make optimisation recommendations to improve organic performance.
* Provide clients with concise, actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights, guiding strategic decisions.
* Collaborate closely with other Solution Groups to action learnings into the overall success of client experience and delivery.
* Proactively contribute to the overall growth of the SEO business.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Solid understanding of the digital marketing ecosystem, with the ability to operationally navigate all three pillars of SEO (Technical, Content & Authority) as well as AI generated search.
* Comprehensive hands-on experience and knowledge in using SEO tools & platforms (e.g. Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, or similar) to tailor SEO strategies for brand and performance objectives.
* Technical acumen to identify, mitigate and resolve SEO-related issues, ensuring smooth execution of SEO activities.
* Strong capability to analyse performance data, identify trends, and derive actionable insights to enhance SEO efforts.
* Capability to design and implement roadmaps to achieve client goals and correlated targets, as well as showcase untapped opportunities within SEO and CRO.
* Ability to develop hypotheses and conduct tests to inform continuous improvement practices.
* Effective communication skills for engaging with clients on operational aspects and contributing to strategic conversations.
* Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g. LookerStudio) and ability to present insights in an engaging and understandable manner.
* In addition to specialisation in SEO, be comfortable with CRO & UX fundamentals and how these work together to impact total website performance.


**What We Offer**
*You can read our full offering in our* 
*handbook.*
* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L2 role within the Media, Client & SEO/CRO column. Check it out!
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: Game Engineer UI/UX
description:
At Embark, we want to empower everyone to create games!
   

  

 You will be working on our live service game THE FINALS, a first-person shooter, alongside some of the most talented people in the games industry.
   

  

 As a Game Engineer UI/UX you will have a creative role, working together with designers, other engineers, artists, and user experience (UX) researchers to improve and develop new features for our game. Here you will have the opportunity to take responsibility for our game’s user interface and player experience.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who will help improve our UI framework and components with a special focus on performance, tooling and scalability.
   

  

 The game we’re making is built in Unreal, using C++, blueprints and a scripting language called Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Implement C++ UI core technology in Unreal (e.g. Slate)
* Implement UI features in Unreal Engine using a mix of C++, Angelscript and Unreal Blueprints
* Collaborate with a wide range of talents at Embark to deliver a great user experience, better tools and a performant and top of the line UI


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* 5+ years of experience working within the game industry
* A strong background in C++
* Knowledge of using Unreal Engine with Slate/UMG
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Senior Content Designer
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Senior** 
**Content Designer** 
 to join our growing team. As the second content designer at Mentimeter, you will play a big part in shaping the role, the way we work, and crafting the product experience together with your partners in Design, Product, and Engineering.
   

  

 As a Senior Content Designer, you will focus on the written aspects of our product experience using both product copy and UX design to solve user needs and achieve business goals.
   

  

* You will ship high-quality products and improvements, from early concepts to high-fidelity prototypes and visuals.
* You will help level up our writing practice by performing audits, establishing guidelines and designing content patterns that create more cohesive user experiences.
* You will build a verbal identity that builds brand through tone, and that is connected to our brand values.
* You will partner with product teams and use AI tools to build the language of AI at Mentimeter.
* You will collaborate closely with other writing functions within Marketing, Sales and Support to create aligned messaging.


 We believe strongly in the power of the empowered product team. We are building organizational processes that ensure a high level of alignment, focus on outcomes, and contextual support from leadership that enable great work to happen. As a Senior Content Designer, you will support multiple teams across the entire product experience, looking holistically at how we express ourselves, but also helping identify specific needs and initiatives.
   

  

 Who we are looking for
   

  

 To thrive in this role as a Senior content designer, we believe you are someone who loves the craft of writing, has an eye for user experiences, and can push content design at Mentimeter forward. You collaborate well with designers, researchers, engineers, and product managers. You are as passionate about crafting clear and compelling messaging as solving user needs.
   

  

 You believe in the power of experimentation and balancing gut feelings with insights. You use hypothesis writing, validation, and iteration to ensure your words deliver the right impact.
   

  

 You have a knack for thinking in systems and see consistency as a key perspective to your role. Creating patterns and guidelines is a natural part of your process. You effectively prioritize your time and continuously evaluate where you can make the most impact, and which initiatives to treat with an “80-20” mindset.
   

  

**Skills And Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in an English-speaking Content Design or UX Writing role.
* Native-level written and spoken English. You are highly skilled at turning abstract concepts into simple sentences.
* You have worked in a product company with cross-functional teams and identified ways to scale content practices across teams and areas.
* You have helped build processes and guidelines for UX writing or content design in a product context and are interested in shaping the role of content design at Mentimeter.
* You have worked with localization and translation processes, and worked in content management systems for a significant amount of time and can demonstrate your ability in these areas.
* You continuously use insights throughout the writing process to understand, ideate, and validate.
* You can lead, support, and enable others while working on complex projects across multiple teams.
* You create positive relationships and consistently show the value and impact of great content.
* You see diversity and inclusion as key aspects in both your writing and the teams you work with.


**Not Required**
* You don't have to know Swedish (daily work is carried out in English, and the Mentimeter team currently boasts over 50+ different nationalities!)


 💡Please note that you will be asked to attach your
 **portfolio** 
 as part of the application.
   

  

 📍
 **Location:** 
 Onsite, Stockholm HQ
   

  

**Not sure you meet 100% of our requirements?**
 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working on this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Campaign Manager - come and support the team in a Temporary position!
description:
We are now looking for an experienced
 **Campaign manager** 
 to join our team in Stockholm. Our current star will spend time on her very important other focus area, her family. The temporary role is for approx one year and a perfect start would be in December.
   

  

 With that said - If you've ever felt proud seeing a display campaign go live
 *exactly* 
 as planned (and maybe even told someone about it over dinner), we should talk. As a Campaign Manager at Prisjakt, you’ll be the steady hand behind our display advertising across the Nordics – making sure everything runs like clockwork while keeping both clients and colleagues in the loop.
   

  

 You’ll be the calm in the campaign chaos. From collaborating with sales and media agencies to digging into data and fine-tuning results, you’ll be the one who makes sure our clients get what they expect (and a little more). You won’t just push banners – you’ll bring heart, structure, and nerdy joy to everything you do.
   

  

**You’ll spend your time:**
* Acting as the friendly (and competent) campaign point-of-contact for clients, media agencies, and our sales team.
* Backing up sales with sharp insights, smart forecasts, and clear recommendations that make deals easier.
* Owning campaigns from end to end – setting them up, checking the specs, making sure creatives are just right, and launching on time.
* Analysing performance and sharing clear, honest feedback – what worked, what didn’t, and what we’re doing next time.
* Keeping our ad inventory working hard by planning, optimising, and making the most of every available pixel.


**We’re looking for someone who:**
* Loves structure, detail and digging into data, but doesn’t lose sight of the human on the other side of the screen.
* Can balance speed with quality and commercial priorities with user experience.
* Has experience running display campaigns, including a wide digital marketing knowledge, ideally across multiple markets or platforms.
* Communicates clearly and kindly – in meetings, over email, and when things go sideways.
* Brings their full self to work, and genuinely wants to do good stuff with good people.


**Why Prisjakt?**
 At Prisjakt, you don’t need to bring a “work persona” to the table. We believe in authenticity and that your true self is your best self. That’s why we’ve created a space where you can thrive both professionally and personally. Plus, you get two paid hours each week to focus on your health, because we believe a healthy you is a happy you.
   

  

 Want to know more? Check out our culture book and see for yourself why Prisjakt is the place where you can do your best work while being yourself.
   

  

 We would like you to start tomorrow but we understand that you have obligations today and those need to be handed over first. We will screen and meet candidates continuously so don't wait with your application.

title: Product Lead
description:
**Start date:** 
 October 2025
   

  

**Duration:** 
 10 months
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, hybrid
   

  

**Extent:** 
 Fulltime 40 hours/week
   

  

 We are currently looking for a Product Domain Lead to join our client on a temporary assignment and help drive one of their most exciting product domains forward. This role isn’t just about strategy on paper - it’s about inspiring teams, leading change, and making an impact that moves the needle for our company and our customers. Your leadership will shape how we grow, evolve, and set the standard for innovation in our business.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

 As our Product Domain Lead, you’ll be the visionary who not only defines the strategy for your domain but also sets the metrics that truly move the business forward. You’ll have the chance to inspire and grow leaders - guiding Product Managers to unlock their potential and tackle complex challenges with confidence.
   

  

 You’ll be a connector, building strong bridges across teams and functions to ensure collaboration flows seamlessly and results land with real impact. With curiosity and courage, you’ll encourage experimentation, champion data-driven decisions, and dare to push boundaries to find smarter, better ways of working.
   

  

 And through it all, you’ll keep the team focused on what matters most - clearing the path, setting priorities, and ensuring we deliver outcomes (action over perfection) that make a meaningful difference for our clients customers.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:
   

  

* Led other Product Managers (at least 3+ year in a domain-like structure)
* Navigated complexity in a product organization spanning consumer-facing and partner-led products.
* A curious and courageous leadership style, who tunes in, and thrives on inspiring change.


 It is considered meritorious if you have B2B experience.
   

  

**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
**Frontend Engineers (All-Levels)**
 We are working with an AI start-up based in Stockholm, looking for strong Frontend Engineer's in the local-area.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain high-performance features using React and TypeScript.
* Collaborate across backend, ML, design, and product teams to deliver cohesive solutions.
* Lead the end-to-end frontend process, including planning, implementation, release, and iteration.


**Ideal Background:**
* 5+ years building and shipping modern frontend products.
* Advanced React/TypeScript skills with focus on state, architecture, and performance.
* Pragmatic approach to speed vs. polish in shipping features.
* Strong eye for UX, accessibility, and usability.

title: QA Engineer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are looking for a highly skilled QA Engineer for our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Preparing test scenarios, test plans, test procedures, and test reports for various projects such as Design Center/InnerSpace, Accounts or Community
* Manual testing as well as automation testing for both UX/UI and functionality of the developed software/application to make sure requirements are met or exceeded
* Collaborating with a team consisting of PM, developers and designers


**Requirements**
* At least 5 years of experience in a QA role
* Thorough understanding of QA methodology and best practices
* Hands-on experience in writing and executing test cases and test plans
* Experience with web test automation
* Experienced in scripting languages (e.g. JavaScript / TypeScript)
* Experience with Continuous Integration tools (e.g. Jenkins/AWS Code Pipeline)
* Passionate about ensuring great UX for the customers/users of the product you work on
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Power BI
description:
Importance Is Mainly The Knowledge Of Power BI As a Service, And Concepts That Go Beyond Pure Development Of DAX, Mainly
   

  

* Data modelling principles


**Power Query**
* Parameters
* Optimizing queries
* Working with and setting up dataflows
* Governance in PBI service
* Deployment Pipelines
* Incremental refreshes
* Advanced analytics functionality
* Q&A
* Decomposition Trees
* Visual design and UX


**PowerBI Lead ideal profile (core competence needed highlighted in green)**
 This person will oversee the Real Estate Analytics Power BI app and other analytical assets, taking ownership of best practices for process setup, access management, report development, and governance. They will guide analytical efforts and collaborate with team members to ensure data-driven insights support key business initiatives.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Holistic Power BI Expertise: Act as a subject matter expert in Power BI report development, defining best practices for data ingestion, semantic model design, documentation, and DAX optimization.
* Process Development: Establish and maintain processes for governance, maintenance, and access management of analytical artifacts, including the RE Analytics App.
* Business Requirement Implementation: Serve as a 'Feature Responsible' for new initiatives within the RE Analytics workstream, translating business requirements into actionable features.
* Advanced Analytics Advisory: Provide feasibility on applied advanced analytics, assessing methodological approaches and best fit for relevant business problems.
* Team Coordination: Lead and support the efforts of Power BI developers and other analytics resources, enhancing collaboration, optimizing ways of working, and fostering skill development.
* Strategic Support: Assist the Global Analytics Manager with task definitions for varied scenarios, such as report development, exploratory analytics, causal inference modeling, etc.


**Key Skills**
**Technical Expertise in Power BI:** 
 Strong knowledge of Power BI, including experience with advanced DAX/M, data modeling, and report optimization.
   

  

**Communication and Design Skills:** 
 Strong ability to communicate output of analytical applications, including an understanding for appealing design principles and UX best practices to create user-friendly analytical artefacts.
   

  

**Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills** 
 : Strong ability to analyze data, interpret results, and apply critical thinking to assess challenges and propose solutions.
   

  

**Advanced Analytics Knowledge:** 
 Familiarity with, and experience from implementing various statistical methods to guide applied analytics and infer relevant take-aways.
   

  

**Project and Process Management** 
 : Ability to structure and drive governance, access management, and establish standardized practices relating to analytical artefacts.
   

  

**Leadership and Collaboration:** 
 Ability to coordinate team efforts, provide guidance, and drive continuous improvement across Analytics projects.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Junior/Mid Fullstack Engineer (fokus på frontend)
 



  





**Plats:** 
 Stockholm, Slussen
 



**Anställning:** 
 Heltid
 



  





**OBS! Endast anställning, ej konsultuppdrag.** 




  





 Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens mjukvara inom bokföring och redovisning?
 



 Bolaget bakom Lennart.ai och Lerry.ai söker nu en Junior/Mid Fullstack Engineer med fokus på frontend som vill bli en del av vårt core-team.
 



  





 Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta nära grundarna i ett snabbt växande bolag som siktar på att revolutionera en hel industri. Här kommer du inte bara vara en kugge i maskineriet – du kommer ha en nyckelroll i att forma produkten, teamet och vår framtida resa.
 



  





 Din roll
 


* Utveckla framtidens mjukvara inom bokföring och redovisning.
* Bidra med idéer och kreativitet kring UX/UI och produktutveckling.
* Arbeta i nära samarbete med teamet för att skapa en modern, skalbar och användarvänlig produkt.



  





 Vi tror att du
 


* Har erfarenhet av frontendutveckling (React, VueJS, Tailwind CSS).
* Har viss erfarenhet av backendprogrammering i Laravel PHP framework (LEMP stack).
* Är nyfiken på att lära dig mer och vill växa in i en roll med stort ansvar.
* Tycker att startups och produktutveckling är spännande.
* Gillar att arbeta tillsammans med andra och bidra till en stark laganda.



  





 Vi erbjuder
 


* En unik möjlighet att vara med från tidig fas i ett bolag med hög tillväxtpotential.
* Stor påverkan på produkt och teknikval.
* Arbete i en entreprenöriell miljö med korta beslutsvägar.
* Ett team där personlighet och engagemang värderas minst lika högt som din kod.

title: Senior Producer - Games
description:
Embark is hiring a Producer to join THE FINALS, our critically-acclaimed innovative online shooter. As a member of the production team, you will partner with creative stakeholders to help multiple teams deliver on their goals. You have a drive for removing obstacles, solving problems, and making sure things get done. You know that helping a team work better is a mix of high-minded organizational principles and practical compromises. And you must play games, understand games, and have a deep interest in games as an entertainment medium.
   

  

 At Embark, we believe in building teams of game makers - people who have ownership over the piece of the game they’re creating. As a Producer here, you are a safe pair of hands and the safety net below the creative and technical people who are the very best in the industry at what they do.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Be a servant leader for multiple cross-functional teams, helping them continuously improve and iterate on the game making process
* Foresee potential roadblocks in the future, proactively addressing them or bringing the right people together to address them
* Generally problem-solve with your teams to maximize the benefit to player experience within our constraints
* Manage the development process for your teams, nurturing sustainable day-to-day, sprint-to-sprint, and milestone-to-milestone rhythms of productio
* Communicate and overcommunicate with your teams, stakeholders, and external teams - horizontally, vertically, and around corners


**We would love if you have**
* 5 years of experience as a producer or team lead in the PC/console space
* Experience with live service titles and their development cadence
* Experience with the benefits and drawbacks of working with cross-functional teams
* Excellent communication skills that allow you to explain complex ideas and motivate teams through mutual understanding
* A proactive, humble, and conscientious attitude, with a high sense of ownership and autonomy
* An organized and detail-oriented mindset, the ability to thrive within ambiguity and messiness, and the patience to bring the former to tame the latter
* A lifetime of experience playing videogames and a longtime fascination with the craft of making them


*For this role we are only considering candidates already residing in Sweden.*
 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Lead Game Designer - Block Jam 3D
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position is fully remote CET ±3h or Barcelona-based.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of casual, hybrid-casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Block Jam 3D** 
**.**
 With Block Jam 3D, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are looking for a Lead Game Designer to join the Block Jam 3D team and help push our game to the next level in meta design, gameplay features, and player engagement.
   

  

 The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with top-grossing Match-3 or puzzle mobile games and a strong understanding of mechanics, systems, and hybrid F2P economies that make these games successful. You will work closely with Product, Art, and Engineering to create engaging features, refined gameplay loops, and innovative meta-systems that improve player retention, monetization, and overall fun.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Feature & System Design
+ Design new gameplay features, core loops, and meta systems to drive long-term engagement and monetization.
+ Create detailed design documents, user flows, and economy models.
+ Propose AB test ideas and iterate based on player data and feedback.

* Puzzle & Gameplay Tuning
+ Work with level designers to enhance puzzle mechanics and moment-to-moment gameplay.
+ Ensure the gameplay experience is satisfying, accessible, and monetization-friendly.

* Collaboration & Execution
+ Partner with product managers and engineers to deliver features from concept to live release.
+ Collaborate with artists to ensure UX and visuals support the intended player experience.

* Player-Centric Development
+ Analyze player behavior and KPIs to inform design decisions.
+ Proactively identify opportunities to improve retention, engagement, and IAP monetization..


 Profile
   

  

* 5+ years of professional game design experience in mobile free-to-play games.
* At least one shipped Match-3 or top puzzle mobile title with proven success.
* Strong knowledge of:
+ F2P mechanics and hybrid monetization strategies.
+ Meta systems, live ops, and long-term engagement loops.
+ Economy balancing and feature progression.

* Proficient in clear and comprehensive design documentation.
* Comfortable with data-driven decision-making and AB testing.
* Collaborative mindset with excellent communication skills.


**Nice to have**
* Experience in Puzzle games, Match 3 puzzle, Sort games…
* A degree in game design, computer science, or a related field would be beneficial.


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside

title: Lead iOS Developer
description:
Are you a passionate iOS developer eager to shape the future of equine health? Join Sleip and use your expertise to build innovative solutions that make a real impact for veterinary professionals and horse owners worldwide.
 



  





**About Sleip AB** 




 Sleip AB is a fast-growing, venture-backed startup reshaping the equine health industry with cutting-edge AI and mobile technology. We’re on a mission to deliver objective, data-driven gait analysis that transforms how equine health is managed. Headquartered in Stockholm, our innovative app has already empowered over 900 veterinary professionals worldwide, and we’re just getting started. Our leadership team – including visionary founders with deep expertise in both technology and veterinary science, and a recently appointed COO from AniCura – is committed to creating impact through relentless innovation and collaboration.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We are looking for a Senior iOS Developer to take technical ownership of our flagship iOS application. In this role, you will drive the evolution of our app by reinventing the codebase, raising the technical bar, and building new products that expand our reach. You will have the opportunity to re-architect our core app, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and lead the development of new features aimed at both veterinary professionals and horse owners. Your work will be central to supporting our growth and delivering innovative solutions as we continue to shape the future of equine health.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 As Senior iOS Developer, you will play a central role in shaping our mobile product and technical direction. Your main responsibilities include:
 


* Leading the redevelopment of our iOS codebase to enable new features and improved user experience.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions.
* Taking ownership of app performance, security, and scalability.
* Mentoring colleagues and supporting team development.
* Integrating, maintaining, profiling and optimising ML-models running on device in collaboration with ML team.



  





**Who You Are** 




 We are seeking someone who combines technical expertise with a collaborative mindset. You should have:
 


* At least 7 years of iOS development experience, with a record of leading complex projects.
* Proficiency in Swift and SwiftUI, and strong knowledge of iOS frameworks.
* Experience integrating backend APIs and optimizing app performance.
* Strong communication skills and a willingness to mentor others.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and motivated by real-world impact.
* Experience with CoreML or Vision Frameworks is a plus.



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 At Sleip AB, you’re not just coding an app—you’re shaping the future of equine health. You’ll work in an energetic, mission-driven team where your contributions directly impact how veterinary professionals care for horses worldwide. With strong backing from leading investors and strategic partners like Boehringer Ingelheim, our rapid growth trajectory means unparalleled opportunities to innovate, lead, and grow in your career.
 



  





**How to Apply** 




 If you are passionate about mobile innovation and eager to make a difference in equine health, we welcome your application. If you would like more information or have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact our recruitment consultant Mitra Frost or Elin Lidström at Novare, email: mitra.frost@novare.se / elin.lidstrom@novare.se

title: Digital kommunikatör med fokus på innehåll, sociala medier och riktad kommunikation
description:
**Om STI** 
  
 



  





 Sedan 1924 har STI – Stockholms Tekniska Institut erbjudit utbildningar inom teknik och samhällsbyggnad i nära samverkan med arbetslivet. Idag erbjuder vi YH-program och YH-kurser inom efterfrågade områden, som bidrar till hållbar utveckling och är i linje med Agenda 2030. Hos oss är utbildning praktisk från dag ett, med målet att göra verklig skillnad för både individer och samhälle. Vårt läge i Liljeholmen ger en inspirerande och modern lärmiljö för både studerande och personal. 
 



  





**Om rollen** 
  
 



  





 Vi söker en digital kommunikatör till en bred roll med fokus på innehållsproduktion, sociala medier och riktad kommunikation. 
 



  





 En viktig del i rollen är att hitta, skapa och publicera autentiska berättelser från STI:s värld (i text, bild och enklare rörligt) som engagerar och stärker relationerna med våra målgrupper. Du ansvarar för våra sociala medier, har en central redaktörsroll på webben och producerar innehåll till kampanjer och CRM-flöden. 
 



  





 Som kommunikatör blir du en nyckelperson i att utveckla och driva STI:s kommunikation framåt. Du blir både producent och projektledare i vardagen: du driver idéer till färdiga publiceringar, planerar och följer upp, och ser till att våra kanaler utvecklas. Visst stöd från externa leverantörer förekommer vid behov, men merparten av innehållet och marknadskommunikationen produceras inhouse, av dig och tillsammans med teamet. 
 



  





 Rollen innebär även att du arbetar i team med antagningsansvarig gällande kommunikationen med sökande och antagna, och är precis som marknadschef, delaktig i delar av det operativa antagningsarbetet under högsäsong. 
 



  





 Du ingår i ett litet och engagerat team på tre: marknadschef, som du rapporterar till, en kommunikationsinriktad antaganingsansvarig. Vi jobbar nära varandra, hjälps åt vid toppar och delar ambitionen att göra skillnad med vårt arbete. 
 



  
 



**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 
  
 



  




* Skapa och publicera innehåll för STI:s kanaler (artiklar, inlägg, enklare rörligt och bild)
* Driva våra sociala medier: planera, publicera, följa upp och utveckla
* Vara redaktör för sti.se med ansvar för artiklar, innehåll och utbildningssidor
* Bidra i kommunikationen med sökande och antagna: onboarding, lojalitet och förstahandsval
* Vara del av antagningsteamet under högsäsong (bedömningar, onboarding, digitala upprop m.m.)
* Producera innehåll till kampanjer och arbeta i plattformar som Meta Ads Manager
* Vara kontaktperson för samarbeten med externa aktörer



  





  
 



**Om dig** 
  
 



 Du är en vass digital kommunikatör och skribent med mycket god känsla för språk, målgrupper och tonalitet. 
 



  





 Du kan skriva texter som engagerar och bygger relationer och du gör det med noggrannhet och träffsäkerhet. 
 



  





 Du brinner för att skapa innehåll och har drivet och modet att själv fånga berättelserna där de händer, genom att skriva, fota, filma eller intervjua, och förvandla det till kommunikation. 
 



  





 Eftersom rollen är bred kan du prioritera och leverera i flera spår parallellt, utan att fastna i detaljer. Du trivs i ett sammanhang där alla bidrar utanför sin egen roll vid toppar. Även marknadschefen är kommunikatör, vilket ger dig stöd och bollplank – men också en hög ribba för kvalitet och leverans. 
 



  





**Kvalifikationer - krav:** 



* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av kommunikationsarbete, med fokus på digitala kanaler och innehållsproduktion
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att självständigt producera och publicera innehåll (text, bild, enklare rörligt)
* En skicklig skribent med vana skriva för olika externa målgrupper
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, med känsla för språk och tonalitet
* Självgående, proaktiv och leveranssäker
* Bekväm med att producera eget material och publicera i olika kanaler
* God känsla för bild, färg och form



  





**Meriterande** 
  
 


* Ansvar för och utveckling av sociala medier-kanaler
* Vana av att arbeta i CMS (t.ex. WordPress)
* Erfarenhet av CRM och riktad kommunikation (gärna Dynamics 365)
* Erfarenhet av annonsering i Meta Ads Manager/LinkedIn Campaign Manager
* Förståelse för UX, SEO och innehållsstrategi för webb



  





**Vi erbjuder** 
  
 



 Hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i ett litet och engagerat team där din insats märks. Du får arbeta med kommunikation som gör skillnad – både för människor som hittar rätt utbildning och för branscher som får den kompetens de behöver. 
 



  





 STI är en stiftelse utan vinstutdelning, vilket betyder att alla resurser går tillbaka till verksamheten och tryggar framtiden. Vi har en inkluderande arbetsmiljö och tror på balans mellan arbete och fritid. 
 



  





 Vi erbjuder: 
 



  




* Självständigt ansvar för STI:s externa kommunikation
* Variation i arbetsuppgifter och möjlighet att påverka
* En arbetsplats vid Liljeholmens galleria med flexibla tider och möjlighet till distans två dagar i veckan
* En trygg anställning i en 100-årig organisation som är mer fokuserad på framtiden än på historien



  





**Ansökan** 
  
 



 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med 6 månaders provanställning. Urval sker löpande och tillträde är snarast möjligt så skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag. Vid frågor kontakta Elin Wisbrant, marknadschef.

title: Commercial Gaming Director - Nordics
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 The Commercial Gaming Director - Nordics will be responsible for shaping and driving the gaming strategy across the Nordic region, covering Sweden, Denmark, and Finland. You will oversee a diverse portfolio of brands and work closely with a dedicated Nordic team to deliver exceptional performance and player experiences.
   

  

 The successful candidate will ensure alignment with business objectives, oversee the development and execution of engaging propositions, help design innovative promotions, and enhance the product offering to deliver a superior player experience and achieve commercial growth.
   

  

 As the key stakeholder, this role partners with internal product and gaming teams to represent the Nordic market perspective, helping to shape a customer experience that resonates locally and remains globally scalable.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

 Strategy
   

  

* Develop and implement a comprehensive local gaming strategy for the Nordic portfolio, aligned with the company's overall business goals and market positioning.
* Lead the strategic planning process for gaming initiatives, identifying opportunities for growth and differentiation.
* Continuously evaluate the competitive landscape, customer & regulatory needs, and market trends to adapt and refine the strategy as necessary.
* Define clear short-term and long-term objectives, ensuring measurable targets for success across all gaming brands.
* Collaborate with senior stakeholders to align gaming strategies with marketing, operations, and financial planning.
* Help ensure we operate sustainably within a fast moving regulatory environment


 Proposition
   

  

* Develop and own the localised gaming proposition strategy for all Nordic brands, tailoring experiences to match individual brand identities and target audiences.
* Analyse market trends, customer behavior, and competitive landscapes to define a compelling gaming proposition.
* Collaborate with marketing, operations, and product teams to ensure consistent messaging and alignment with brand values.
* Identify opportunities to expand the gaming portfolio, including new verticals, partnerships, and innovations.


 Campaigns
   

  

* Design and oversee the execution of promotional strategies that drive player acquisition, retention, and reactivation.
* Ensure promotions are innovative, data-driven, and aligned with regulatory requirements while enhancing player engagement.
* Work with CRM and analytics teams to measure promotion performance and refine strategies for maximum ROI.
* Develop campaigns that cater to various player segments, balancing mass-market appeal with personalised experiences.


 Product
   

  

* Help lead the roadmap for the gaming product portfolio across multiple brands to meet market demands and exceed customer expectations.
* Collaborate with global product teams to drive innovation in game mechanics, UX/UI, and platform features.
* Drive cross-functional efforts to ensure smooth integration of new games and features across platforms.
* Monitor and analyse key performance indicators (KPIs), using insights to optimise the gaming experience.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

* Industry Expertise: Proven tier 1 experience in a senior role within the iGaming industry, with a strong understanding of gaming propositions, promotions, and product management.
* Strategic Vision: Ability to define and execute a clear, innovative gaming strategy that aligns with brand objectives and market opportunities.
* Customer-Centric Approach: Deep understanding of player behaviour and the ability to design strategies that enhance player satisfaction and loyalty.
* Analytical Skills: Proficient in interpreting data, KPIs, and market trends to make informed decisions.
* Leadership & Collaboration: Strong leadership skills with experience managing cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration, and driving results.
* Commercial Acumen: Demonstrated ability to deliver revenue growth and profitability while managing budgets and resources effectively.
* Regulatory Knowledge: Strong Familiarity with Nordic regulations and compliance standards.


**Who We Are**
 LeoVegas Group is part of MGM Resorts International, one of the world’s leading hospitality and entertainment companies. MGM Resorts International is currently the fifth largest global gambling operator in the EGR Power 50, and combines the strength and scale of a global powerhouse with the agility and innovative spirit of a tech-driven iGaming leader.
   

  

 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

 BENEFITS:
   

  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 If you are passionate about sportsbook operations and want to play a key role in shaping the future of sports betting within LeoVegas Group, we would love to hear from you!

title: Technical Artist - Mob Control
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position is fully remote CET ±2h or Barcelona-based.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Mob Control** 
 .
   

  

 With Mob Control, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are about to make a big leap forward to push Mob Control into the next level, and you might be the chosen one, Neo.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in the upcoming evolution of Mob Control, a mobile game with over 400 million downloads.
   

  

 As a Senior Technical Artist, you’ll bridge the gap between art and engineering, designing scalable UI/UX systems, building stylized shaders, and solving creative challenges that directly impact gameplay and player experience.
   

  

 We’re looking for a hybrid profile: someone with strong artistic fundamentals and enough technical experience to bring modular, visually stunning systems to life in Unity. You’ll collaborate closely with game designers, developers, and artists in a fast-paced LiveOps environment, contributing to one of the world’s most played mobile games.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and implement modular and reusable UI/UX systems (cards, popups, banners, upgrades, etc.).
* Create custom shaders and materials (2D/3D) for characters, environments, and UI elements.
* Build tween-based animation systems and shader-based responsive feedback fx.
* Support gameplay teams with technical visual solutions and FX that enhance readability and impact.
* Develop and integrate screen-space FX and postprocessing effects for menus and gameplay.
* Contribute to VFX design for in-game actions, events, and player feedback.
* Prototype and maintain tools to streamline art production and optimize pipelines.
* Create basic 3D models or animations as placeholder content when needed.


 Profile
   

  

* 6+ years of experience in game development, ideally in mobile or stylized GaaS titles.
* Proven track record across full production cycles (from pre-production to LiveOps).
* Strong grasp of visual design principles: color, form, contrast, timing, motion.
* Solid Unity experience: uGUI, Shader Graph or Amplify, Animation and Timeline systems.
* Experience creating stylized shaders for VFX and gameplay.
* Familiarity with editor tools and custom inspectors in Unity.
* Proficiency in 2D/3D tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, Blender, or Maya.


**Nice To Have**
* Experience in high-volume LiveOps pipelines with frequent content updates.
* A strong portfolio of stylized UI/UX, VFX, or technical art systems.
* Passion for solving creative problems through smart, scalable technical workflows.


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside

title: IT-arkitekt
description:
Uppdragsbeskrivning
  
En erfaren lösningsarkitekt med god ledarskapsförmåga sökes för att driva flera parallella IT-initiativ från idé till färdig lösning. Uppdraget kräver bred teknisk kompetens, stark initiativförmåga och vana att leda arbete från behovsanalys och lösningsarkitektur till genomförande. Fokus ligger på att korta tiden från idé till hållbart resultat.
  
  

Arbetsuppgifter
  
Samordning av strategiska IT-initiativ
  
Identifiera övergripande behov och prioritera insatser.
  
Definiera omfattning och avgränsningar.
  
Ta fram och dokumentera lösningsdesign.
  
Leda interna IT-resurser och säkerställa framdrift.
  
Följa upp arbetet och rapportera status.
  
  

Stöd till IT-organisationen
  
Ge stöd i pågående tekniska förändringar inom exempelvis data- och integrationsplattformar, identitetshantering, nätverk eller IT-arbetsplatser.
  
Förbereda beslutsunderlag för teknikval.
  
Granska och verifiera lösningsförslag från leverantörer.
  
  

Stöd i projekt
  
Bidra med teknisk expertis vid kravställning, systemuppsättning och leveranskontroller.
  
Samordna tekniska projektaktiviteter med tydliga avgränsningar.
  
  

Medverkan i beslutsforum
  
Delta i möten som rör arkitektur, behov och strategiska vägval när det behövs.
  
  

Kompetenskrav
  
Minst fem års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt i komplexa IT-miljöer.
  
Akademisk utbildning inom IT, datateknik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande.
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet från minst två uppdrag inom offentlig verksamhet.
  
Erfarenhet av arbetsledning och att driva tekniska initiativ.
  
Goda kunskaper om integrationslösningar och datahantering.
  
Erfarenhet av verktyg och metoder för arkitekturanalys och dokumentation, exempelvis TOGAF eller ArchiMate.
  
Förmåga att stödja beslutsfattare i strategiska teknikval.
  
  

Meriterande
  
Erfarenhet av säkerhetslösningar och proaktivt riskarbete.
  
Certifiering inom lösningsarkitektur, till exempel TOGAF, AWS Solution Architect eller Azure Solutions Architect.
  
Kunskap om digital transformation och förändringsledning.
  
  

Övrigt
  
Uppdraget utförs huvudsakligen på plats med möjlighet till distansarbete efter överenskommelse.
  
Start snarast möjligt, inledningsvis cirka tre månaders avtal med chans till förlängning upp till två år.
  
Uppskattad omfattning cirka 450–500 timmar.
  
  

Ansökan ska innehålla CV på svenska, ifylld kompetensmatris och referenser som styrker liknande uppdrag. Urval sker löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Delprojektledare – Eftermarknad
description:
Vill du ha en nyckelroll i att säkerställa hög kundnöjdhet och kvalitet även efter leverans? Vi söker nu en strukturerad och serviceinriktad Delprojektledare med fokus på eftermarknad, som vill bidra till att hålla avancerade tekniska system i toppskick.
  
  

**OM TJÄNSTEN:**  

Som Delprojektledare inom eftermarknad får du ett helhetsansvar för reparationer och reservdelar till levererade system. Du arbetar från förfrågan och offert till färdig leverans, med fokus på att säkerställa att reparationer och reservdelar hanteras effektivt och med hög kvalitet.
  
  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter innefattar:**  

Stödja projektledare i större projekt som omfattar reparationer, reservdelar och uppgraderingar.
  
Ha internt ansvar för reparationer och reservdelsprojekt.
  
Säkerställa att tekniska frågor besvaras korrekt tillsammans med projektledare och säljteam.
  
Upprätthålla goda kundkontakter via fysiska och digitala möten.
  
Förse leveransorganisationen och produktionsplaneringen med korrekt och aktuell information.
  
Följa upp beställningar av reservdelar och reparationer så att de levereras i tid, inom budget och enligt kvalitetskrav.
  
Administrera servicerapporter, fakturering och projektdokumentation.
  
  

Arbetet är varierande – från större leveranser till enskilda enheter och både korta och längre projekt. Du arbetar nära produktion och blir en del av ett team där samarbete, öppenhet och arbetsglädje är självklara värden.
  
  

**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:**  

Har relevant utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet, exempelvis inom B2B-eftermarknad, produktionsplanering eller reparationsverksamhet.
  
Är noggrann, analytisk och har god kommunikativ förmåga.
  
Uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och ser gärna att du är:
  
  

Initiativtagande, affärsmässig och resultatorienterad
  
Självgående och målinriktad
  
Strukturerad och lösningsorienterad
  
En person som sprider positiv energi, engagerar och får andra att arbeta mot gemensamma mål
  
  

**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:**  

**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
**Placeringsort:** Järfälla (resor i tjänsten kan förekomma)
  
**Start:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Lön:** Marknadsmässig
  
**Kontaktperson:** Alice Tegebro
  
  

Tjänsten kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För vissa befattningar kan medborgarskap vara en förutsättning.
  
  

**OM FRIDAY:**  

Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter. Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag! Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.
