title: Legal Student Worker
description:
📍Stockholm
   

  

 🧑‍🎓 Handbook
   

  

 📚 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 💼 Work time is 16h/week
   

  

 Are you in your final years of your master’s degree in law and looking for a student worker role to kick start your legal career? If so, keep on reading!
   

  

 As an aspiring lawyer and student worker at Precis you will be given the opportunity to work alongside our skilled and modern legal team in an international work environment and assist with commercial legal projects spanning across our 13+ global offices.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Support our legal team with high-stakes projects related to commercial contracts, AI, privacy and marketing.
* Support with drafting, reviewing and negotiating commercial agreements and other documents related to our business.
* Conduct legal research across a variety of relevant cutting-edge areas, ranging from AI, privacy and tech law to marketing and intellectual property law.
* Communicate important updates and provide top-notch advice to other stakeholders and departments at Precis.


**What We Are Looking For**
* You are in your final year(s) of a Master of Laws (LL.M.), preferably writing your Master thesis during the spring or fall of 2026 within the areas of AI, privacy, marketing law, tech law or intellectual property law.
* You have a big interest in AI, privacy, marketing, tech and digitalisation, are highly motivated and eager to learn.
* You are curious, committed and able to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced environment where no two days are the same.
* You are fluent in written and spoken English, and any other languages are a plus.
* Based in or close to Stockholm, so that you can work alongside the legal team in our Stockholm office at least once a week.


**What We Can Offer**
* Meaningful and real assignments in a modern team at a challenger agency (unlike some other “firms out there”, we’re not looking for someone to make coffee).
* Mentorship and guidance from our small but growing legal team, including one-on-one support to help you get the most out of your time at Precis and fast track your growth.
* Opportunity to work on a variety of projects, with real impact for Precis and our advertising clients.
* First hand insights into the work of an in-house legal team to enhance your professional experience.
* We offer all our employees free snacks, coffee, tea and fruits everyday, and we open our kitchen bar with sodas and beers on Fridays for our afterworks.
* Social, diverse and open environment.


*At Precis, we are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. A diverse set of minds working in an inclusive environment leads to innovative ideas – and it is precisely these sorts of ideas that we need to keep pushing the boundaries of marketing.*
**Please send your application in English.**
**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: Underwriting Specialist - Stockholm
description:
**Be a part of the next big thing**
 Do you thrive on tackling complex challenges? Are you passionate about creating impactful solutions that drive commerce forward? Do you believe in encouraging and elevating those around you?
   

  

**About Us**
 Kustom, formerly known as Klarna Checkout (KCO), is the Nordic market leader in digital checkout solutions. Today, we support over 24,000 merchants across more than 170 countries, providing a streamlined checkout experience. We offer localized solutions in 18 markets, tailored to specific languages, currencies, and payment methods. No matter where businesses operate, we deliver a checkout experience that meets the needs of both merchants and shoppers - driving growth globally.
   

  

**The role**
 As a Merchant Credit Analyst at Kustom, you'll play a crucial role in safeguarding our merchant portfolio by conducting thorough financial analysis of our largest merchants. You'll be part of our growing risk team, helping to build and maintain robust monitoring processes as we transition our risk operations in-house.
   

  

**Things you'll be doing**
* Analyze financial statements and assess merchant financial health
* Monitor and evaluate financial trends and business sustainability of major merchants
* Manage regular financial statement collection and review processes
* Develop and implement risk assessment frameworks
* Collaborate with commercial teams while maintaining strong risk principles
* Help develop the next-generation counter-party risk monitoring framework


**Skills And Experience You'll Need**
* Strong financial analysis skills with experience in reading and interpreting financial statements
* Background in credit risk assessment, preferably from another payment service provider, fintech, or bank
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Strong communication skills to effectively convey risk decisions
* Experience with risk monitoring systems and tools


**We believe you'll thrive in this role if you have**
* High degree of integrity and the confidence to make tough decisions
* Strong sense of accountability and independence
* Initiative-taking mindset and proactive approach to problem-solving
* Ability to maintain professional judgment under pressure
* Collaborative spirit while being able to stand firm on risk decisions


**Benefits**
* Robust pension plan with national and occupational components
* Excellent health insurance coverage, including long-term illness protection and salary exchange options
* Annual wellness allowance of 3,000 SEK to invest in your health and fitness
* Extra day off when major holidays (e.g., Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve) fall on weekends
* Continuous learning opportunities and professional development support


**A place to grow**
 At Kustom, you won’t just be another face in the crowd. This is a place where we elevate each other and celebrate success as a team. We believe in our ability to create excellence - and have fun doing it!
   

  

 We know we set high expectations, but we also know that the road to success isn’t a straight line. We support and encourage each other to try, to fail, to try again. Because that’s how we grow, individually and together.
   

  

 Does this sound like the place for you?
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please apply in English. At Kustom, we welcome everyone! We don’t care where you’re from, whom you love, or what kind of food is your favorite (unless we’re celebrating together, then we’ll need to know!). We believe in inclusivity for all.
* Given the above, we treat all candidates the same! That’s why we have this awesome recruitment tool to keep track of all the amazing talents that apply - so please; apply through the system and we’ll make sure to keep you updated along the recruitment process. Please note that we can’t keep track of CVs or similar documents sent via email.
* We value your privacy! When you apply, we'll handle your data with care. Want to know more about how we use your information? Check out our FAQs at the bottom of the jobs page - we've got all the details there for you!

title: IT/OT Ingenjör inom Life Science
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Våra kunder står inför stora förändringar som drivs av nya tekniska lösningar och vi söker dig som vill vara med och göra skillnad! Just nu rekryterar vi ingenjörer som vill vara med oss på satsningen mot framtidens automation och digitalisering inom Life Science.
   

  

 Sektionen El-, Automation & Industriell IT inom affärsområdet Life Science söker nu en
 **IT/OT Ingenjör** 
 som
 **vill vara med och säkra framtidens industri inom Life Science?**
**Om rollen**
 Som IT/OT Ingenjör kommer du att vara ansvarig för att säkerställa driften och tillgängligheten av IT-system, stödja produktionsrelaterade OT-system och lösa IT-relaterade problem som påverkar tillverkningen. Du kommer att implementera och underhålla cybersäkerhetslösningar för både IT och OT, integrera dataflöden mellan IT och OT samt utveckla gränssnitt för realtidsdata. Dessutom kommer du att administrera system, felsöka incidenter och samarbeta med leverantörer vid komplexa problem. Du kommer också att driva förbättringsprojekt och introducera ny teknik där resor kan förekomma.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Teknisk utbildning på högskole-/universitetsnivå inom datavetenskap eller liknande
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom OT, gärna från läkemedelsproduktion
* God förståelse för IT/OT-konvergens och cybersäkerhet
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska (tal & skrift)


**Meriterande** 
**är:**
* Kunskap om GMP
* Erfarenhet inom Life Science, läkemedelsindustri, livsmedelsindustri, sjukvård, kärnkraft eller annan reglerad industri
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av PLC/DCS-system (t.ex. Siemens PCS7, ABB 800xA, Rockwell 5000 eller DeltaV) och/eller SCADA-system (Wonderware, WinCC, ABB)
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av ERP system (t.ex SAP, eller liknande)


**Personliga egenskaper:**
 Vi söker någon som är kommunikativ och samarbetsinriktad, med en förmåga att skapa goda relationer och samarbeta effektivt med andra. Du är strukturerad och lösningsorienterad, vilket innebär att du kan hantera utmaningar på ett metodiskt sätt och hitta kreativa lösningar. Noggrannhet och kvalitetsmedvetenhet är också centrala egenskaper, då vi värdesätter precision och hög standard i allt arbete. Slutligen har du förmågan att arbeta både självständigt och i team, vilket gör dig flexibel och anpassningsbar i olika arbetsmiljöer.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 På AFRY är vi många som är passionerade, inte bara på jobbet utan även på fritiden. Vi vill vara din ideala arbetsgivare, oavsett fas i livet, och vi förstår vikten av en balans mellan privatliv och arbete.
   

  

 Därför passar vi på att redan här nämna några av de förmåner du erhåller om du börjar hos oss:
   

  

* Fast lön och kollektivtal – Trygga komponenter som är en självklarhet för oss!
* Vidareutveckling i form av utbildningar och våra uppdrag samt genom att nätverka med våra duktiga konsulter
* Club AFRY – Vår personalklubb med möjlighet till kultur och sportevenemang, bokklubb, stuguthyrning, yoga mm.
* Friskvårdsbidrag


**Välkommen med din ansökan, sista ansökningsdag är 2025-10-16**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten?
   

  

 Välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

**Vytautas Urbikas, Sektionschef**
 Mail: vytautas.urbikas@afry.com
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Säljare
description:
brixtol textiles is a Swedish brand founded in 2011, dedicated to creating timeless,
 



 sustainable outerwear.
 



  





 Today, our collections are available worldwide through more
 



 than 150 retail partners. In 2023, we were honored with the “Sustainable identity"
 



 award at the Encouragement for Action Awards, recognizing our commitment to
 



 responsible fashion.
 



  





 Since 2024, we are proudly part of the TEXTILES & GOODS group, alongside Swedish
 



 retailer Grandpa. With our headquarters in Stockholm, we are on an exciting journey
 



 of continuous growth — and we are now looking for a passionate sales representative
 



 to join our team and be part of shaping the future of brixtol textiles.
 



  





 The role
 



 Reporting directly to the Head of sales, the sales representative plays a key role
 



 in running and developing sales at brixtol textiles, with main focus on the Swedish
 



 Market within the wholesale segment. You will be responsible of strengthening
 



 existing business relationships while simultaneously building NEW relationships and
 



 identifying potential business opportunities.
 



  





 The day-to-day work is varied, social and result-driven with a focus on long term,
 



 sustainable and profitable growth.
 



 The sales representative has a good understanding of working with building brands at
 



 the same time as building a commercially successful growth and profitable business.
 



 It lies within the sales representative’s responsibilities to acquire a solid grasp of
 



 the market, lifestyle and other factors driving customer behavior, and how to cater
 



 to their current and future needs.
 



  





 This role is based at the brixtol textiles showroom, as well as at the TEXTILES &
 



 GOODS HQ, in Stockholm, reporting to head of sales.
 



  





 Main responsibilities
 



  





 Present collections and heading up purchasing meetings and
 



 negotiations with retail-partners
 



  





 Continuously visit retailers (existing and NEW) to run clinics,
 



 activations and strengthening relationships
 



  





 Responsible for meeting set budgets (sales and gross margin) and if not
 



 suggest measures for future improvement and increased growth
 



  





 Continuously analyzing sales and presenting results
 



  





 Attending tradeshows, fashion-shows and other important industry
 



 events
 



  





 Who are we looking for
 



  





 Someone who has at least 1 year prior experience from working as a
 



 Sales Rep within Swedish Wholesale
 



  





 Is fluid in both Swedish and English, verbal and written
 



  





 Has a drivers licence and is willing/wants to travel and sees this as
 



 something motivating
 



  





 Self-motivated, structured and analytical but also social, fun-loving
 



 and great at building relationships
 



  





 Is motivated by building networks, growing sales and building things
 



 longterm!

title: Senior och Junior Biologer – Nulägesanalys biologisk mångfald
description:
**"Vi söker talanger – bli en del av VIPAS AB"**
 "Är du en driven IT-professionell som vill utvecklas i en dynamisk konsultmiljö? Bli en del av VIPAS AB och arbeta med projekt som utmanar och inspirerar."
   

  

**Vår Verksamhet**
 "Vi på VIPAS AB kombinerar teknisk expertis med affärsfokus för att leverera lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Genom modern teknik som Java och Python och med vår erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling och DevOps skapar vi innovativa, skalbara lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att nå sina mål."
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Trafikförvaltningen ansvarar för en hållbar, säker och pålitlig kollektivtrafik i Region Stockholm. Som del i detta arbete behöver vi genomföra en nulägesanalys av den biologiska mångfalden inom och i anslutning till våra fastigheter. Fokus ligger på inventering av invasiva arter och värdefulla naturmiljöer, framför allt i miljöer nära trafikspår såsom banvallar och depåer.
   

  

 Resultaten ska bidra till en långsiktig planering för skötsel, förvaltning och bekämpning där så krävs. Uppdraget påbörjas snarast och leverans av slutrapport ska ske senast december 2025.
   

  

**Roller och ansvarsområden**
**Senior Biolog (1 konsult)**
* Leder och planerar inventeringsarbetet
* Kvalitetssäkrar leveranser och metodik
* Deltar i möten med Trafikförvaltningen och ansvarar för granskning


**Junior Biolog (2–5 konsulter)**
* Genomför huvuddelen av fältinventeringen
* Dokumenterar och skriver rapporter
* Deltar vid behov i möten


**Leveranser**
* Skriftlig rapport med beskrivning av metod och resultat
* Kartor i PDF- och GIS-format (Shape, GeoPackage eller motsvarande)
* Data som kan integreras i BESTA för framtida förvaltnings- och skötselplaner


**Kvalifikationer**
**Obligatoriskt:**
* Relevant akademisk bakgrund inom biologi eller närliggande område
* Erfarenhet av artinventering, gärna med fokus på invasiva arter
* God förmåga att dokumentera och rapportera på svenska
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet från inventering i spårmiljö eller motsvarande
* GIS-kompetens (framtagning av kartor och artdata)
* Kännedom om regionala eller nationella förvaltningsplaner för biologisk mångfald


**"Bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team"**
 "På VIPAS AB värdesätter vi drivna och engagerade medarbetare. Vi erbjuder attraktiva villkor och en arbetsmiljö som främjar kompetensutveckling och karriärtillväxt. Hos oss får du arbeta med spännande projekt inom flera branscher och bidra till banbrytande IT-lösningar tillsammans med ett erfarent och innovativt team."
   

  

**"Vi vill höra från dig"**
 "Tveka inte – skicka din ansökan till
 **pooja@vipas.se** 
 och upptäck möjligheterna hos VIPAS AB."
   

  

**Behörighet för ansökan :-** 
 "För att kunna ansöka krävs svenskt medborgarskap eller ett giltigt arbetstillstånd för Sverige."
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 "Intresserade kandidater uppmanas att skicka in CV och personligt brev. Observera att rekryteringen sker löpande, vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum."

title: GTM Director, EMEA
description:
**About Legora**
 Legora is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $35+M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Legora is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a high-impact
 **GTM Director** 
 to lead our EMEA sales organisation through its next phase of growth. This is a second-line leadership position, reporting to the VP of Growth, EMEA. You’ll be responsible for scaling a high-performing sales organisation, coaching Team Leaders into world-class managers, and driving consistent execution across the region.
   

  

 You’ll own revenue delivery, talent development, and scalable processes — while also representing Legora at the executive level in high-stakes customer conversations with some of the world’s premier law firms and enterprise legal teams.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

***Leadership & Talent Development***
* Manage and coach Team Leaders, developing them into world-class sales managers.
* Build a culture of accountability, collaboration, and excellence.
* Recruit, onboard, and retain top sales talent across the region.


***Revenue & Pipeline Management***
* Own EMEA revenue targets with accurate forecasting.
* Run pipeline and deal reviews to ensure quality, velocity, and disciplined execution (MEDDPIC).


***Process & Execution***
* Define and enforce scalable sales processes that drive efficiency and win rates.
* Partner with RevOps on systems, metrics, and dashboards to enable performance.
* Champion operational excellence in forecasting, territory planning, and account prioritisation.


***Executive Engagement***
* Represent Legora in strategic meetings with C-suite and Managing Partners at top-tier law firms and corporates.
* Support AEs in high-stakes deals, adding credibility without displacing the deal owner.
* Influence internal stakeholders to secure resources, remove blockers, and accelerate growth.


***Communication & Collaboration***
* Act as the voice of the EMEA sales organisation internally.
* Partner closely with Marketing, Product, Legal Engineering and Customer Success to align GTM strategy.


 What You Bring
   

  

* 8+ years in B2B SaaS sales leadership, including 3+ years in second-line management.
* Proven track record of scaling high-performing teams across EMEA.
* Strong ability to recruit, coach, and retain A+ sales talent.
* Experience with complex, enterprise-level sales cycles (legal or other regulated industries a plus).
* Operational excellence in pipeline management, forecasting, and structured execution (MEDDPIC a strong plus).
* Executive presence with credibility to engage senior stakeholders externally and internally.
* A growth mindset: comfortable with ambiguity, fast-moving environments, and cross-functional collaboration.


 What We Offer
   

  

* The opportunity to lead and scale our EMEA sales org at a hypergrowth AI company redefining legal tech.
* Fast-track career growth with direct impact and senior-level visibility.
* Competitive compensation with high-upside equity.


 Ready To Join?
   

  

 If you are passionate about driving GTM results in the legal tech space, ready to thrive in a fast-paced and supportive environment, and motivated by Legora’s mission, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Third Party Risk Manager
description:
As we expand our Vendor Management & Outsourcing team, we’re looking for a new colleague to join NOBA in the role of Third Party Risk Manager!
   

  

**What We Will Offer To You**
 A key role in a growing function with evolving responsibilities and a place in a collaborative and driven team. Here, you will get the opportunity to contribute to the implementation of high-impact regulatory processes in a flexible workplace and a hybrid work setup and that values an open, supportive culture focused on development and ownership.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will join a team consisting of five highly skilled colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences. You will assess, manage and monitor risks together with our Manager DORA Third Party & Outsourcing. These risks are related to third-party vendors, service providers and outsourced partners.
   

  

 In providing support to contract owners and facilitating efficient and streamlined processes, you will play a key role in protecting the organization from regulatory, operational, and reputational risks associated with external relationships.
   

  

**In More Detail, Your Areas Of Responsibility Will Include**
* Support and drive our Third-Party Risk Management (TPRM) program throughout the entire vendor lifecycle
* Support in due diligence and risk assessments for new and existing third-party relationships
* Monitor performance and compliance of critical vendors, including SLAs, KPIs, and risk metrics
* Partner with Legal, Risk, Compliance and Procurement to review and strengthen contract terms related to data security, operational resilience, and audit rights
* Stay updated with financial services regulations such as EBA Outsourcing and DORA and ensure our program is compliant
* Support in internal and external audits related to third-party risk
* Collaborate across teams including IT Security, Legal, Risk, Compliance, and IT to ensure holistic vendor oversight
* Support in the regular reporting to senior leadership and risk committees.


**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
* 2+ years of experience in third-party/vendor risk management, operational risk, or compliance
* Solid understanding of regulatory requirements in financial services (e.g., EBA Guidelines, DORA ICT)
* Very good communication skills in English
* An academic degree within relevant field.


 It is a plus if you have
   

  

* Experience from banking, fintech, or insurance
* Experience working with formal outsourcing governance and reporting to supervisory authorities.
* Good communication skills in Swedish and/or the Norwegian languauge


**To thrive in this role, we also believe you’re someone who**
 Communicates clearly and builds strong collaborations across teams. You enjoy diving into complex information, spotting patterns, and navigating a dynamic vendor landscape with an analytical mindset. A structured way of working comes naturally to you - you value clarity, consistency, and accuracy in both documentation and process development. While you're a team player, you're also proactive and confident in taking ownership and driving your work forward independently.
   

  

 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data here.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: Founding Full-Stack Engineer- Equity-Only | Stockholm-Based (Kista & Epicenter) | Mission-Driven Tech for Good
description:
Founding Full-Stack Engineer- Equity-Only | Stockholm-Based (Kista & Epicenter) | Mission-Driven Tech for Good
   


 Who We Are
 
  





 At
 **After Class** 
 , we’re rethinking what after-school life can look like.
 



 We’re on a mission to make after-school experiences more
 **creative, inclusive, and accessible** 
 for youth across Sweden.
 



  





 Our platform connects families to enriching activities and empowers providers with the tools they need to grow. We’re building a community that helps young people thrive
 **offline** 
 in dance studios, art rooms, sports fields, and leadership spaces.
 



  





 We're merging
 **tech + purpose** 
 to create a future where every kid can explore, grow, and connect no matter their background.
 



  





 We’re
 **early-stage, mission-led, and moving fast.** 
 Backed by users, partners, and real momentum, we’re now looking for a
 **real builder** 
 to join us at ground level.
 



  




 Who You Are
 
  





 We're looking for a
 **founding full-stack engineer** 
 who’s not afraid to build from scratch, shape what the product becomes, and go all-in on something meaningful.
 



  





 You thrive in the startup space. You love shipping fast. And you’ve got the
 **grit, determination, and clarity** 
 to drive things forward even when it’s messy.
 



  





 You’re a
 **problem solver** 
 , a
 **product thinker** 
 , and a
 **hands-on architect** 
 .
 



 You don’t wait for permission to lead
 **you’re already doing it.** 




  





 Now you’re ready to do it on something that actually matters.
 



  





 This is an
 **equity-only role (for now)** 
 . We care
 **less about how many years of experience** 
 you have and more about what you can actually build.
 



  





 That means we’re not offering a salary
 **we’re offering ownership** 
 .
 



 We’re betting on this mission and we want someone who’s ready to
 **bet on themselves too** 
 .
 



  




 What You’ll Do
 
  





 (This is a
 **backend-heavy** 
 role with full-stack touchpoints.)
 


* Develop and maintain our internal admin and activity provider dashboards
* Build clean, efficient, and scalable backend services
* Own secure user authentication and role-based access
* Integrate third-party services (Firebase, Stripe, etc.)
* Work closely with mobile and design to ensure a seamless product experience
* Set up and manage CI/CD pipelines, testing, and deployments
* Contribute to UX improvements and frontend flows as needed
* Collaborate with the founding team on product decisions and technical roadmap


- 

 What We’re Working With
 * **Node.js**
* **MongoDB**
* **React.js**
* **TypeScript / JavaScript**
* **Firebase** 
 (Auth, Firestore)
* **Stripe** 
 (for payments)
* **REST APIs**
* **Git + CI/CD pipelines**



  




 You Should Be:
 
  




* Confident owning both backend and frontend codebases
* Strong in backend architecture, logic, and performance
* A clear, proactive communicator who thrives in a lean, collaborative team
* Able to independently manage your time and deliver on priorities
* Based in
 **Stockholm** 
 —
 **workspace access in Kista & Epicenter** 
 , WFH-friendly but available for in-person collaboration when needed


- 

 Why Join Us?
 
 🛠️ Workspace in
 **Kista & Epicenter** 




 🕒 Flexible hours
 



 💸
 **Equity-based** 
 (this is a
 **founder-level** 
 role)
 



 🧠 You own your work and help shape the product
 



 🌍 You’re building something real for real people
 



  





 Ready to help us
 **digitize the after-school experience** 
 ?
 



 We’re building for scale, for impact, and for good.
 



 Apply today

title: Databasspecialist till Must
description:
**Vill du ha ett meningsfullt arbete och bidra till ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld?**
 Det förändrade omvärldsläget medför att vårt försvar behöver förstärkas och den ökade underrättelseverksamheten mot Sverige och Försvarsmakten är omfattande. Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) bedriver försvarsunderrättelseverksamhet och militär underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänst till stöd för svensk utrikes-, försvars- och säkerhetspolitik samt i övrigt för kartläggning av yttre hot mot Sverige.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder ett viktigt och stimulerande arbete där du dagligen bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet. Vi erbjuder också mycket goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Hos oss finns det friskvårdsmöjligheter som inkluderar träning tre timmar i veckan på arbetstid samt möjlighet att ha balans mellan fritid och arbete.
   

  

**Om enheten**
 Enhetens uppgift är att utveckla säkerhetsrelaterad mjukvara (applikationer). Detta inkluderar att säkerställa nödvändiga förutsättningar så som vidmakthålla samt vidareutveckla våra databashanteringssystem, effektiv testverksamhet, framåtsträvande metodutveckling, kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, samt ändamålsenliga arbetssätt och samarbetsformer som stödjer både verksamhet och medarbetare.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Vi står inför stora förändringsprojekt vilket stället höga krav på din initiativförmåga samtidigt som det ger dig möjligheten att utvecklas och genom din insats bidra till hela Försvarsmaktens verksamhet. Du kommer ha det lösningsmässiga ansvaret inom dina områden och har som främsta uppgift att säkerställa att systemet kan förvaltas långsiktigt. Du bedömer systemets påverkan i ärenden och rekommenderar ändringar till planer, prioritering och omfattning av vidmakthållande. Allt detta i nära samarbete med kärnverksamheten så att det vi levererar blir precis vad Försvarsmakten behöver. På grund av verksamhetens säkerhetskrav krävs att arbetet utförs på plats. Beredskapstjänstgöring och resor kan förekomma.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som databasadministratör
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Linux/Unix-operativsystem
* Goda kunskaper inom T-SQL
* Djupgående kunskap i databashanteringssystem
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


**Meriterande**
* Högskoleexamen inom systemvetenskap eller annan för tjänsten relevant högskoleutbildning
* Erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med IT-infrastruktur från Försvarsmakten eller annan myndighet inom totalförsvaret
* Erfarenhet av databasreplikering
* Erfarenhet av Sybase SQL Server (SAP ASE)


**Personliga egenskaper** 
 Våra medarbetare har olika bakgrund men med ett gemensamt intresse och kunskap inom IT. Som person ser vi att du är kommunikativ, ödmjuk och prestigelös samt skapar tillit i arbetsgrupper och bland medarbetare. Du är bra på att fånga upp drivkrafter och därigenom skapa hög motivation hos dina kollegor. Du trivs med att arbeta självständigt men även med att i team anta utmaningar och finna lösningar. Du har förmåga att proaktivt identifiera förbättringsmöjligheter och implementera effektiva lösningar. Det är också viktigt att vara flexibel för att kunna hantera förändrade förutsättningar samtidigt som ditt arbetssätt präglas av struktur och noggrannhet.
   

  

 Som person är du trygg i dig själv, med stor integritet och är naturligt säkerhetsmedveten. Du är en nyfiken och kreativ person som kan uppnå ett stort förtroende hos våra uppdragsgivare. Du har ett starkt driv toppat med mycket tålamod.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Ovan ställda kvalifikationer ska på begäran kunna verifieras genom intyg, referenser samt arbets- eller urvalstester.
   

  

*För att myndighetens uppdrag ska vara framgångsrikt förutsätts att alla medarbetare uppträder enligt den värdegrund som finns. Försvarsmaktens värdegrund slår vakt om alla människors lika värde, rättvisa och jämlikhet och främjar demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter (läs mer på www.forsvarsmakten.se).*
**Övrigt** 
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med provanställning om sex månader
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

**För upplysningar om befattningen eller rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**
 hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se, vänligen skriv ”Databasspecialist” i ämnesraden.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Fackliga representanter nås via hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se
   

  

*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-10-14. Löpande urval kan förekomma. I urvalsfrågorna, ditt CV och personliga brev vill vi att du beskriver på vilket sätt du uppfyller våra efterfrågade krav och meriter. Du ansöker via* 
*jobb.forsvarsmakten.se*
 ,
 **Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) är en del av Försvarsmaktens högkvarter i Stockholm. Vi ger regeringen och Försvarsmakten kvalificerade beslutsunderlag om omvärldsutvecklingen och hot mot Sveriges och Försvarsmaktens säkerhet. Vår vision är ”Ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld”. Must är en kunskapsorganisation och erbjuder både spännande och för Sverige angelägna arbetsuppgifter. Här arbetar både officerare och civila experter inom olika områden, t ex statsvetenskap, IT, ekonomi, teknik, matematik och HR. En stor del av Must verksamhet omfattas av sekretess och vi ber dig därför att inte berätta att du sökt jobb hos Must för andra personer än dina närmaste. Läs gärna mer om Must och vår verksamhet här Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Public Policy Manager, Nordics
description:
We are looking for a Public Policy Manager to spearhead our regulatory and policy initiatives within the Nordics.
   

  

**About Us**
 With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.
   

  

 We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or disability.
   

  

 Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!
   

  

**About The Role**
 Bolt is leading the charge in transforming urban mobility across the Nordics. This crucial role involves managing regulatory challenges, forging strong relationships with stakeholders, and ensuring compliance to support Bolt's strategic objectives. The Public Policy Manager will play a pivotal role in navigating the regulatory landscape and influencing policy to facilitate Bolt's growth and operational success.
   

  

**Main tasks and responsibilities:**
* Oversee Bolt’s regulatory, compliance, and political communications strategies in the Nordics, aligning them with Bolt's operational goals and urban mobility mission.
* Provide expert regulatory guidance and compliance oversight to Bolt's commercial teams, transforming complex legislation into actionable strategies for business growth.
* Build and maintain influential relationships with stakeholders such as regulators, political figures, and business partners to advocate for favorable policies and ensure compliance.
* Manage Bolt's licensing requirements through regular compliance audits and the acquisition of new licenses to ensure uninterrupted operations.
* Collaborate with Bolt's commercial and product teams to create and implement strategic plans that address the unique challenges and opportunities in the Nordic markets.
* Direct Bolt’s public relations efforts, managing media inquiries and corporate communications to maintain a positive public image and align with corporate objectives.


**About you:**
* You have at least 3 years of experience in legal, compliance, public policy, or regulatory roles.
* You have a good understanding of the Nordic countries' regulatory and licensing landscape/ Experience in mobility and transport services would be a plus.
* You have a track record in developing and executing public policy strategies and managing corporate communications within a regulatory environment.
* You possess excellent communication skills, able to clearly and persuasively articulate complex regulatory issues to diverse audiences; fluency in English and proficiency in other local languages are highly regarded.
* You have built strong relationships with governmental and regulatory bodies, securing cooperation and advocacy for organizational objectives.


 Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying!
   

  

**Why you’ll love it here:**
* Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
* Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
* Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
* Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
* Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
* Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 2 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.
* Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
* Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.

title: Teknisk affärsutvecklare
description:
Teknisk affärsutvecklare med språkkunskaper till Stockholm
   

  

 Har du en teknisk bakgrund, ett affärsdriv och gillar att bygga relationer över landsgränser? Då kan du vara rätt person för rollen som teknisk affärsutvecklare på Subec!
   

  

 Vi söker dig som både förstår teknik och talar flera språk – svenska i kombination med tyska, franska, spanska eller andra större språk då du kommer att bli en nyckelspelare i vår internationella expansion.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som teknisk affärsutvecklare hos oss arbetar du nära våra kunder inom kabel-, tråd- och plastindustrin i över 55 länder. Du ansvarar för hela säljprocessen – från behovsanalys till offert och lösning – med stöd från våra erfarna projektledare och konstruktörer.
   

  

 Dina kunder finns bland annat i Tyskland, Österrike, Schweiz, USA, Frankrike och Italien. Internationella resor är en naturlig del av rollen och bidrar till starkare relationer och djupare processförståelse.
   

  

**Vad har Jonathan Lundsjö, Product Manager, att säga om tjänsten och företaget?**
*"Min bakgrund är inom maskinteknik och ledarskap, med 6 års erfarenhet inom kabel-, tråd- och rörbranschen. Jag har haft roller inom produktdesign, maskinbyggande och tekniskt sälj. Som Product Manager på Subec har jag varit involverad i projekt globalt i 2 år, från idé till konstruktion, tillverkning och driftsättning.*
*Subec erbjuder frihet under ansvar och möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling. Vi värdesätter en trivsam arbetsmiljö och balans i arbetslivet. Jag hoppas att min blivande kollega delar mitt intresse för teknik och utveckling, och att vi kan sporra varandra i Subecs produktutveckling. En egen drivkraft och glimten i ögat i en snabb arbetsmiljö är uppskattat.*
*Det mest stimulerande med jobbet är att arbeta i ett mindre bolag med korta beslutsvägar, samtidigt som man hanterar globala projekt. Möjligheten att resa och arbeta med kunder runt om i världen är spännande, och att arbeta med ett sammansvetsat team av kollegor är en bonus."*
**Vi söker dig som har**
* Teknisk utbildning eller erfarenhet från industrin
* Erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, samt ett av följande språk: tyska, franska, spanska eller annat världsspråk
* Förmåga att skapa långsiktiga relationer
* God IT-vana
* Körkort


 Som teknisk affärsutvecklare utgår du från vårt kontor i Sickla, Stockholm, men samtidigt är världen din arbetsplats. Hos Subec får du arbeta i en liten och snabbfotad organisation med högt i tak, mycket frihet och nära samarbeten.
   

  

**Kontakt och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Säljpoolens rekryteringskonsult Christopher Thorstrand. Du når Christopher på 08-51481641.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan via ansökningsknappen. Vi arbetar med löpande urval under denna rekrytering, vi vill därför gärna ha in din ansökan snarast möjligt.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Partner Growth Specialist - Stockholm
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett globalt snabbväxande företag med världens största plattform för matsvinn?Är du en fena på att knyta kontakter och drivs av att identifiera strategiska möjligheter med fokus på tillväxt?Vi letar nu efter en driven och engagerad Partner Growth Specialist.
   

  

 På Too Good To Go drömmer vi om en planet utan matsvinn.
   

  

 Som världens största app för att bekämpa matsvinn kopplar vi ihop butiker, caféer och restauranger som har osåld överskottsmat med kunder som köper och njuter av den.
   

  

 Vi är stolta över vad vi har uppnått hittills, och i Sverige är vi bara i början av vår resa.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Partner Growth Specialist som med starkt driv optimerar partnerskap och skapar ömsesidigt värde genom att förstå vad våra partners behöver för att bli framgångsrika. Du kommer att ingå i vårt Independent sales team och rapportera till Head of Independent Partners.
   

  

**Din Uppgift**
 Som Partner Growth Specialist kommer du vara en nyckelperson i vårt svenska Independent Partners-team. Du kommer säkerställa att våra partners har allt de behöver för att lyckas, samtidigt som du arbetar strategiskt för att optimera bibehållandet av våra partners, tillgången av överraskningskassar i appen och förbättra prestationer. I denna roll är du en viktig “röst för våra partners” – du förstår deras behov och motivation och gör vad du kan för att öka deras positiva inverkan med TGTG, samt analysera data för att identifiera möjligheter till optimering och problem som behöver lösas.
   

  

**Du Kommer Att**
* Ha en portfölj med ca 1 000 oberoende partners som du proaktivt kontaktar, samt hanterar inkommande frågor via e-post och telefon.
* Arbeta nära våra partners för att lösa problem och säkerställa att så mycket mat som möjligt räddas genom optimerad prissättning.
* Analysera butikernas prestationer och föreslå förbättringar.
* Identifiera risker för churn och möjligheter för att bredda utbudet tillsammans med partners, samt planera för bästa förhållningssätt och implementera dessa.
* Tydligt kommunicera till våra partners, på ett sätt som är i linje med vår varumärkestonalitet.
* Utveckla djup kunskap om hur Too Good To Go fungerar och använda denna expertis för att stödja det interna teamet.


**Vi Tror Att Du**
* Har erfarenhet från en kundnära roll, som kundservice, försäljning eller partneransvar. Trivs med att arbeta mot mål och KPI:er. Är en van kommunikatör som snabbt och effektivt kan skapa kontakt med partners över telefon – att prata i telefon ger dig energi!
* Är en problemlösare som använder data och analys för att hitta möjligheter.
* Har utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga; du är tydlig och vänlig i konversationer eller e-post med partners. Har starka interpersonella och kommunikativa färdigheter.
* Är empatisk och tålmodig. Har systemvana som tex google suite och CRM-verktyg.
* Är självständig och ansvarstagande och att du kan planera din tid och hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt.
* Är positiv och har en proaktiv attityd, redo att anpassa dig till en snabbt växande organisation och ta initiativ.
* Är en lagspelare som vill lära sig, samarbeta och bidra med idéer.


**Våra Värderingar**
* We Win Together
* We Raise the Bar
* We Keep It Simple
* We Build A Legacy
* We Care


**Det Vi Erbjuder**
* En unik möjlighet att arbeta i ett snabbt växande företag, med världens största marknadsplats för matöverskott (certifierat B Corporation!) där du varje dag kan känna att du gör en positiv skillnad.
* Erfarenhet av att vara del av ett internationellt företag med talangfulla kollegor i många länder – alltid redo att dela kunskap och ge stöd!
* Stark personlig och professionell utveckling i en intensiv och snabbväxande scale-up-miljö.
* En öppen företagskultur där du har frihet och utrymme att släppa lös din kreativitet. En stark teamkultur där framgångar firas tillsammans.
* Grundlön + attraktiv bonus.
* 25 + 5 dagars betald semester utöver helgdagar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag


**Hur Du Ansöker**
 Vi tar rekryteringen på största allvar, så läs noga igenom allt ovan. Kolla gärna också vår hemsida och internationella medier för att få en bra översikt av Too Good To Go.
   

  

 Skicka ditt CV och personliga brev på svenska. Observera att vi endast accepterar ansökningar via vår plattform. CV eller personliga brev via e-post eller LinkedIn-meddelanden accepteras inte.
   

  

*A Movement for Everyone*
*We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.*
*We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.*

title: Product Developer FW
description:
Are you a dynamic and experienced Product Developer FW with a passion for collaborating towards success in a high-tech, innovative environment? Join our R&D department at ASSA ABLOY Opening Solutions, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Product Developer FW**
 You would be involved in the development and maintenance of the ARX security system, ensuring it remains at the forefront of high-security solutions. You would play a key role in developing software for embedded systems, from initial design to implementation, testing, maintenance and continuous improvements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Write and maintain software in C for embedded Linux systems, contributing to the development of new features, enhancements, and system maintenance.
* Work closely with other software developers and testers to ensure the success of the project and alignment with stakeholders.
* Contribute to design documentation, including creating and reviewing design proposals and ensuring that the development process adheres to standards.
* Utilize Python for testing tools and troubleshooting embedded systems to ensure high quality and efficiency.
* Drive improvements in the system, ensuring maintainability and performance optimization for embedded devices.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Proven hands-on experience in embedded software development using C in a Linux environment.
* Strong knowledge of system design, design documentation, and software testing.
* Familiarity with tools like JIRA, GitLab, and Confluence; knowledge in Python coding, TCP/UDP protocol and basic electronics is additionally valued.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a structured, analytical manner.


 We are looking for someone with strong communication skills who can collaborate effectively across teams and stakeholders. You are a natural team player who enjoys sharing knowledge and supporting colleagues, while also being proactive and self-driven with a “can-do” attitude. A structured and organized way of working helps you manage multiple tasks and keep projects on track. At the same time, you are open-minded and adaptable, thriving in a dynamic environment where priorities can change quickly.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* We offer a flexible hybrid working model, with 2–3 days per week in the office.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be subjected to a background screening. The performance of the background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
*Stories have the power to make the ordinary extraordinary. They help us think bigger, see beyond ourselves, and deepen our connection with others.* 




  





*As one of the world’s leading audiobook and e-book streaming platforms, Storytel brings unlimited listening to millions of users across 25 markets. Driven by our purpose, “Leading the future of storytelling, we move the world through stories”, Storytel Group inspires and entertains people around the world by blending innovation with tradition. We bring stories to life across various formats for everyone to discover. Anytime. Anywhere.* 




  





 Ready for your next chapter? We’re looking for a
 **Senior Backend Engineer** 
 to join our Content Platform team!
 



  





**About the Team** 




 The Content Platform domain is the backbone of Storytel, ingesting and processing all content from publishers to the platform, enriching it with metadata, and building systems that organize knowledge about creators and content. Over three million audiobooks, ebooks, and podcasts flow through our processing pipeline and are made available to other teams via APIs and event streams.
 



  





 The domain mission is to be a key driver for Storytel’s product and commercial strategy by making book metadata a competitive advantage for Storytel. The team leverages AI and automation to scale the creation and enhancement of book metadata, fueling product innovation and unlocking the full potential of generative AI-powered experiences.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 Take the next step in your career as a Senior Backend Engineer at Storytel! You’ll work with cutting-edge technologies alongside other experienced colleagues. As a senior backend engineer, you’ll be involved in – and be asked to lead some of – our modernisation journey, but also the maintenance of the existing platform. Your skills and experience will also be valuable in supporting and coaching more junior engineers.
 



  





**About You** 




***To be a good match for this role, we believe that you have:***



* Solid knowledge of backend development in
 *Java* 
 , and experience of more polyglot environments – today we maintain services in mostly Java, but even some in
 *Golang* 
 ,
 *Kotlin,* 
 and
 *C#* 
 .
* A great understanding of modern architecture, system design, data structures, and software engineering principles, and knowing how to apply them to design scalable and robust solutions.
* Experience with deploying and operating services in a cloud environment (we use
 *Google Cloud Platform* 
 , but experience from other platforms is just as valuable).
* A curious and positive mindset about the potential of LLMs, both as a tool to enhance your own workflow and as a component for building innovative product features.
* Experience working closely with business and product stakeholders, and understanding their needs. You can transition from the idea stage to scalable and maintainable solutions.
* Passion for building great products that people love, always making technology choices with this end goal in mind.



  





 But most importantly, we believe that the right mindset and attitude are more valuable than ticking all the technical boxes, so if you feel that this could be the right job and environment for you to learn and develop yourself, alongside others in the team, do not hesitate to get in touch with us!
 



  





**Join a world of stories** 




 At Storytel, we’re a team of creative story lovers who thrive on collaboration and new ideas. Our workplace is friendly, dynamic, and full of opportunities to experiment and make an impact. We believe in trust, flat hierarchies, and empowering you to grow with us.
 



  





 Does this sound like your next story? Simply fill out the application form and share your CV or LinkedIn profile – no cover letter needed. Answer a few questions, and you’re all set.

title: MAX are looking for new co-workers!
description:
*MAX is not only Sweden’s favourite burger restaurant chain, it is also one of the first. Back in 1968 the founders of MAX, Curt Bergfors and Britta Andersson, opened their first restaurant in Gällivare, high up in the northern parts of Sweden. Today we are more than 5000 employees in several countries and we are constantly growing.*
 Aiming for a career within the fast food business? Looking for additional income during your studies? Either way we might have the right opportunity for you!
   

  

 All people are equal! To us that means equal opportunities, rights and obligations no matter who you are. The only limit is your own goals and results. We will guide you through with a clear plan, internal training and great opportunities to grow and develop with Sweden’s tastiest burger chain.
   

  

 Your job at the restaurant will include to serve our guests, prepare the food and make sure the restaurant is clean and tidy at all times. The main goal is to provide Sweden’s tastiest burgers, every day. The working hours will vary from daytime, evenings to nights and weekends. To make sure you get familiar with all aspects of the job you will be guided by your manager through digital and on-the-job training. Almost all of our managers have started their career in this very position.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 In order to fancy this job you need to love service and enjoy fast pace. You like to work in a team and are most effective when you get to be a part of a group. Quality is key to us so you need to be very orderly but at the same time keep up with the guest’s expectations on fast delivery.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A fast paced fun job where everyone works closely together as well as great opportunities to grow and develop along with us. Terms and conditions are according to our collective agreement and we also offer health benefits to all employees.
   

  

 We welcome your application as soon as possible! Please note that the selection process will start immediately and that the position might be filled before the application deadline.

title: Researcher in Intersectional Feminist AI for Justice and Sustainability
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a motivated researcher to join our project Intersectional Feminist AI for Visibility, Justice, and Sustainability. The project explores how missing data, invisible labor, and environmental costs shape artificial intelligence (AI) systems, and develops tools and frameworks for more accountable and inclusive technologies.
   

  

 As a researcher, you will be part of an interdisciplinary team working at the intersection of computer science, feminist theory, and social justice. You will contribute to developing technical methods such as natural language processing (NLP), large language models (LLMs), and critical visualization tools, while collaborating closely with community partners and organizations.
   

  

 Your work will focus on one or more of the following areas:
   

  

* Counterdata mapping: using AI-assisted methods to identify and visualize structural absences in datasets related to marginalized communities.
* Infrastructural labor recognition: documenting and amplifying the voices of AI workers, especially those engaged in hidden or precarious forms of labor.
* Ecofeminist accountability: assessing the environmental impact of AI systems and contributing to early frameworks for feminist environmental impact assessment.


 We offer a dynamic research environment where technical innovation is combined with critical perspectives, collaboration, and societal responsibility. You will join the Division of Software and Computer Systems at KTH, working with colleagues across disciplines in computer science, history of technology, and feminist studies.
   

  

 We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. This position offers an opportunity to contribute not only to scientific knowledge but also to shaping AI systems that better serve people and the planet.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A position at a leading technical university that generates knowledge and skills for a sustainable future.
* Engaged and ambitious colleagues along with a creative, international and dynamic working environment
* Work in Stockholm , in close proximity to nature
* Guidance on relocating and settling in KTH and in Sweden
* The opportunity to contribute to an interdisciplinary project at the forefront of responsible and feminist AI research.
* A supportive environment that values diversity, inclusion, and work–life balance.


 Read more about what it's like to work at KTH and our benefits.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Requirements**
* A doctoral degree or an equivalent foreign degree in computer science, AI, data science, or another relevant field.
* You are able to work independently and take responsibility for your research tasks.
* You have good collaborative abilities and working together with colleagues across disciplines and backgrounds.
* You have good communication skills in English, both written and spoken, as it is the working language of the project.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* You have research experience in areas such as natural language processing (NLP), large language models (LLMs), or visualization methods.
* It is commendable if you have teaching experience or an interest in supervising and mentoring students.
* It is commendable if you can communicate research and development work to different audiences, both within and outside academia.
* It is commendable if you have experience in interdisciplinary research or in collaboration with non-academic organizations, such as community groups, NGOs, or industry partners.
* Knowledge of diversity and equal opportunity issues, with specific focus on gender equality


 Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
   

  

 Trade union representatives
   

  

 Contact information to trade union representatives.
   

  

 To apply for the position
   

  

 Log into KTH's recruitment system in order to apply for this position. You are responsible to ensure that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad.
   

  

 The application must include:
   

  

* CV, including relevant professional experience, knowledge, and a list of publications.
* Cover letter (maximum two pages) describing why you want to conduct research in this area, your academic interests, and how they relate to your previous studies and future goals.


 Your complete application must be received by KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

**About The Employment**
 The employment is valid for a limited time according to the agreement - for up to 12 months, with access according to agreement.
   

  

 Other information
   

  

 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values.
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
   

  

 Disclaimer:
 *In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence*
 About KTH KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm has grown to become one of Europe’s leading technical and engineering universities, as well as a key centre of intellectual talent and innovation. We are Sweden’s largest technical research and learning institution and home to students, researchers and faculty from around the world. Our research and education covers a wide area including natural sciences and all branches of engineering, as well as architecture, industrial management, urban planning, history and philosophy. Read more here

title: Sales Manager – Bank Partnerships (DACH)
description:
We are expanding across Europe and are looking to hire a Sales Manager with strong knowledge of their local banking market, a solid industry network, and a proven ability to generate new business. Your focus will be on building Gimi’s presence in key regions such as CEE, DACH, Iberia, the UK, and beyond.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity where, looking back, you will proudly be able to say that you opened an entirely new market for Gimi – with full support from the team, but as the key driver of the expansion.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Open new markets, lead the way in building Gimi’s presence in your country/region
* Prospecting & lead generation. Identify and engage banking partners through networking, referrals and proactive outreach
* Relationship management: Develop strong partnerships with new and existing clients, understanding needs and solving pain points
* Sales cycle ownership: Drive the process from first contact to closing, supported by our negotiation team
* Stay on top of trends, competitors and customer needs in your local banking industry
* Represent Gimi at events and conferences, strengthening our presence in your region
* Share learnings and support colleagues across markets to accelerate growth


**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years’ sales experience with banks/enterprise accounts in fintech, payments or financial services
* Strong network in the banking sector in either Poland, Germany, Southern Europe or France
* Fluent in English and your local market language (Polish, German, French, Spanish, Italian, or Portuguese)
* Track record of building long-term, high-value partnerships
* Comfortable with travel and hybrid sales (mix of in-person and virtual)
* Self-driven, resilient and motivated to succeed in long, complex sales cycles


**Why Join Gimi?**
 At Gimi, we are on a mission to equip the next generation with Financial Superskills®. You’ll join a close-knit startup team where you’ll directly shape the future of our product and revolutionize how banks engage with young people.
   

  

 We offer benefits that match or exceed startup standards (yes, including pension, education budget, and 30 vacation days annually). And you’ll enjoy our cozy office at Nytorget in Stockholm.
   

  

**Sounds interesting?**
 If you’re excited to help shape the future of financial literacy and think you have what it takes to build and grow impactful partnerships, we’d love to hear from you! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis. Don’t wait to submit your application!

title: Databricks Champion
description:
*At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 800 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!*
**Your role**
 We are now seeking a passionate and experienced
 **Databricks Expert or Champion** 
 to join our dynamic team in Stockholm or Gothenburg. In this role, you will play a key part in driving Capgemini’s data, analytics & AI strategy forward using the Databricks platform. You will work hands-on with the latest tools in data ingestion, ETL, orchestration, and machine learning, while also contributing to solution design, architecture, and customer engagement. This is a role for someone who thrives at the intersection of technology, strategy, and communication.
   

  

 Capgemini has a strong and close collaboration with Databricks and was named EMEA Partner of the Year 2024 – a recognition of our customer growth, joint engagements, and technical excellence. As part of our team, you’ll help strengthen this partnership and guide organizations in unlocking the full potential of the Databricks platform.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key part in:*
* Design and implement high-performance data pipelines using Databricks and Apache Spark
* Build and maintain secure data lakehouses and data warehouses in Azure
* Integrate AI/ML models into data pipelines using Databricks ML and Azure ML
* Lead solutioning and architecture efforts – from whiteboard to production
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data scientists, analysts, and DevOps engineers
* Participate in presales, technical workshops, and customer presentations


**Your profile**
 We believe you are a senior data engineer or architect with a passion for building scalable, high-impact data solutions. You combine deep technical skills with strong communication and solutioning capabilities.
   

  

 You have:
   

  

* Proven experience designing and implementing data platforms using Databricks, Apache Spark, SQL, and Python
* Several years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure, including services like Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, and Azure ML
* A solid understanding of data architecture, including lakehouse design, data modeling, and governance
* Experience working in presales, technical workshops, and customer-facing presentations
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions


**Databricks Champion – or on your way there**
 We are looking for someone who is either:
   

  

* An official Databricks Champion, recognized for their technical excellence and community contributions, or
* A high-level Databricks expert with the ambition and potential to become a Champion. With Capgemini’s support, network, and close partnership with Databricks, we’ll help you take that next step.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work
* hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We partner with names such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Databricks, which can equip you with valuable certifications in the latest technologies, if that is your ambition.


 SON
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Systemingenjör, Technical Watch Supervisor till AVISEQ på Arlanda
description:
AVISEQ är den ledande aktören inom drift och underhåll av avancerad teknik inom luftfartsområdet. Vi gör allt från projektering till färdiga installationer. Utmanande felsökningar, reparationer och installationer är vår vardag. Vi jobbar med terminalutrustning, infrastruktur, IP-nätverk, radarutrustningar, radio- och navigationssystem på flygplatser. Vi har goda relationer med kunder och leverantörer. Vår verksamhet karaktäriseras av samarbete, entreprenörskap och humor. AVISEQs Operation-avdelning består av sex olika team med verksamhet över hela landet. Vi söker nu en ansvarstagande Systemingenjör, Technical Watch Supervisor (TWS) till vårt team på Arlanda.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Du erbjuds ett utmanande och stimulerande arbete i en spännande miljö där viktiga egenskaper är stresstålighet, stor social kompetens och ett osvikligt engagemang. Du kommer att bli en viktig länk i kedjan, för att upprätthålla en effektiv och säker verksamhet vid flygledningscentralen, Arlanda ATCC.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak**
 TWS arbetar med att övervaka och avhjälpa eventuella fel som uppstår på ATCC och ansvarar för att driften av ledningssystemen alltid hålls intakta. Som Technical Watch Supervisor ingår du i ett team som tillsammans bemannar kontrollcentralen dygnets alla timmar och årets alla dagar. Tjänsten innefattar listtjänstgöring med både jour och beredskap. Cirka 50% av tjänsten innebär aktiv listtjänst, under den andra halvan av tjänsten arbetar du som systemansvarig för ett eller flera system. Dina kunskaper och din förmåga att fatta rätt beslut vid rätt tid är avgörande för att flygtrafikledningen innehar den säkerhet som krävs och att flygtider kan hållas. Dessa arbetsförhållanden gör tjänsten till mycket ansvarsfull och ett arbetspass är aldrig det andra likt. Du kommer att arbeta i en högteknologisk miljö, där fortbildning sker anpassat efter uppdragets karaktär. Du får arbeta på ett företag som är en ledare inom sin bransch och du blir en del av ett team som består av ambitiösa och engagerade kollegor.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas med och lyckas i rollen som TWS på AVISEQ är du självständig och drivande men har samtidigt lätt för att samarbeta, både med kollegor och med våra kunder. Du är ansvarstagande och systematisk och gillar ordning och reda. Du har en kreativ och lösningsorienterad inställning till hur du utför ditt arbete och du har ett brinnande teknikintresse, datorvana och har viljan att ständigt uppdatera dina kunskaper. Vi tror att du har minst 3-årigt tekniskt gymnasium, men gärna högskoleingenjör med inriktning mot elektronik eller IT. Du har en vana av att upprätta teknisk dokumentation och du är flytande i svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift. Du välkomnas till ett företag där det är högt i tak och där vi lägger stort värde i de personliga egenskaperna. Grundläggande kunskaper från Windows/Office, Unix/Linux, nätverk/förbindelser/modem är klart meriterande. Erfarenheter från att ha arbetat med felsökning/analyser och övervakning är också något som vi kommer att lägga vikt vid.
   

  

**Om verksamheten**
 AVISEQ verkar inom kritisk kommunikation. Vi är specialister på att erbjuda kostnadseffektiva tjänster utan att göra avkall på säkerheten. Vi övervakar, driftar och underhåller våra kunders tekniska utrustning och system, allt för att säkerställa deras kritiska verksamhet. Våra största kunder verkar inom luftfart och säkerhet vid flygtrafikcentraler, flygplatser, statliga myndigheter och företag, såväl offentliga som privata, i hela Sverige. AVISEQ har cirka 200 anställda och blev i maj 2020 en del av LFV-koncernen. Vi vill vara den bästa arbetsplatsen för dig som gillar utmaningar och att ta ett samhällsansvar!
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan, gärna så snart som möjligt då urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på 100%, där vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning. Grund för anställning är godkänd registerkontroll/säkerhetsprövning och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Vi eftersträvar mångfald och välkomnar sökande som kan bidra till att vi uppnår detta. I denna rekrytering samarbetar AVISEQ med Poolia. Vid frågor, kontakta rekryterare Sofie Cardegren på 073-344 71 76.

title: SAP Functional Lead - Sales and Distribution
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 Our operations and how we support our customers is undergoing a major business transformation – Programme one . A key role in this business and IT transformation journey is our Functional Lead for Sales & Distribution. You will be a key player in one of DeLaval’s biggest business transformation programs ever. As part of this greenfield program, we will replace many of our existing solutions and processes with new solutions from SAP.
   

  

**Purpose Of Role And Key Responsibilities**
 You will be our senior solution designer and business advisor, with a deep understanding of business processes and capabilities. Close cooperation with business and IT stakeholders, as well as with SAP and our implementation partner, is your natural way of working. You are a strong advocate and gatekeeper for our principles: standardization, harmonization & simplification.
   

  

**Specific Tasks Include**
* Translate business requirements into technical solutions by applying knowledge of business processes and best practices, ensuring alignment with agreed cost-levels (TCO perspective) and in compliance with development and operations guidelines.
* Keeping guidelines and instructions up to date and addressing deviations from agreed design principles and ways of working.
* Upon completion of our transformation program, continue to be part of the SAP CoE supporting the continuous business development and improvement journey.


**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a proactive team member who will add value to our program with their SAP, technology, and business competence.
   

  

 To be successful in this role, we believe that you:
