title: System Engineer
description:
🚀
 **Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a System Engineer** 
 🚀
   

  

 Do you want to be part of a journey where technology powers business transformation? At VIPAS AB, we believe that IT systems are the foundation of digital innovation. As a growing IT & Engineering consulting company, we are looking for passionate
 **System Engineers** 
 to help design, operate, and optimize enterprise-grade systems across diverse industries.
   

  

**About VIPAS**
 At VIPAS AB, we go beyond traditional consulting. We deliver tailored solutions that bring real impact, using powerful technologies across
 **cloud, embedded systems, software development, cybersecurity, and DevOps** 
 . Our projects span
 **telecom, automotive, finance, public sector, and healthcare** 
 , giving consultants the opportunity to work on diverse, challenging, and rewarding assignments.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for motivated
 **System Engineers** 
 to join our growing team.
   

  

 In this role, you will design, deploy, and maintain critical IT systems and infrastructure. You will ensure
 **stability, scalability, and security** 
 , while working on
 **system integration, performance optimization, and automation** 
 .
   

  

 Whether you are an entry-level engineer eager to learn, a mid-level specialist managing complex environments, or a senior architect driving strategy, you’ll find opportunities to grow with us.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**System Administration & Operations**
* Install, configure, and maintain Windows/Linux servers.
* Manage Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, Group Policies, Exchange, O365.
* Monitor system performance and availability.


**Infrastructure & Virtualization**
* Work with VMware, Hyper-V, Proxmox, Citrix, or KVM virtualization platforms.
* Manage storage solutions (SAN, NAS, iSCSI, NFS).
* Handle backup & disaster recovery (Veeam, Commvault, Azure Backup, AWS Backup).


**Automation & Tools**
* Automate tasks with PowerShell, Bash, Python, or Ansible.
* Use monitoring tools: Nagios, Zabbix, Prometheus, Grafana, SolarWinds.
* Implement configuration management and patching strategies.


**Security & Compliance**
* Apply system hardening and patching best practices.
* Manage access controls and Identity & Access Management (IAM).
* Ensure compliance with ISO 27001, GDPR, or other regulatory frameworks.


**Collaboration & Integration**
* Work closely with Cloud, DevOps, and Network Engineers.
* Translate business needs into technical solutions.
* Participate in migrations (on-prem to cloud, legacy to modern platforms).


**Qualifications**
 We welcome applications from
 **all levels** 
 – junior, mid-level, and senior.
   

  

**Core Skills (all levels):**
* Experience in Linux/Windows server administration.
* Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
* Knowledge of networking basics (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, Firewalls, VPN).
* Familiarity with scripting/automation.


**Preferred Skills (role-dependent):**
* Cloud integration experience (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Containerization knowledge (Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
* Knowledge of DevOps practices (CI/CD, IaC).
* Familiarity with security frameworks & audits.


**Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or related fields.
* Certifications like MCSA, MCSE, RHCSA, RHCE, CompTIA Server+, VMware VCP, Azure/AWS Associate are a plus.


**Why Join Us?**
 At VIPAS AB, we believe in more than just filling positions—we believe in building futures. Our consultants choose us because we offer
 **security, transparency, and growth opportunities** 
 . As part of the
 **Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement** 
 , you can trust that your career is supported with fair compensation, solid benefits, and long-term stability.
   

  

 What sets us apart is the
 **diversity of projects** 
 . From
 **banking to automotive, from healthcare to public sector** 
 , our consultants gain real-world, hands-on experience across industries.
   

  

 Our culture is built on
 **collaboration, curiosity, and integrity** 
 . We celebrate innovation, embrace inclusion, and ensure that every voice is valued. At VIPAS AB, you don’t just join a company—you join a community.
   

  

 📩 Interested? Apply today and take the next step in your
 **System Engineering career** 
 with VIPAS AB.
   

  

 👉 For more details, reach out to
 **shrini** 
**@vipas.se**
**Note:** 
 Applicants must hold a valid EU work permit. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—apply now before the opportunity closes.

title: Sr System & Cloud Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 We are looking to strengthen our Platform Services team with a System and Cloud Engineer who is passionate about building secure, scalable and reliable systems. If you're skilled in Cloud platforms, automation, and infrastructure as code, we'd love to talk with you.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Essential Responsibilities:**
* Oversee load balancers, Global Server Load Balancing (GSLB) equipment, Content Delivery Network (CDN) platforms, and troubleshoot client/server issues.
* Handle proactive and reactive outages, work with vendors, and take ownership of network incidents, escalations, and root cause analysis.
* Lead backbone network design and architecture for on-premises and public cloud migration, and build hybrid connectivity solutions.
* Work with business unit leadership, product managers, and customers to develop project objectives, timelines, and feature requirements.
* Support network system availability, manage network capacity, and ensure compliance with Information Security standards.
* Deploy equipment, manage SSL certificate hosting and renewal, and build infrastructure for data centers and cloud environments.
* Implement and continually improve operational procedures, systems, and network engineering best practices.
* Offer on-call support, monitor infrastructure and hosted services, and troubleshoot complex issues.
* Manage and influence global teams, provide guidance and support, and mentor team members in areas of expertise.
* Communicate incident impacts, risks, and mitigation plans to executives, document incident information, and create network engineering documentation and best practices.


**Minimum Qualifications:**
* Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience and a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.


 PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us.
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset-you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0130875

title: Data Engineer
description:
**ComeOn Group in short**
 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Managing a multi brand portfolio on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.
   

  

 As our new data engineer, you will be involved in the design, development and maintenance of near real-time data streaming and batch data integrations for regulatory operational reporting, analytics and machine learning initiatives. This is a challenging role with huge growth potential as you will be helping to build the backbone where all our regulatory reporting data will flow through, as well as enabling our teams to gain deeper insights and drive business growth.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design, build and maintain robust, scalable and reliable batch and streaming data pipelines in cloud environment
* Assure quality and consistency of data by implementing best practises of data engineering
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues with the data feeds
* Assist, establish and maintain appropriate communication channels with business and technical teams in the context of company data assets
* Work with all parts of the system and through all stages of the development process from analysis to release
* Manage infrastructure using terraform and ensure efficient deployment of data services


**About you:**
* Experienced data engineer with 3+ years in data integration / real time streaming / data warehousing
* Excellent command of spoken English
* Keen attention to detail and data quality
* Experience in programming in Scala or Java
* Experience in streaming big data sets with Spark, Flink, Kafka or similar
* Experience with AWS or GCP Cloud data processing solutions
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment whilst interacting with a variety of different disciplines
* Proven ability to prioritise and deal with problems systematically and provide clear communications regarding the issues, resolution times and solutions
* Experience with IaC tools like Terraform and deployment tools like Gitlab Runners, Github Actions or similar


 & then some nice to haves...
   

  

* Hold an academic degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science or mathematics
* Experience within the iGaming industry and / or regulatory aspect of iGaming would be considered an asset
* Experience in SQL query writing and optimisation
* Experience with Airflow in GCP environment
* Experience in business analysis and requirements gathering
* Experience with data warehousing will be considered an asset


**So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?**
* A competitive remuneration package! 💰
* Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events 😎
* A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we're truly Hybrid!)
* On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere 🌎
* 30 paid vacation days a year
* Generous pension and insurance benefits
* Brand new laptop and smartphone with fully paid plan
* Generous health subsidy benefit
* Company events, including breakfast mornings and Friday beers


 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
   

  

 At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
   

  

 Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!
   

  

* LinkedIn
* Instagram
* Facebook
* Glassdoor

title: Security Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 – We’re looking for a Security Engineer to raise the bar for how fast-moving AI teams stay secure. You’ll work with infra, ML, and product teams to protect our stack without slowing us down. This is a high-leverage role for someone who wants to build security into the core of everything we ship.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience securing modern cloud-native environments, ideally at product-focused tech companies or early-stage startups or top-tier AI labs.
* Deep knowledge of securing engineering infrastructure: CI/CD pipelines, secrets, service-to-service auth, containerized environments, and public cloud.
* Strong systems mindset - you're comfortable diving into infra code, writing tools, and contributing directly to engineering workflows.
* Track record and intuition to design pragmatic security controls that don’t slow teams down.
* Bonus: You’ve shipped internal security tools or open-sourced relevant infra.


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Help us build and ship AI products at extremely high velocity without compromising on security.
   

  

* Identify high-leverage surfaces across Lovable’s engineering stack, from CI/CD and auth to product endpoints.
* Design and implement tooling that helps developers go the secure route by default.
* Own detection, triage, and response for vulnerabilities and incidents - internal and external.
* Collaborate with infra, ML, platform and product engineers to embed security into everything we build.
* Track emerging risks in AI infra, LLM pipelines, and third-party integrations, and close the gaps before they matter.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Google Cloud, AWS, Terraform
* DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, observability, infra-as-code


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with the team.
* Complete the take-home exercise
* Show us how you approach problems during two technical interviews
* Join us for trial work lasting 2 days preferably on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Systems Engineer
description:
**About**
 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **Systems Engineer** 
 to lead the definition and documentation of system requirements. You will play a key role to translate customer and technical input into clear, structured requirements that guide product development and ensure regulatory compliance.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and manage system requirements from customer and internal input
* Document system specifications, interfaces, and traceability
* Collaborate with engineering, project, and customer teams
* Ensure compliance with marine and safety standards


**Your Profile**
* Degree in systems or electrical engineering (BSc/MSc) or similar
* 5+ years of experience in system development and requirements engineering
* Skilled to formulate requirements and do the right trade-offs to optimize customer properties.
* Structured and strong analytical skills
* Knowledge of standards (ISO, DNV, IEC) is a plus


**Why Join Echandia Marine?**
**Impact** 
 : Work on groundbreaking technology that will shape the future of sustainable marine transport.
   

  

**Growth** 
 : Develop your skills in a dual role that combines technical leadership with product strategy.
   

  

**Innovation** 
 : Join a culture that values creativity, collaboration and innovation at every level.
   

  

**Mission** 
 : Be part of a purpose-driven company working to make the marine industry cleaner and more efficient.
   

  

 The right candidate will be part of a fast growing, non-hierarchical and business focused scale-up company fighting climate change through zero-emission electrification.
   

  

 Echandia is challenging the maritime industry with safer electrification. Since its founding in 2018, Echandia has rapidly become a global leader in maritime battery systems, delivering nearly 70 systems for electrification projects worldwide. Our systems are tailored to optimize energy efficiency and reduce environmental impact, supporting the maritime industry’s transition towards sustainable operations. Based in Stockholm, we serve customers across the globe.

title: DevOps Engineering Manager
description:
**Vill du vara med på resan och ansvara för att leda vår transformation till Cloud?** 
 Välkommen till oss som vår nya DevOps Engineer Manager!
   

  

 Vi är ett framgångsrikt produktbolag som fokuserar på att leverera en FaaS-tjänst för redovisning, ekonomi och lön till våra kunder. Sen vår start för 10+ år sedan har vi vuxit organiskt och med sunda finanser. Kleer är i starten på ett omfattande tekniskt initiativ och behöver förstärka vår organisation! Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 På Development är vi idag cirka ca 35 kollegor som arbetar tillsammans för att driva innovation och kontinuerligt vidareutveckla vår produkt. Vi jobbar i en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter.
   

  

**👉🏼 Om rollen**
 Som DevOps Engineering Manager kommer du arbeta operativt och spela en avgörande roll i vårt team som idag består av 2 personer. Du kommer ha ansvar för att leda och utveckla vår operations och infrastrukturprocesser. Vi söker dig som är operativt involverad i arbetet i teamet men vill gå in i en ledarroll och bli en del av ledningsgruppen på Development.
   

  

 Du blir en nyckelspelare i att säkerställa smidighet, effektivitet och stabilitet i vårt team. Du kommer även vara ansvarig för att leda vår transformation till cloud.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden Som DevOps Engineering Manager**
* Operations och Infrastruktur: Ansvara för övervakning, underhåll och optimering av vår infrastruktur.
* Releasehantering: Leda utvecklingen och implementeringen av automatiserade byggpipelines och säkerställa effektiva releaser.
* Metrics och Incidenthantering: Implementera och övervaka KPI:er och metrics för systemets hälsa, samt leda incidenthantering och problemlösning.
* Tekniskt Ledarskap: Agera som en mentor och ledare inom teamet, driva projekt framåt och vara proaktiv i att identifiera och åtgärda tekniska utmaningar.
* Cloud Transformation: Spela en ledande roll i vår övergång till cloud-baserade lösningar, inklusive arbete med Kubernetes och andra cloud-teknologier. Samt arbeta med att optimera vår cloud-drift.
* Personalansvar: Utveckla och stödja teamet som finns idag genom mentorskap, feedback och individuell utveckling för att skapa en stimulerande och positiv arbetsmiljö.


****💜 Vem söker vi?****
 Vi söker dig som har relevant utbildning samt stark bakgrund inom DevOps, med bevisad erfarenhet av att hantera operations, infrastruktur, och releaseprocesser. Vidare tror vi att du har;
   

  

* Erfarenhet från liknade tech stack: Java, MySQL, Jenkins, Maven, ELK, Prometheus, GitLab.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av cloud-teknologier, särskilt inom cloud transformation och Kubernetes, är mycket meriterande.
* Förmågan att arbeta självständigt, ta initiativ och leda både projekt och människor.
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och en proaktiv inställning till utmaningar.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmågan att samarbeta effektivt inom ett team.


 Vi erbjuder en spännande roll i hjärtat av vår tekniska transformation. Vi har en dynamisk och stöttande arbetsmiljö där dina idéer och bidrag värderas högt. Du kommer få en möjlighet till professionell utveckling och tillväxt inom företaget.
   

  

 Det finns så mycket mer att berätta om både Kleer som bolag, vår vision att göra svenska företag mer framgångsrika, vår kultur, utvecklingsteamet, produkten m.m. Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill veta mer! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Önskad start:** 
 Så snart vi hittar rätt person för rollen, enligt överenskommelse. Vi går igenom urvalet löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
   

  

 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

 Vi på Kleer ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: Security Engineer
description:
**Join Relax Gaming’s growing Information Security team and play a key role in protecting one of the fastest-growing companies in iGaming.** 




  





 At Relax Gaming, security isn’t just about compliance, it’s about enabling innovation while safeguarding our people, products, and players. We’re looking for a skilled
 **Security Engineer** 
 who thrives in dynamic environments, enjoys solving complex problems, and wants to make a real impact across the business.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




 As a Security Engineer at Relax, you’ll be part of a collaborative team that ensures our security objectives are met and that we remain ahead of emerging threats. Your work will span across proactive risk management, hands-on security operations, and supporting audits in regulated environments.
 



  




* **Protect & innovate** 
 : Design, implement, and manage security frameworks that safeguard Relax ICT systems.
* **Be hands-on** 
 : Conduct risk assessments, manage vulnerabilities, monitor logs, investigate incidents, and continuously improve our security posture.
* **Drive compliance** 
 : Support ISO 27001:2022, financial audits, and other compliance requirements while ensuring smooth remediation.
* **Enable the business** 
 : Create security policies, raise awareness, and act as a trusted advisor to teams across the organization.
* **Stay ahead** 
 : Keep up with evolving threats and bring best practices to strengthen our defenses.



  





**What we’re looking for** 




 We’re not just after certifications and checklists, we want someone passionate about security, with the curiosity to keep learning and the communication skills to bring others on the journey.
 



  




* **Proven expertise** 
 in Security Operations (log monitoring, threat detection, incident response).
* **Hands-on knowledge** 
 of EDR, SIEM, IDS/IPS, MDM, DDoS protection, and vulnerability management.
* **Audit experience** 
 , ideally ISO 27001, from preparation to remediation.
* **Relevant certifications** 
 (CISSP or equivalent required; ISO 27001 Lead Implementer preferred).
* **Technical edge** 
 : scripting/automation skills (Python, Bash, Jira/Confluence automation) are a plus.
* **Strong communicator & educator** 
 : able to explain complex security issues in plain English and influence stakeholders who may not have a security background.
* Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, or a related field.



  





**Why join Relax Gaming?** 




 At Relax, you’ll join a diverse, international team united by curiosity, creativity, and drive. Security here isn’t an afterthought, it’s central to how we grow, operate, and innovate in regulated markets around the world.
 



  




* **Impact** 
 : Your work will directly shape how Relax Gaming operates securely across multiple jurisdictions.
* **Growth** 
 : With rapid expansion, there’s plenty of room for you to develop your skills and take on new responsibilities.
* **Collaboration** 
 : Work closely with teams across product, compliance, and operations in a supportive, respectful culture.
* **Flexibility** 
 : This role can be based in Malta, Estonia, Serbia, Sweden, or the Isle of Man.



  





**Life at Relax in Stockhom** 




 Welcome to Relax Gaming Stockholm. Where big talent meets even bigger hearts. Right in the center of the city, our newly renovated office in Gallerian offers more than just a great location and a sun-drenched terrace. It’s home to some of the brightest minds in iGaming, a powerhouse mix of creative energy, deep experience, and next-level ambition. Here, senior experts collaborate seamlessly with high-performing juniors, creating an environment where learning, innovation, and quality go hand in hand. It’s fast-paced, fun, and fiercely supportive - a team that knows how to deliver at the highest level without ever losing the playful spirit that defines Relax. Mastered by experience. Driven by play. Truly Relax.
 



  





**About Relax Gaming** 




 Relax Gaming Group was founded in 2010 with the goal of creating games for the modern iGaming landscape. Always staying true to the Relax core values - Driven, Adaptable, Supportive, and Respectful - the recent and rapid expansion has been conceived in order to deliver unparalleled global reach. Via a quick one-time integration, Relax Gaming now provides access to a roster of 1500+ casino games and a diverse range of proprietary products, including Poker, Bingo, and its own rapidly expanding slot portfolio.
 



  





 The high-quality aggregated content is provided through its selected Silver Bullet (commercially represented) and Powered By Relax (commercially independent) partners. Regulated markets are also at the heart of its growth strategy, with both fully supported regulated markets as well as licenses held in multiple jurisdictions.
 



  





**This role can be located in almost every one of our locations:** 
 Malta, Estonia, Serbia, Sweden or the Isle of Man.
 



 Keen to find out more? Learn about us here.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced
 **GCP Data Engineer** 
 with strong expertise in
 **BigQuery, Python, and SQL** 
 to join our data engineering team. The ideal candidate will design and optimize data pipelines, build scalable cloud-based solutions, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality datasets for analytics and business decision-making.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, develop, and maintain
 **ETL/ELT pipelines** 
 using
 **Airflow** 
 and transformation tools (dbt or similar).
* Manage
 **data workflows and orchestration** 
 on
 **Google Cloud Composer** 
 .
* Build and maintain
 **data storage and processing workflows** 
 on
 **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)** 
 using
 **BigQuery and GCS** 
 .
* Automate infrastructure and deployments using
 **Terraform** 
 .
* Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and engineers to deliver
 **clean, reliable datasets** 
 .
* Monitor pipeline performance, handle failures, and ensure
 **data quality and observability** 
 .
* Follow best practices for coding, testing, documentation, and version control.



  





**Required Skills & Experience** 



* Strong proficiency in
 **Python** 
 for data processing and scripting.
* Hands-on experience with
 **Airflow** 
 (or similar orchestration frameworks).
* Expertise in
 **SQL** 
 and solid understanding of
 **data modeling** 
 and
 **data warehousing principles** 
 .
* Experience with
 **BigQuery, GCS** 
 , or equivalent platforms (
 **AWS Redshift/S3** 
 ,
 **Azure Synapse/Data Lake** 
 ).
* Familiarity with
 **dbt** 
 or similar transformation tools (
 **Spark SQL, Dataform, etc.** 
 ).
* Knowledge of
 **Terraform** 
 and Infrastructure-as-Code practices.
* Comfortable working in
 **Agile environments** 
 with Git-based workflows.
* Knowledge of
 **Kafka** 
 and real-time data streaming is a plus.



  





**Competencies** 



* Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset.
* Ability to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
* Effective communication skills in a collaborative environment.

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
**At Professional Galaxy AB,** 
 we help businesses leverage technology to simplify operations and drive growth. We deliver tailored, scalable IT solutions using Java, Python, Cloud platforms, and more. Our consultants specialize in IT and engineering roles, including Software Development, DevOps, Systems Engineering, Project Management, Cybersecurity, and Finance.
   

  

 With expertise in sourcing and contract management, we optimize supply chains, strengthen supplier relationships, and support strategic procurement. By combining technical skills with business insight, we enable clients to overcome today’s challenges and prepare for tomorrow’s opportunities.
   

  

**Your role**
 Co-develop a dedicated AI infrastructure for SEB HR, while providing hands-on training and mentorship. The goal is to build internal capabilities, enable operational independence, and transition existing AI models into a newly built environment.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Proven experience with GCP services and ML engineering workflows.
* Strong Python programming skills, with the ability to build and debug ML pipelines.
* Skilled in knowledge transfer: able to explain best practices, architecture choices, and scalable ML setups on GCP.
* Team-oriented mindset: supports shared goals, takes ownership, and fosters learning.
* Deep practical knowledge of:
* Vertex AI: Training, deployment, monitoring, orchestration
* BigQuery: Scalable analytics and warehousing
* Cloud Storage: Raw and processed data storage
* Dataflow: Preprocessing and pipeline orchestration
* Engine / TPUs / GPUs: High-performance training
* Cloud Functions / Cloud Run: Model serving and automation
* IAM: Access control for secure ML workflows
* Monitoring & Logging: ML system observability
* Registry: Container and artifact storage
* IaC: Terraform / Deployment Manager for GCP resources
* CI/CD: Cloud Build / GitHub Actions integration
* Auth & Access: OAuth 2.0, IAM roles, service accounts


**Start date:** 
 2025-11-03
   

  

**End date:** 
 2026-04-30
   

  

**Offer due date:** 
 2025-09-21
   

  

 We often present candidates on an ongoing basis. This means that we sometimes remove the assignment from our website earlier than the last application day. If you are interested in an assignment, we recommend that you apply immediately.
   

  

 Please feel free to contact Ritu Sareen, ritu.sareen@progalaxy.se, if you have any queries related to the job!

title: Integration Software Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 





 About Qurrent
 




 At Qurrent, we're accelerating the transition to a renewable energy future by transforming distributed energy resources—batteries, solar, wind—into flexible, revenue-generating assets. Our AI-driven virtual power plant optimizes assets in real time for customers and the grid. We’re ambitious, move fast, and love working with people who turn hard problems into high performing systems.
 



  





**The Role** 




 You’ll build the integrations that let our agent software talk to the physical world. Most days you’ll be implementing and hardening Modbus-based drivers against diverse hardware, while also extending the Go abstraction layer that sits above protocol adapters. You’ll work closely with hardware partners to get devices online reliably and securely.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Implement, test, and maintain integrations with Modbus servers (TCP/RTU) and other industrial/IoT protocols.
* Extend our Go-based abstraction layer that normalizes device capabilities across vendors.
* Diagnose protocol quirks, timing issues, and field bugs across serial, TCP/IP, and edge environments.
* Collaborate with partners and customers during onboarding; document capabilities and edge cases.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Hands-on with Modbus (must-have); familiarity with one or more of IEC 104, MQTT, or vendor SDKs is a plus.
* Comfortable on Linux at the edge ( logging, networking, security basics).
* Clear communicator; you enjoy calls and screen-shares with partner engineers to unblock integrations.
* Pragmatic, test-minded approach to reliability.
* Solid Go skills and production experience with protocol-level integrations.
* Conversational Swedish



  





**Nice to Have** 



* Experience with time-series data, offline-tolerant agents, or gateway hardware (e.g., RS-485, PLCs).
* Energy/DER, SCADA, or telemetry domain exposure.



  





**﻿
 
 Why Join Us** 



* Fast moving industry that is in the midst of major shifts.
* Your work unlocks entire classes of hardware for our platform—impact you can measure.
* Collaborative, low-ego team using modern tooling (including AI/LLMs) to move faster.

title: iOS Engineer
description:
At Svea Solar, we have a clear vision – to fix the planet. As Sweden’s and one of Europe’s leading players in energy technology, we are driving the energy transition with solar power and smart energy solutions. ⚡
 



  





 We’re now expanding our app team with an
 **iOS Engineer** 
 . Are you ready to join the Power Shift?
 



  





**About The Role & The Team** 




 As our iOS Engineer, you’ll help shape our new app and its extensions, including the Apple Watch app. The app already supports tens of thousands (soon hundreds of thousands 😉) customers in optimizing their energy use. Our iOS app is built with SwiftUI and Swift concurrency, connected to a newly developed backend, using Apple’s latest frameworks. The minimum iOS version is 16 (but is being bumped to 18 this fall).
 



  





 You’ll work closely with our iOS Staff Engineer, Product Manager, and the rest of the app team to define and deliver on our roadmap, reporting to the Engineering Manager.
 



*We follow a collaboration-first policy, working three days a week from our Alvik office.* 




  





**Your Key Responsibilities** 



* Take part in defining the architecture, platform, and best practices for the development of our apps on iOS and watchOS
* Write, review, and test code in a collaborative environment with other software engineers
* Work closely with other engineers, designers, and product owners to explore new solutions to problems
* Contribute to the development roadmap on how to best further us on our way to rid the planet of fossil fuels



  





**Are we a match?** 




**We’re Looking For You Who…** 



* Values team success over personal success.
* Are fluent in English - our organizational language.
* Have extensive experience in Swift, with solid knowledge of Swift concurrency and SwiftUI.
* Write readable, idiomatic, and maintainable Swift, and are happy to follow established coding guidelines and workflows.
* Have released at least one app on the App Store, or you have a project in the works you can show us.



  





**Bonus Points If You:** 



* Stays up to date with advancements in Swift 6.



  





**🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you** 




  





**The opportunity to make an impact** 
 – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.
 



  





**A value-driven workplace** 
 – read more about our values here.
 



  





**The chance to own your results** 
 – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.
 



  





**Diversity and inclusivity** 
 – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.
 



  





**Employment benefits** 
 – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.
 



  





**Flexibility/ hybrid work** 
 – work up to two days a week from home.
 



 Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
 



  





**⚡Who are we** 




 As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it
 **The Power Shift** 
 . And the ones driving it?
 **Power Shifters** 
 .
 



  





**About Our Recruitment Process** 



* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.



 👉
 **Ready to become a Power Shifter?** 
 We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!

title: Spännande möjligheter för Systemingenjörer hos Saab!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*
**Din roll**
 I ett nära samarbete med engagerade kollegor kommer du att ställas inför varierande och utmanande uppgifter och din roll kommer att omfatta hela produktcykeln – från kravhantering och systemdesign till testning och implementering.
   

  

 Vår arbetskultur på Saab präglas av ett seriöst, långsiktigt och förtroendebaserat tillvägagångssätt. Vi värdesätter att ha roligt tillsammans och tror på att bygga starka och hållbara relationer. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller om du är en erfaren specialist inom ditt område, är det viktigaste att du delar vår passion för utveckling och ny teknologi.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Har du kunskap inom någon av dessa områden; test, kravhantering, system-safety och aerospace? Vi är intresserade av att lära känna just dig! Vad driver dig och vad vill du utvecklas inom? På vårt kontor i Järfälla erbjuder vi en bred variation av spännande möjligheter inom system. Vi söker personer för roller som –
 ***systemingenjörer, system-safety, IT-säkerhetsexperter och test/kravingenjörer.***
 Vi värdesätter egenskaper som nyfikenhet, starkt driv och förmågan att effektivt kommunicera och samarbeta. Vi ser att du har en relevant högskole – eller civilingenjörsexamen, tillsammans med flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld. Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

*Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt härliga team och gör ditt intresse för teknik till verklighet hos Saab!*

title: Software Engineer to Alva Labs
description:
The workforce is undergoing a massive transformation, with up to 50% of today’s jobs expected to require new skill sets within a few years. This shift makes evaluating talent challenging, and closing this skill gap is rapidly becoming the most critical issue for companies worldwide.
 



  





 At Alva, we believe you are more than just your CV. Traditional evaluations can't capture your full potential, especially in a world where roles evolve quickly. We're dedicated to building an inclusive product that gives everyone an equal opportunity to showcase their abilities and match efficiently with relevant job opportunities. By doing so, we empower companies to thrive and improve their performance through better talent alignment.
 



  





 We are currently looking for Fullstack Engineers to help us revolutionize how the world views talent, today and tomorrow.
 



  





**The company** 




 Alva Labs is a Stockholm-based SaaS company that offers a solution that is helping global organizations grow their team in a scientific way. Alva has created a unique candidate assessment platform that helps companies find the right candidate for them, and candidates to find their dream job. Combining state-of-the-art psychometrics, data science, and an obsession with candidate experience, it provides the needed tool for data-driven talent acquisition.
 



  





 Our current focus is on transforming our offerings to meet the needs of larger and more complex organizations. By targeting this segment, we aim to redefine how the market perceives talent management. We are embarking on ambitious product innovations and evolving our go-to-market strategies. In this dynamic environment, the engineering team will play a pivotal role in shaping the future success of our company.
 



  





**The role** 




 The day-to-day work in Alva’s engineering team is performed in product squads focused on different product surfaces. Currently, we’re divided into four different squads, each squad aims to be self-sufficient and consists of a Product Manager, Designer, and three to five engineers. Currently, we're hiring for our Product squads that build the core offering of Alva's platform.
 



  





 Within 1 month you have:
 


* Received the support you need in order to get a good start at Alva.
* Started to familiarize yourself with the product and the platform.
* Started contributing to the team’s work.



  





 Within 3 months you have:
 


* Been programming in all parts of the tech stack. All the way from frontend to backend and cloud infrastructure.
* Helped your team to build new features quicker than we otherwise would have - the velocity has increased significantly.



  





 Within 6 months you have:
 


* Impacted the quality of the product, getting to the point where we fix all bugs and improve performance metrics.
* Become a technical role model and informal leader within your team.
* Started to feel proud of the part of the product and the codebase you are working with.



  





**You** 




 We do not expect you to have prior extensive experience building recruitment solutions but we're rather interested in you being a skilled Fullstack Software Engineer and a colleague we could always rely on. Ideally, you have extensive experience working as a fullstack engineer and are used to leading technical discovery of complex problems.
 



  





 We would also be happy if you;
 


* Love solving complex problems and turning them into solutions that breathe simplicity.
* Are ambitious and structured.
* Are a prestigeless team player and enjoy supporting your coworkers.
* Our day-to-day language is English, so no need to know Swedish.
* Are able to spend at least 3 days/week at our office in central Stockholm.



  





**Your future colleagues** 




 We are a team of 60+ people, representing a wide selection of professional backgrounds. And all of that is absolutely fantastic, but the true beauty is the trust and warmth you will experience. You will most likely never be in a place where people are as nerdy about what we do, and have so many brilliant minds to learn from and ask for guidance. To quote our CEO during our last company trip, “It feels like hanging out with a bunch of old friends”.
 



  





**What we offer** 




 We strongly believe that experimentation is the best way of learning and making decisions about product and technology. Therefore, we try our best to keep the feedback loops short to iteratively improve our product and our system. For this to be possible, we need a modern system that is pleasant to work with. The core of our tech stack is;
 



  




* Python
* React, TypeScript
* Google Cloud Platform (GKE, Cloud Run, Pub/Sub)
* PostgreSQL, Firestore
* GraphQL
* Protocol buffers
* Event-driven microservices



  





 The problem we are solving is not just engaging and interesting (the combination of psychological science and statistics, with a large chunk of candidate experience obsession, what’s not to love?), but it is also something that has a tremendous impact on both people and businesses. You will have the opportunity to work with something that truly makes a difference.
 



  





 What else? We have flexible work hours in a hybrid setup, where you spend at least 3 days/week in the office. You will get six weeks of vacation, a flexible compensation and benefits package where you can make individual adaptations, a generous preventive care benefit, and a few other neat perks. You can read all about our benefits →
 
 here
 
 ← and our company values →
 
 here
 
 ←.
 



  





**The hiring process** 




 Given that we claim to be experts in hiring, you probably wonder what we have in store for you.
 


1. Objective screening with Alva’s own tests (and your first interaction with the product we build!)
2. First interview (focusing on who you are)
3. A coding challenge to complete at home (and your second interaction with our product) as preparation for the next round.
4. Live-coding session with your potential new colleagues.
5. System design interview with an Engineering manager
6. Final interview with CTO and deputy CEO
7. Background- and ID check (yes, we take security seriously)
8. Done deal!



  





**Come help us change the world of hiring! Welcome to Alva!**

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
   

  

**But where does that take you?**
 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
   

  

**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
   

  

**We are looking for**
**Senior Software Engineer**
**to join our team at our location in Stockholm**
**(Y)our Mission:**
 Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We allow consumers to choose when and how they want to pay, guaranteeing merchants a steady and predictable cash flow. Our products make us proud, but not content, and we have high ambitions for our existing and upcoming products. We’re now modernizing and strengthening one of our key products with renewed focus in the Nordics — backed by the strength of a global group, but with the energy and ownership of a startup. You’ll join a newly formed product & tech team, helping shape how we work and how we grow as we double down on building sustainable, human-centric FinTech solutions.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* In this role, you will work as a full-stack engineer, primarily focusing on backend tasks and having smaller front-end responsibilities. You will join one of our products, and your daily tasks will be:
* Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, APIs, and other workflows.
* Attend regular scrum ceremonies as a member of an agile cross-functional team.
* Analyze, discuss and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create.
* Adopt, implement, and provide feedback on organizational and industry standards and practices that will positively impact on our engineering culture.


  

  

**What will help you to succeed in the role:**
* A university degree in the IT field
* Hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework.
* Experience in frontend development with any modern JavaScript framework (e.g., Angular).
* Some experience in developing, shipping, and maintaining cloud-based applications.
* A good understanding of RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with microservices and distributed architecture is a plus.
* Experience with relational databases, preferably SQL Server.
* Knowledge of cloud development and experience with Azure is a bonus.
* Written and spoken English proficiency to communicate and collaborate with our international team.


**About the technologies we use:**
 Our teams have autonomy regarding tech choices. The example below will give you some insights, and we look forward to discussing this further.
   

  

 All solutions developed cloud-native targeting Azure - Infrastructure defined using Terraform - Services deployed to Kubernetes clusters by default - A growing microservice ecosystem with event-based integration - Using latest .NET Core - RESTful API design - Single-page frontend apps served by CDN - Frontend tech using TypeScript, often Angular or standard Web Components (Stencil) - Automated tests in each layer - Design collaboration using Figma.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
   

  

 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Lead iOS Developer
description:
Are you a passionate iOS developer eager to shape the future of equine health? Join Sleip and use your expertise to build innovative solutions that make a real impact for veterinary professionals and horse owners worldwide.
 



  





**About Sleip AB** 




 Sleip AB is a fast-growing, venture-backed startup reshaping the equine health industry with cutting-edge AI and mobile technology. We’re on a mission to deliver objective, data-driven gait analysis that transforms how equine health is managed. Headquartered in Stockholm, our innovative app has already empowered over 900 veterinary professionals worldwide, and we’re just getting started. Our leadership team – including visionary founders with deep expertise in both technology and veterinary science, and a recently appointed COO from AniCura – is committed to creating impact through relentless innovation and collaboration.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We are looking for a Senior iOS Developer to take technical ownership of our flagship iOS application. In this role, you will drive the evolution of our app by reinventing the codebase, raising the technical bar, and building new products that expand our reach. You will have the opportunity to re-architect our core app, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and lead the development of new features aimed at both veterinary professionals and horse owners. Your work will be central to supporting our growth and delivering innovative solutions as we continue to shape the future of equine health.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 As Senior iOS Developer, you will play a central role in shaping our mobile product and technical direction. Your main responsibilities include:
 


* Leading the redevelopment of our iOS codebase to enable new features and improved user experience.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions.
* Taking ownership of app performance, security, and scalability.
* Mentoring colleagues and supporting team development.
* Integrating, maintaining, profiling and optimising ML-models running on device in collaboration with ML team.



  





**Who You Are** 




 We are seeking someone who combines technical expertise with a collaborative mindset. You should have:
 


* At least 7 years of iOS development experience, with a record of leading complex projects.
* Proficiency in Swift and SwiftUI, and strong knowledge of iOS frameworks.
* Experience integrating backend APIs and optimizing app performance.
* Strong communication skills and a willingness to mentor others.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and motivated by real-world impact.
* Experience with CoreML or Vision Frameworks is a plus.



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 At Sleip AB, you’re not just coding an app—you’re shaping the future of equine health. You’ll work in an energetic, mission-driven team where your contributions directly impact how veterinary professionals care for horses worldwide. With strong backing from leading investors and strategic partners like Boehringer Ingelheim, our rapid growth trajectory means unparalleled opportunities to innovate, lead, and grow in your career.
 



  





**How to Apply** 




 If you are passionate about mobile innovation and eager to make a difference in equine health, we welcome your application. If you would like more information or have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact our recruitment consultant Mitra Frost or Elin Lidström at Novare, email: mitra.frost@novare.se / elin.lidstrom@novare.se

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
*Stories have the power to make the ordinary extraordinary. They help us think bigger, see beyond ourselves, and deepen our connection with others.* 




  





*As one of the world’s leading audiobook and e-book streaming platforms, Storytel brings unlimited listening to millions of users across 25 markets. Driven by our purpose, “Leading the future of storytelling, we move the world through stories”, Storytel Group inspires and entertains people around the world by blending innovation with tradition. We bring stories to life across various formats for everyone to discover. Anytime. Anywhere.* 




  





 Ready for your next chapter? We’re looking for a
 **Senior Backend Engineer** 
 to join our Content Platform team!
 



  





**About the Team** 




 The Content Platform domain is the backbone of Storytel, ingesting and processing all content from publishers to the platform, enriching it with metadata, and building systems that organize knowledge about creators and content. Over three million audiobooks, ebooks, and podcasts flow through our processing pipeline and are made available to other teams via APIs and event streams.
 



  





 The domain mission is to be a key driver for Storytel’s product and commercial strategy by making book metadata a competitive advantage for Storytel. The team leverages AI and automation to scale the creation and enhancement of book metadata, fueling product innovation and unlocking the full potential of generative AI-powered experiences.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 Take the next step in your career as a Senior Backend Engineer at Storytel! You’ll work with cutting-edge technologies alongside other experienced colleagues. As a senior backend engineer, you’ll be involved in – and be asked to lead some of – our modernisation journey, but also the maintenance of the existing platform. Your skills and experience will also be valuable in supporting and coaching more junior engineers.
 



  





**About You** 




***To be a good match for this role, we believe that you have:***



* Solid knowledge of backend development in
 *Java* 
 , and experience of more polyglot environments – today we maintain services in mostly Java, but even some in
 *Golang* 
 ,
 *Kotlin,* 
 and
 *C#* 
 .
* A great understanding of modern architecture, system design, data structures, and software engineering principles, and knowing how to apply them to design scalable and robust solutions.
* Experience with deploying and operating services in a cloud environment (we use
 *Google Cloud Platform* 
 , but experience from other platforms is just as valuable).
* A curious and positive mindset about the potential of LLMs, both as a tool to enhance your own workflow and as a component for building innovative product features.
* Experience working closely with business and product stakeholders, and understanding their needs. You can transition from the idea stage to scalable and maintainable solutions.
* Passion for building great products that people love, always making technology choices with this end goal in mind.



  





 But most importantly, we believe that the right mindset and attitude are more valuable than ticking all the technical boxes, so if you feel that this could be the right job and environment for you to learn and develop yourself, alongside others in the team, do not hesitate to get in touch with us!
 



  





**Join a world of stories** 




 At Storytel, we’re a team of creative story lovers who thrive on collaboration and new ideas. Our workplace is friendly, dynamic, and full of opportunities to experiment and make an impact. We believe in trust, flat hierarchies, and empowering you to grow with us.
 



  





 Does this sound like your next story? Simply fill out the application form and share your CV or LinkedIn profile – no cover letter needed. Answer a few questions, and you’re all set.

title: Product Developer FW
description:
Are you a dynamic and experienced Product Developer FW with a passion for collaborating towards success in a high-tech, innovative environment? Join our R&D department at ASSA ABLOY Opening Solutions, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Product Developer FW**
 You would be involved in the development and maintenance of the ARX security system, ensuring it remains at the forefront of high-security solutions. You would play a key role in developing software for embedded systems, from initial design to implementation, testing, maintenance and continuous improvements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Write and maintain software in C for embedded Linux systems, contributing to the development of new features, enhancements, and system maintenance.
* Work closely with other software developers and testers to ensure the success of the project and alignment with stakeholders.
* Contribute to design documentation, including creating and reviewing design proposals and ensuring that the development process adheres to standards.
* Utilize Python for testing tools and troubleshooting embedded systems to ensure high quality and efficiency.
* Drive improvements in the system, ensuring maintainability and performance optimization for embedded devices.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Proven hands-on experience in embedded software development using C in a Linux environment.
* Strong knowledge of system design, design documentation, and software testing.
* Familiarity with tools like JIRA, GitLab, and Confluence; knowledge in Python coding, TCP/UDP protocol and basic electronics is additionally valued.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a structured, analytical manner.


 We are looking for someone with strong communication skills who can collaborate effectively across teams and stakeholders. You are a natural team player who enjoys sharing knowledge and supporting colleagues, while also being proactive and self-driven with a “can-do” attitude. A structured and organized way of working helps you manage multiple tasks and keep projects on track. At the same time, you are open-minded and adaptable, thriving in a dynamic environment where priorities can change quickly.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* We offer a flexible hybrid working model, with 2–3 days per week in the office.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be subjected to a background screening. The performance of the background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Java Developer
description:
Avigna is hiring for a
 **"Java Developer."**
 Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for a
 **Java Developer** 
 to join the team to build, support, and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient cost and schedule management. If you want to grow and build the foundation on the IT platform working across multiple customers, look no further.
   

  

 In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day
   

  

**Location: Stockholm**
**Experience: 5+ yrs**
**Must-Haves**
* Proven experience in agile software development
* Proficiency in SOA technologies (SOAP/REST)
* Hands-on expertise in Java and Spring Boot
* CI/CD pipeline experience using Jenkins and Bitbucket
* Front-end development with Angular, JavaScript, and TypeScript
* Containerization using Docker and OpenShift
* Database integration with MongoDB and MariaDB/MySQL
* System architecture involving digital certificates, PKI/CA, and HSM
* Domain experience in healthcare
* Implementation of authentication/authorization protocols: OAuth/OICD, SAML
