title: Cyber Security Manager - Team Manager for Cyber Security Architecture Team
description:
**Job Description**
 To provide a secure, trustworthy, and always available experience to our customers, we are now transforming the way we address the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have created a new Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments. Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a unit that focuses on Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering, with the mission to protect our customers, colleagues, and company by establishing and managing safe and secure technology use and at the same time path the way forward for our Cyber Security Architecture.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to lead our Cyber Security Architecture team, to drive our delivery and services portfolio throughout the whole H&M Group and all our brands. You will report to the Head of Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering Unit.
   

  

 We are looking for a strong
 **Manager** 
 and principal leader.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Manage day-to-day activities of the Cyber Security Architecture team, ensuring operational and performance objectives are met.
* Spear-head team-level budgeting, planning, and roadmap initiatives.
* Cultivate professional development within the team to ensure relevant skills and qualifications.
* Contribute to the Cyber Security strategy and ensure team alignment.
* Contextualize corporate strategic vision, conducting analysis, identifying opportunities, and defining strategic activities in the Cyber Security domain.
* Analyze, design, develop, and maintain roadmaps and implementation plans to enable future-state security capabilities, ensuring organizational resilience, stability, and operational excellence.
* Drive continuous improvement and simplification to enhance end-to-end business value, collaborating across the organization to lower the total cost of ownership.
* Develop control mechanisms to manage Cyber risks in alignment with business risk appetite.
* Act as a facilitator for complex technical topics, collaborating across functions to ensure comprehensive consultation.


**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
* Experience in multiple cyber security areas, e.g. Device security, Application security, Data security, Cloud security, Network security, Secure development, and IAM.
* Demonstrated skills and experience in information security within an international and diverse context.
* Previous leadership experience of a senior team, with up to seven direct reports
* Proven experience and a structured approach to KPI and OKR driven deliveries, and alignment to other organisational units
* Leadership understanding of team dynamics and staff personal development.
* A bachelor's degree in a related field.
* Preferred certifications: CISSP, CISM, CompTia Security+, Identity Management Institute (IMI) certifications.
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: EMEA Revenue Operations Data Analyst
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 EMEA Revenue Operations team in Sinch is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will require a strong foundation in Salesforce, Excel, Tableau, Power BI as well as other advanced reporting tools, coupled with prior management consulting experience to drive data-driven insights, stakeholder engagement, and strategic decision-making across the EMEA region. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable intelligence to support business growth and efficiency for the region.
   

  

**In this role you'll make a significant impact by driving the activities in the following areas:**
**Data Analysis & Reporting**
* Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets from Salesforce, Excel, Tableau and other platforms.
* Develop interactive dashboards and visualizations in Excel, Tableau and Salesforce.
* Deliver regular and ad-hoc reports to senior management and business stakeholders.


**Business Insights & Strategy**
* Translate complex data findings into clear business recommendations.
* Identify trends, opportunities, and risks to support regional business objectives.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to optimize processes and improve performance.


**Stakeholder Engagement & Consulting**
* Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the EMEA region.
* Leverage consulting experience to manage expectations, challenge assumptions, and align on data-driven decisions.
* Gather and translate business requirements into actionable data needs, collaborating closely with data engineering teams to design models and enable effective reporting and BI solutions.


**Data Governance & Best Practices**
* Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with company standards.
* Promote data-driven decision-making across the organization.
* Drive adoption of dashboards and reporting tools within business teams.


**Key Tasks And Responsibilities**
* Maintain and optimize Tableau, Excel, Salesforce reports and dashboards for business needs.
* Design and automate Excel-based models for recurring analysis.
* Build advanced Tableau, Salesforce dashboards to support leadership decision-making.
* Provide performance metrics, KPIs, and business health reporting for EMEA.
* Partner with Sales, Finance, Marketing, Product and Operations teams on cross-regional projects.
* Support strategic initiatives by providing scenario modeling and forecasting.
* Deliver clear documentation and training for stakeholders using analytics tools.


**Requirements**
**Professional Experience**
* 5-7 years in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics consulting.
* Minimum of 2 years in management consulting or a similar advisory role.
* Strong focus on accuracy, detail, and precision.


**Technical Skills**
* Advanced Salesforce reporting and data extraction.
* Proficiency in Excel (advanced formulas, pivot tables; macros preferred).
* Expertise in Tableau, Looker, and other visualization tools.
* Nice-to-have: experience with data warehouses (Snowflake) and data build tools (DBT).
* Ability to interpret complex datasets and transform them into actionable insights.


**Stakeholder & Communication Skills**
* Proven ability to influence, collaborate, and communicate effectively with senior stakeholders.
* Skilled at presenting data in a clear and compelling way.


**Education & Languages**
* Degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, or related field.
* English fluency required; additional EMEA languages are an advantage.


 Our corporate language is English,
 **please submit your application in English** 
 .
   

  

 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation outside the EU at this time. Applicants must:
   

  

* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.


**OUR HIRING PROCESS**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Data Analyst to the division Business & Retail Banking | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you driven by the potential of leveraging data as a strategic asset within an organization? Are you eager to uncover valuable insights that provide a broad understanding of SEB and our customer base? Do you have a keen interest in doing in-depth data analysis with new tools in cloud-environment? If so, this opportunity could be the perfect fit for you!
   

  

 The Business & Retail Banking (BRB) division is now strengthening the Data, Analytics & CIO organization further to accelerate the journey towards a more data driven and customer-centric bank. We are a team with highly engaged and skillful data and analytics professionals, and we are now looking for a Data Analyst, who will report to me, Magnus Klint, Head of Customer Insight Analytics.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving initiatives within the area of data and analytics, like value driven analytical use cases, usage of new technical capabilities, and more. SEB is committed to accelerating its data and analytics journey, underscoring the imperative to mobilize and bolster expertise and execution capabilities.
   

  

 Your primary focus will be around deepening our understanding of customer behavior, needs, and preferences. This entails identifying, analyzing, exploring, and interpreting trends and patterns within complex datasets through detailed data-driven analyses. Also, you will actively support internal stakeholders by proactively uncovering potential opportunities across various areas.
   

  

 Further, you will be part of a center of analytical excellence dedicated to identifying business opportunities, exploring customer segments, product categories, and distribution channels, fostering a more data-centric and customer-focused way of working.
   

  

 You'll also be important in building the new cloud-based data- and analytics platform, shaping our future environment aligning with SEB: s long-term strategic direction. That includes futureproofing of tools and data, but also a new way of working and ensuring competence needed.
   

  

 The position is in Arenastaden, Solna.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
 We are seeking individuals who hold an enthusiasm for data, business acumen, and adaptability in dynamic environments. We encourage proactive engagement, both presently and with a forward-thinking mindset.
   

  

 Ideal candidates will hold an academic degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Economics, or a related discipline, coupled with a couple of years of hands-on experience in quantitative analytics. Proficiency in cloud-based environments, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with a focus on data and analysis, is highly desirable. Additionally, familiarity with programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL for data analysis is advantageous. The role also requires prior experience with data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau. Experience from Financial services is merited.
   

  

 The ability to effectively communicate and present findings to stakeholders is of great importance. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish. Strong interpersonal skills are key for collaborating within our cross-functional teams and engaging with stakeholders. We value individuals who demonstrate dedication, proficiency, and a collaborative spirit in their work.
   

  

**Welcome with your application**
 Attach your CV and a short personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the data driven journey at BRB. Since we select candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2025-10-02. If you have questions about the position, please contact Magnus Klint, Head of Customer Insight Analytics, phone +46 70-76 76 142 or e-mail magnus.klint@seb.se
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Graduate Commercial Strategy Associate (Fixed-term, 12 months)
description:
Meet Unit4. With over 40 years of heritage, we’re an agile, fast growing, Cloud company that is on a mission to redefine Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) for mid-market people-centric organizations.
   

  





 With our innovative, self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software, our customers can spend more time on meaningful high-value work. At the heart of what we do lies a simple yet profound purpose: Improve how people work by focusing on what truly matters. — A powerful statement that enables different priorities for different people.
   

  





 We’re shaping how work should feel, and we empower our people by providing them with the right tools to achieve the autonomy they need - it's what makes us unique.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 This is a hands-on, high-impact role for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments and enjoys solving problems in real time. As a Graduate Commercial Strategy Associate, you’ll work directly with the Head of ERPx Commercial Strategy & Growth to help scale ERPx as a core growth engine. You’ll be parachuted into cross-functional teams to help build processes, align priorities, and drive execution—whether that’s refining go-to-market strategy, resolving friction points, or supporting commercial initiatives. This is a “do-er” role for someone who wants to learn by doing and contribute meaningfully from day one.
   

  





**Key Responsibilities**



* Parachute into cross-functional teams to help build and operationalize strategic initiatives across Sales, Product, Marketing, and Customer Success.
* Support the design and rollout of ERPx’s go-to-market strategy, ensuring alignment across value proposition, pricing, reference strategy, partner execution, and in-market delivery.
* Build and manage recurring processes that keep teams aligned and accountable.
* Identify friction points or misalignments across functions, and propose structured, data-backed solutions to bridge them.
* Develop dashboards, reporting mechanisms, and analysis that inform leadership decisions on ERPx’s growth and scalability.
* Conduct research and analysis to identify opportunities and support commercial positioning.


**Qualifications**
* 1–3 years in consulting, business strategy, operations, or related analytical roles (internships or analyst experience welcome).
* Strong problem-solving skills, comfort with data, and ability to translate insights into clear actions.
* Experience working across multiple teams or functions, with demonstrated ability to drive alignment.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, able to present complex ideas for diverse audiences.
* Interest in ERP, SaaS, or enterprise technology.



**Why Join Us?**




 This is more than a graduate role—it’s a launchpad into enterprise strategy. You’ll be embedded in a high-performing team driving one of the company’s most important growth engines: ERPx. You’ll work directly with senior leaders, gain exposure to global commercial strategy, and help shape how innovation in product, AI, services, and delivery comes together in-market.
   

  





 We’re looking for curious, driven individuals who want to learn by doing, thrive in ambiguity, and are ready to make an impact from day one.
   

  





**What We’re Looking For**



* A bias for action, someone who doesn’t just analyze but builds.
* Comfort parachuting into new teams, quickly understanding context, and helping drive progress.
* A collaborative mindset with the confidence to challenge assumptions and propose solutions.
* A passion for enterprise technology and how it transforms industries.


**Additional Information**

 Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us
   

  





  

  

 At Unit4, we offer:
   

  




* a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
* balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
* talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
* a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
* a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.

title: AWS DevOps Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 AWS DevOps Engineer
   

  

**This** 
**is** 
**Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 At Worldline, delivering an awesome payment experience that our customers love is what we burn for. Our cloud-native acquiring platform is processing billions of card transactions including authorization processing and clearing and settlement for our customers to trust. Currently, we are looking for a skilled platform-focused Senior DevOps Engineer to join our Platform Engineering team, where you'll focus on creating scalable, self-service infrastructure solutions that empowers our product teams.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
 You will help build the Engineering Platform, enabling developers to independently create, test, launch, manage, and monitor real-time authorization platform through self-service and continuous improvement. As part of a dedicated, domain-focused team, you will help design and deliver an internal platform that:
   

  

* Empowers development teams with seamless, self-service access to tools and technologies
* Minimizes non-development overhead and cross-team delays
* Reduces cognitive load around security, governance, and compliance
* Enables fast, independent software delivery
* Measures success through clear, observable business outcomes


 Your work will directly support internal teams in innovating, building, and operating at scale, and will include participating in an on-call rotation schedule.
   

  

**Who Are We Looking For?** 
  

  

* You are passionate about empowering teams to work more autonomously throughout the development process, enabling faster feature delivery and quicker recovery from production issues.
* As a self-starter, you excel at teamwork, demonstrating commitment, accountability, consistently supporting your team and collaborating effectively across groups.
* In addition to solid technical skills, you must also have:
+ Strong interpersonal and communication skills
+ Comfortable with unknowns and have a learning mindset
+ Ability to mentor engineers


**What Can't We Do Without**
 We’re looking for a skilled and experienced software developer with at least 5 years of hands-on experience, especially with Python in production environments. You know your way around version control (like Git).
   

  

* You understand the fundamentals of SSO, user authentication and access control, and have exposure to tools like AWS Cognito, Flask, and key protocols like OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect.
* You're skilled in Python and Go, and you have a strong understanding of REST APIs, HTTP(s), especially when using NGINX to manage proxies and handle requests.
* Cloud tech is second nature to you. You’ve worked extensively with AWS — think ELB, Route53, Lambda, IAM, DynamoDB, S3, RDS — and you understand cloud-native networking concepts like VPCs, subnets, peering, transit gateways, service meshes, NATs, and firewalls.
* You understand the complexities of AWS multi-account strategies and have used Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation) to automate the lifecycle of account provisioning.
* You have practical experience in CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Docker for containerization, ideally within AWS ECS.
* Degree in Computer Science, engineering, or similar. Fluent in English and/or Swedish with a valid Swedish work permit.
* Bonus points if you’ve got some experience with React too.
* If this sounds like a good fit, we’d love to hear from you.


**Skills We'd Like**
 Hands-on experience with DevOps culture, automation, lean processes, metrics, and resilience.
   

  

* AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional certification (or equivalent expertise) is a strong plus.
* Publicly available code, writing, or projects that showcase your experience.
* Experience from developing secure and/or PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Being a part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide
* Health benefits contribution
* Health check – Every 2nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape The Evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

**Learn More About Life At Worldline At Jobs.worldline.com**
 We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Consulting Associate Director- Cloud Transformation
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
At
 **Gartner Consulting** 
 , we don't just advise; we equip leaders with
 **objective, data-driven insights** 
 from our unparalleled research and advisory business. As an Associate Director, you will lead complex cloud transformations, leveraging our proprietary frameworks and
 **unique access to enterprise data and analyst expertise** 
 to help clients make the right technology choices and achieve measurable business outcomes. You will leverage your understanding of cloud architectures and emerging technologies to shape transformation journeys, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Strategic Cloud Advisory: Partner with senior stakeholders to define cloud vision, strategy, and transformation roadmaps that support business growth, agility, and resilience.
* Cloud Value Realization: Identify opportunities for cost optimization, scalability, and competitive differentiation through effective cloud utilization and modernization.
* Transformation Leadership: Lead cloud readiness assessments, business case development, and executive workshops to build consensus and drive change across business and IT functions.
* Program Oversight: Manage cloud transformation initiatives, ensuring alignment with governance, security, compliance, and financial management standards.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate complex cloud concepts in clear, business-focused language to facilitate decision-making and cross-functional collaboration.
* Continuous Improvement: Monitor cloud adoption metrics, provide actionable insights, and foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning.


**Required Experience & Skills:**
* Fluent in both Swedish & English
* Demonstrated experience in management consulting, digital transformation, or cloud strategy roles.
* Ability to translate business requirements into actionable cloud strategies and solutions, leveraging knowledge of service and deployment models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS; public, private, hybrid).
* Familiarity with major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their strategic capabilities, as well as the current trends and best practices.
* Understanding of cloud governance, security, compliance, and risk management principles.
* Experience leading cloud projects using Agile methodologies, ensuring timely delivery and adaptability to evolving client needs.
* Exceptional communication skills, with a track record of engaging and influencing senior stakeholders.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with cloud reference architectures, cloud landing zones, and modern application delivery models (containerization, serverless, microservices).
* Knowledge of data integration and migration strategies to support seamless transformation.
* Relevant cloud certifications are advantageous but not mandatory.


**Why Join Us?**
* Work with the World's Best Data: Gain unmatched access to Gartner's proprietary research, data, and a network of 2,000+ industry analysts. You'll deliver advice that is objective, actionable, and backed by the most comprehensive IT data in the world and in collaboration with a team of forward-thinking consultants in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment.
* Focus on the Right Advice, Not the Next Project: Unlike traditional consulting, our model prioritizes client success over project duration. Your goal is to provide unbiased, impactful advice, not to prolong engagements.
* Unrivalled Professional Development: Our internal knowledge sharing, direct access to analysts, and dedicated training programs ensure you're always at the forefront of cloud trends.


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100847
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**We at the Growth Hacking team** 
 have the mission to grow the user base, increase engagement, and boost revenues. We try to achieve this with a focus on product-led growth.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Manage and lead the team to ensure we build our product efficiently and effectively.
* Influence product priorities and scope, offering valuable input in decision-making.
* Communicate complex decisions clearly, weighing the pros and cons of different solutions.
* Mentor and guide engineers, helping them develop both technically and culturally.
* Leverage your experience to establish best practices across the engineering team and beyond.
* Drive project delivery by aligning with cross-functional stakeholders and ensuring the team has everything needed.
* Be hands-on—balance strategic leadership with system designs and reviews to support solutions.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and technologies, ensuring the team works with the best tools available.
* Build strong relationships and align efforts within the team and with external partners when necessary.


**What You Bring In**
* 2+ years of relevant experience as an Engineering Manager or technical leader.
* 10+ years of experience in Android development.
* Experience with coaching, mentoring, or managing teams of 5+ engineers.
* Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban) and ability to drive efficient development workflows.
* A strong passion for enhancing user experiences and contributing to product strategy.
* Solid understanding of the Android SDK.
* Experience with RESTful APIs.
* Proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


**It would be great if you also have**
* Knowledge of performance optimization for Android applications.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and mobile observability tools.


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Executive / Leadership**
 Team
   

  

**Growth Hacking**
 Posted
   

  

**23 days ago**

title: SAP Engagement Manager
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
   

  

 Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an SAP Engagement Manager, you will be responsible for leading and managing client engagements, ensuring successful delivery of SAP projects, and building strong, long-lasting relationships with our clients.
   

  

 Do you want to make a significant impact and advance your career in a collaborative and innovative environment with well-known customers this could be the role for you!
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Understanding client's needs, aligning project objectives with company goals, and ensuring the successful completion of the project at hand.
* Lead SAP implementation projects from inception to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Play a central role in building, maintaining and enhancing client relationships and working collaboratively with solution architects and technical consultants for preparing appropriate response to RFP documents.
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with project delivery, ensuring smooth execution and client satisfaction.


**Your profile**
* Minimum 10 years of experience in SAP project management with good delivery or pre-sales background having demonstrated experience in managing projects.
* Strong understanding of SAP solutions and proven ability to manage complex projects, lead cross-functional teams and ability to respond to RFP and estimation capabilities.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clients and team members.


*Note: Nordic-based and fluency in English; proficiency in Swedish is preferred. Open to travel.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness.
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.


**Application**
*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.
   

  

 With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com
