title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Job Description** 




  





 Job Summary We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Data Engineer with deep expertise in Informatica ETL and a strong architectural mindset focused on data sourcing and enterprise data platforms.
 



 The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and optimizing data pipelines and data products across a modern data ecosystem, including Azure, Databricks, and DevOps environments.
 



 Experience in SAFe Agile delivery and knowledge of Data Product architecture on enterprise data lakes is essential.
 



 Key Responsibilities
 



 • Lead the design and development of robust ETL workflows using Informatica/ PowerCenter/IICS/IDMC.
 



 • Architect and implement scalable data sourcing strategies from diverse systems (on prem, cloud, APIs).
 



 • Ensure data quality, lineage, and governance across ingestion pipelines.
 



 • Design logical and physical data models aligned with business domains and data product principles.
 



 • Contribute to the architecture of enterprise data lakes and data platforms.
 



 • Define standards for metadata, schema evolution, and data partitioning.
 



 • Build and optimize data pipelines on Azure Data Services (Data Factory, Synapse, ADLS).
 



 • Develop and manage Databricks notebooks and workflows for data transformation and analytics.
 



 • Integrate cloud-native tools for monitoring, logging, and performance tuning.
 



 • Implement CI/CD pipelines for data workflows using tools like Azure DevOps, Git, and Terraform.
 



 • Automate deployment and testing of ETL jobs and data pipelines.
 



 • Actively participate in SAFe Agile ceremonies, sprint planning, and backlog grooming.
 



 • Collaborate with Product Owners, Data Architects, and Business Analysts to deliver data solutions.
 



 • Contribute to the design and implementation of data products that serve analytical and operational needs.
 



 • Ensure alignment with enterprise data strategy and governance frameworks. Required Skills & Qualifications
 



 • 10+ years of experience in Data Engineering, with strong hands-on expertise in Informatica ETL.
 



 • Proven experience in data architecture, especially in data sourcing and data lake platforms.
 



 • Strong knowledge of Azure Data Services, Databricks, and cloud-native data engineering.
 



 • Exposure to DevOps practices and tools for data pipeline automation.
 



 • Experience working in SAFe Agile environments.
 



 • Solid understanding of data governance, metadata management, and data quality frameworks.
 



 • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. Preferred Qualifications
 



 • Certifications in Azure, Informatica, or Databricks.
 



 • Experience with data mesh or data product architecture.
 



 • Familiarity with Python, SQL, and Spark.

title: Information Security Officer
description:
I'm interested
   

  

 At Söderberg & Partners, innovation, trust, and security are core to everything we do. As our organization continues to grow, we are looking for a skilled and experienced Information Security Officer (ISO) to help protect our clients’ data, uphold regulatory compliance, and strengthen our cyber resilience.
   

  

 As an Information Security Officer, you will be part of the Information Security team, based in Stockholm and will report to the Chief Information Security Officer. You’ll play a key role in advising and supporting companies under the Söderberg & Partners brand - across insurance, wealth management, and fintech - with hands-on security leadership, ICT-risk management, and compliance efforts.
   

  

 You will also act as an internal consultant, providing information security expertise and services to affiliated companies within the group.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm (Hybrid), with regular travel to Oslo and Copenhagen
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Serve as Information Security Officer for selected companies under the Söderberg & Partners brand (primarily in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark)
* Work with assignments and projects within our information security team, like risk assessments, and internal/external audits Develop and manage security policies, awareness programs, and third-party risk processes
* Support security incident response and assessments of supplier and customer security
* Secure compliance with regulations such as DORA, EBA guidelines and other regulations
* Educate stakeholders, including key roles, end users and management
* Collaborate with business, IT, and compliance teams to embed a pragmatic, business-aligned approach to security


**Skills & Requirements**
 What You Bring
   

  

* Proven experience as an Information Security Officer or in a senior information security role as an employee or consultant
* Strong knowledge of information security frameworks (e.g. ISO/IEC 27001/2), risk management, and European financial regulations
* Strong documentation skills (security policies etc.)
* Knowledge of technologies and processes within IT and cybersecurity - IT-operations, cloud security (Microsoft Azure), and secure development practices
* Fluent in Swedish and English (Norwegian, Danish, or Dutch is a plus)
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills


 A bonus is if you also have certifications in information security (e.g. CISSP, CISM, ISO Lead Implementer) and/or experience working with IT frameworks like ITIL, COBIT
   

  

 What We Offer
   

  

* A central role in a growing security team at one of Sweden’s top financial advisory firms
* Exciting, varied tasks and initiatives across the Nordics
* A modern HQ in central Stockholm
* A culture that values initiative, analyses, innovation, and collaboration
* Continuous learning and development in a purpose-driven company focused on scalability and growth


 We recruit continuously—submit your application today and be part of our journey!
   

  

 Start Date: As soon as possible, by agreement
   

  

 Great Place to Work
   

  

* Växande bolag med stora visioner
* Centrala och moderna kontor
* Utrymme för nytänkande och personlig utveckling
* Bra förmåns- och försäkringspaket
* Engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare
* Omtanke om kunden och varandra
* Growing company with big visions
* Space for innovation and personal development
* Good benefit and insurance package
* Committed and competent employees
* Care for both customer and colleagues


**About The Company**
 Söderberg & Partners is a leading non-bank provider of wealth management, corporate pension and insurance services in the Nordic region and the Netherlands. The company offers a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, government institutions and individuals. Founded in 2004, the firm is headquartered in Stockholm and maintains offices across Europe. The firm ownership is divided between Mr. P-O Söderberg, the founders and management together with two of the world’s largest financial investors – KKR and TA Associates.

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
**At Professional Galaxy AB,** 
 we help businesses leverage technology to simplify operations and drive growth. We deliver tailored, scalable IT solutions using Java, Python, Cloud platforms, and more. Our consultants specialize in IT and engineering roles, including Software Development, DevOps, Systems Engineering, Project Management, Cybersecurity, and Finance.
   

  

 With expertise in sourcing and contract management, we optimize supply chains, strengthen supplier relationships, and support strategic procurement. By combining technical skills with business insight, we enable clients to overcome today’s challenges and prepare for tomorrow’s opportunities.
   

  

**Your role**
 Co-develop a dedicated AI infrastructure for SEB HR, while providing hands-on training and mentorship. The goal is to build internal capabilities, enable operational independence, and transition existing AI models into a newly built environment.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Proven experience with GCP services and ML engineering workflows.
* Strong Python programming skills, with the ability to build and debug ML pipelines.
* Skilled in knowledge transfer: able to explain best practices, architecture choices, and scalable ML setups on GCP.
* Team-oriented mindset: supports shared goals, takes ownership, and fosters learning.
* Deep practical knowledge of:
* Vertex AI: Training, deployment, monitoring, orchestration
* BigQuery: Scalable analytics and warehousing
* Cloud Storage: Raw and processed data storage
* Dataflow: Preprocessing and pipeline orchestration
* Engine / TPUs / GPUs: High-performance training
* Cloud Functions / Cloud Run: Model serving and automation
* IAM: Access control for secure ML workflows
* Monitoring & Logging: ML system observability
* Registry: Container and artifact storage
* IaC: Terraform / Deployment Manager for GCP resources
* CI/CD: Cloud Build / GitHub Actions integration
* Auth & Access: OAuth 2.0, IAM roles, service accounts


**Start date:** 
 2025-11-03
   

  

**End date:** 
 2026-04-30
   

  

**Offer due date:** 
 2025-09-21
   

  

 We often present candidates on an ongoing basis. This means that we sometimes remove the assignment from our website earlier than the last application day. If you are interested in an assignment, we recommend that you apply immediately.
   

  

 Please feel free to contact Ritu Sareen, ritu.sareen@progalaxy.se, if you have any queries related to the job!

title: Senior Manager till Onsite Solutions i Stockholm
description:
Är du en erfaren ledare inom ekonomiområdet med en passion för att driva förändring och utveckling? KPMG Onsite Solutions söker nu en Senior Manager till vårt team i Stockholm, där du får möjlighet att leda och coacha vårt team av engagerade konsulter inom ekonomi. Har du arbetat som konsult, controller, redovisare eller i liknande roller och vill ta nästa steg i karriären? Drivs du av att utveckla och inspirera andra kollegor? Då kan det vara dig vi söker! Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med både ledarskap och ekonomi, samtidigt som du bidrar till vår affärsutveckling och lönsamhet. Utöver att leda vårt team, kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i att forma och utveckla våra kunders framtida ekonomifunktioner.
   

  

**Om oss**
 KPMG Onsite Solutions är en social och sammansvetsad avdelning med team i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Vi erbjuder interimslösningar inom Finance, BI och Data Analytics och efterfrågan på våra tjänster är hög. Bland våra kunder finns några av Sveriges största bolag, små- och mellanstora bolag och spännande start-ups. Som Senior Manager hos oss får du en unik möjlighet att bidra med din expertis och realisera dina visioner.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Senior Manager på Onsite Solutions kommer du att ha ett övergripande ansvar för vårt team i Stockholm. Du leder och coachar konsulter och Team Leaders och ingår i ledningsgruppen för att bidra till avdelningens utveckling och lönsamhet. Ditt ansvar omfattar bland annat att leda personal, driva förändringsprojekt och att delta i ledningsgruppen. Du kommer att arbeta konsultativt i komplexa kundmiljöer, ofta i förändring eller tillväxt.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av kvalificerat ekonomiarbete, såsom, controlling, redovisning, CFO-roll eller motsvarande, som konsult eller som fast anställd.
* Tidigare erfarenhet från konsultverksamhet, såsom, konsultbyrå, management consulting eller motsvarande.
* Akademisk examen inom ekonomi (kandidat- eller mastersnivå).
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda team och/eller konsulter.
* Förmåga att bidra till affärsutveckling och försäljning.
* God förståelse för ekonomisk styrning, processförbättring och förändringsledning.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska.
* Vana att arbeta med Excel och affärssystem på avancerad nivå.


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av roller som interimskonsult.
* Vana att arbeta nära ledningsgrupper och styrelser.
* Spetskompetens inom t.ex. koncernredovisning, IFRS, hållbarhetsrapportering, BI & Analytics eller liknande.
* Internationell erfarenhet eller samarbete med globala team.


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 Som Senior Manager hos oss får du möjlighet att bli kollega med några av Sveriges vassaste specialister inom ekonomi. Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk och stimulerande arbetsmiljö i hjärtat av Stockholm, där du blir en del av ett tight team med en sammanhållning utöver det vanliga. Hos oss har du chansen att påverka hur Onsite Solutions växer och utvecklas. Vi erbjuder ett fritt arbete med stort eget ansvar, där du får möjlighet att arbeta med några av Sveriges mest intressanta bolag.
   

  

**Vill du vara med och göra skillnad med oss?** 
 Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av en inspirerande arbetsplats med engagerade kollegor. Har du frågor eller funderingar gällande tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Talent Acquisition Specialist Anna Landar på anna.landar@kpmg.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Nordic Technology Operating Model Manager
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are looking for a senior professional with strong expertise in compliance and risk management within technology operations to lead and drive our Technology Operating Model
 
 across the Nordics. The position is embedded in Deloitte’s internal IT function.
   

  

  





 This senior role is pivotal in ensuring that our Technology Operating Model (TOM) adheres to regulatory requirements and industry standards, mitigating risks associated with technology solutions and operations. You will lead governance frameworks, enforce compliance policies, and work closely with legal and audit teams to ensure Deloitte’s technology solutions meet all regulatory requirements.
   

  

  





**Key Responsibilities**




***Compliance and Risk Management:***



* Lead and maintain a repository of compliant IT solutions aligned with regulatory and internal standards.
* Identify, assess, and mitigate risks related to the Technology Operating Model.
* Develop, implement, and enforce policies and procedures to ensure ongoing compliance across technology operations.
* Collaborate with legal, audit, and business stakeholders to ensure alignment with evolving regulatory requirements.


***Governance:***
* Manage a backlog and pipeline of TOM compliance assessments and risk reviews.
* Establish and maintain governance frameworks that support compliance and risk mitigation efforts.


***Performance and Continuous Improvement:***
* Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to compliance and risk management.
* Use data-driven insights to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvements in technology governance.


**Qualifications**

**We are looking for candidates who have:**



* Bachelor’s degree
* 5 – 10 years of proven experience in compliance, risk management, and governance within complex IT environments.
* Strong understanding of regulatory frameworks relevant to technology (e.g., GDPR, SOX, ISO).
* Experience working with internal audit, legal teams, or regulatory bodies.
* Ability to bridge the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders, translating compliance requirements into actionable plans.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and projects.
* Work permit in Sweden is required
* English on a professional level, Swedish is a bonus


**Desired Skills**
* Familiarity with ITIL frameworks and best practices.
* Knowledge of solution architecture, cloud hosting, and cybersecurity from a compliance perspective.
* Experience in stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration.
* Leadership experience


**Additional Information**

**Application**




 You apply online. Your application should consist of:
   

  

  




* CV
* A motivation for why you are interested in the role


 We work continuously with selection for the position. Send in your application as soon as possible.
   

  

  


 As a qualitative step in Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check to increase knowledge about our future employees, ensure a safe working environment for our employees, and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is conducted in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/
   

  

  





  

  

**Questions**




 If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Kristoffer Kaspersen (kkaspersen@deloitte.dk). For questions about the recruitment process, you are warmly welcome to contact Sara Johansson, responsible recruiter at Deloitte (sajohansson@deloitte.se).
   

  

  





 We look forward to your application!
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Integrationsarkitekt
description:
**Var med och bidra till att göra Sverige till ett föregångsland inom hållbart resande.** 




 Med hjälp av data och digitalisering finns stora möjligheter att göra det enklare för resenärer att välja kollektivtrafik framför bil eller flyg.
 



  





 Nu söker vi en tekniskt driven integrationsarkitekt som vill vara med och utveckla den nationella infrastrukturen för biljettförsäljning i kollektivtrafiken. Vill du bidra med teknisk arkitektur, standardisering och samverkan mellan aktörer? Då är det här rätt roll för dig!
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som integrationsarkitekt får du ett helhetsansvar för den tekniska arkitekturen och integrationslösningarna kopplade till Samtrafikens distributionsplattform. Plattformen utvecklas och förvaltas av vår externa leverantör, men du representerar Samtrafiken i tekniska diskussioner, forum och projekt – med fokus på att säkerställa att lösningar utformas och implementeras i linje med våra behov, standarder och långsiktiga mål.
 



  





 En viktig del av tjänsten är att bygga upp expertis inom OSDM – en europeisk standard för biljett- och produktdistribution – och bidra till att den används korrekt och konsekvent i Sverige. Du samordnar tolkningen av standarden tillsammans med våra partners och återförsäljare, och fungerar som rådgivande teknisk länk mellan utveckling, förvaltning, verksamhet och externa aktörer.
 



 Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt, nära utvecklingsteam, test och förvaltning. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till något större – att förenkla resandet för människor och göra kollektivtrafiken mer tillgänglig.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Ansvara för teknisk arkitektur och integrationer i distributionsplattformen
* Utveckla expertkunskap om OSDM-standarden och dess tillämpning i Sverige
* Delta i projekt och tekniska utredningar och säkerställa att nya lösningar byggs rätt från början
* Fungera som rådgivare, tekniskt bollplank och brygga mellan utveckling och verksamhet
* Leda arkitektforum och delta i diskussioner med externa aktörer och partners
* Dokumentera lösningar och kommunicera dem till olika målgrupper



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Har flerårig erfarenhet av systemintegrationer, API:er och teknisk arkitektur
* Är van vid att arbeta med tekniska analyser och dokumentation
* Har förmåga att felsöka och förstå komplexa tekniska miljöer
* Förstår hur komponenter samverkar i distribuerade system
* Är trygg i dialog med både tekniska och icke-tekniska roller
* Har en ödmjuk och nyfiken inställning samt ett stort tekniskt intresse



  





 Meriterande är erfarenhet från kollektivtrafikbranschen, en bakgrund som utvecklare och erfarenhet av tekniska standarder och/eller arbete med verksamhetskritiska system.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* Ett meningsfullt jobb med samhällsnytta
* Trevliga arbetskamrater och en arbetsplats med återkommande höga nöjdhetsbetyg
* Sex veckors betald semester (ingen övertids- eller restidsersättning)
* Friskvårdsbidrag (maximal nivå)
* Ersättning för visst fritidsresande med kollektivtrafik
* Sjukvårdsförsäkring (f.n. PrivatAccess Silver hos Euro Accident) (Vi har tittat på alternativ.)
* Erbjudande om hälsoundersökningar med jämna intervall
* Föräldravillkor som i flera fall är bättre än de i kollektivavtalet
* Möjlighet att låna höj- och sänkbart bord, arbetsstol och arbetslampa för en bättre arbetsmiljö i hemmet
* Möjlighet att nyttja förmån för personalcykel



  





**Övrigt** 





 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning.
 




  






 Centralt i Stockholm, vägg i vägg med Stockholms Centralstation, hittar du vårt kontor.
 
 Vi arbetar från kontoret och på distans – du avgör till stor del fördelningen samtidigt som det alltid är verksamheten som styr.
 



  





 Vår kultur är prestigelös och samarbetsinriktad. Vi hjälper varandra, lär oss av varandra och ser till att ha roligt på vägen.
 



  





**För mer information och ansökan** 




 Skicka CV och personligt brev till jobb@samtrafiken.se. Vi intervjuar löpande så avvakta inte med din ansökan. För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Kajsa Wejander, leveranschef, på tel. 0730-867969 eller e-post kajsa.wejander@samtrafiken.se.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Samtrafiken** 




 Samtrafiken är ett samverkans- och utvecklingsföretag inom kollektivtrafikbranschen. Genom att koppla samman landets offentliga och privata trafikaktörer skapar vi mervärde
 



 för hela branschen. Med våra tjänster, bland annat Resplus, gör vi det enkelt att söka, köpa och
 



 resa med kollektivtrafik i Sverige. Vi verkar samtidigt för att det hållbara resandet ökar och
 



 för merintäkter hos våra ägare. Vi ägs av alla regionala kollektivtrafikmyndigheter samt många av de kommersiella trafikoperatörerna med nationell trafik. Tillsammans når vi längre. www.samtrafiken.se.

title: Engineering Manager - Sound Platform
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
 We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead two of our core services teams, focused on the music area. The Sound Production and Artist Experience (SPARX) team as well as the Sound Platform (SPLAT) team. This is a pivotal role where you will oversee personnel, delivery, processes, tech strategy, and cross-team technical collaboration. You’ll be working with one of our core domains - managing the systems that ingest and manage the music provided by our artists.
   

  

 With about 4 engineers on each team, they contribute value by building a system to classify and tag our music, building efficient administrative tools and developing platform functionality for other teams to access our extensive music catalog. Currently, the teams are enhancing its metadata model to prepare our music catalog for exciting future applications.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
 In this role, you’ll have a significant influence on how the teams operate, defining the technical roadmap and target architecture. You will be managing diverse and dynamic teams and your leadership will be key in fostering a high level of psychological safety and cultivating team members across all levels of seniority.
   

  

* Lead and support the teams in development processes and practices such as standups, mob programming, and facilitating design sessions.
* Conduct 1:1s to guide team members’ growth, improving their skills, team dynamics, and career progression.
* Collaborate closely with the Product Manager and stakeholders to ensure sustainable, high-quality software delivery at a fast pace.
* Own the engineering plan concerning security, legacy, capacity, and quality.
* Manage cross-team technical deliveries and communication.


**Who You Are:**
* An experienced leader capable of coaching and growing teams of engineers, across all seniority levels.
* A strategic thinker who can create a vision for the team and turn it into reality.
* Someone who thrives on collaboration, working closely with the Product Manager and other stakeholders to ensure company-wide alignment.
* A decision-maker who can lead through coaching but knows when to step in to make key decisions.


**Requirements:**
* Strong technical background with expertise in modern software development practices, backend development (Go/Kotlin/Python), microservices, APIs and cloud technology.
* Solid understanding of system design and architecture.
* Proven experience managing and growing multiple engineering teams.
* Ability to build a psychologically safe work environment for your teams.


**Nice-to-have’s:**
* Experience in the music industry and/or sound production.
* Familiarity with GCP, BigQuery and experience working in a modern, product-driven company.


 Join us and be part of a central team, where your work will directly impact the core of Epidemic Sound's business and shape the future of sound production and management!
   

  

**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.
   

  

 Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound. In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Rikard Herlitz, Chief Tech Officer where he shares what makes developers most happy, what velocity means to him and how Epidemic Sound is in the sweet spot when it comes to AI.Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: SAP Business Process Automation Consultant
description:
Key Responsibilities:
 
  




1. Design, develop, and implement
 **automation solutions** 
 using
 **SAP BTP Process Automation, SAP Intelligent RPA, and Workflow Management** 
 .
2. Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify, analyze, and document automation requirements.
3. Develop and optimize
 **bots, workflows, decision logic, and integration flows** 
 to streamline end-to-end processes.
4. Work with
 **SAP UI5, CAPM, Fiori, and APIs** 
 to extend and integrate automation solutions.
5. Perform
 **unit testing, debugging, and deployment** 
 of RPA solutions in production environments.
6. Ensure automation solutions follow best practices, security guidelines, and performance optimization.
7. Support and troubleshoot automation processes, monitoring performance, and resolving production issues.
8. Document solutions, provide training to end-users, and support
 **change management** 
 .



  




 Required Skills:
 
  




1. Strong expertise in
 **SAP BTP Process Automation** 
 ,
 **SAP Intelligent RPA** 
 , and
 **SAP Workflow Management** 
 .
2. Hands-on experience in
 **SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)** 
 components such as
 **SAP CAP, UI5, Fiori, OData, and Cloud Integration (CPI)** 
 .
3. Experience in designing
 **end-to-end process automation** 
 integrating SAP S/4HANA and non-SAP systems.
4. Proficiency in scripting, debugging, and automation design principles.
5. Familiarity with cloud-native development, APIs, and microservices.
6. Strong problem-solving skills with ability to analyze complex processes and optimize them.
7. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with business and technical teams.



  




 Good to Have:
 
  




1. Exposure to
 **AI/ML services on BTP** 
 (e.g., Document Information Extraction, Conversational AI).
2. Knowledge of
 **CI/CD pipelines** 
 for automation deployment.
3. Experience in
 **Agile/Scrum methodology** 
 .
4. SAP certification(s) in
 **BTP, Process Automation, or RPA** 
 .

title: Founding Lead Engineer (Fullstack/Infra/AI)
description:
**About Novis** 




 Novis mission is to expand human knowledge by building the "Cursor for Knowledge" – a fully integrated AI product that combines chat, research, transcription, document drafting, and knowledge bases to support knowledge work end-to-end. Our team is a tight-knit group of passionate builders focused on engineering excellence. As an early-stage startup, this organization is for individuals who appreciate challenging themselves and thrive on pushing the boundaries of AI-human collaboration in a fast-moving, high-impact environment. We operate with a flat structure where every voice matters. All team members are expected to be hands-on and to contribute directly to revolutionizing knowledge work. Leadership is given to those who show initiative and consistently deliver exceptional user experiences. Work ethic and strong technical intuition are important. All engineers are expected to have strong communication skills and the ability to architect scalable systems that power complex AI capabilities.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We're looking for an exceptional Founding Lead Software Engineer (Fullstack/Infra/AI) and technical leader who wants to build the foundational systems that power Novis' AI-powered knowledge work platform and make it the best in the world.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Architect and build Novis' core infrastructure, backend systems, and AI integration layer at scale
* Lead the technical vision for our full-stack platform, from database design to AI agent orchestration and LLM optimization
* Design and implement robust, scalable systems that handle complex AI workflows, real-time collaboration, and massive knowledge processing
* Build and optimize our AI pipeline, including AI agents, RAG systems, LLM integrations, and intelligent document processing
* Establish engineering best practices, CI/CD pipelines, and monitoring systems for a rapidly growing AI platform
* Collaborate closely with the design team to ensure seamless integration between powerful backend capabilities and intuitive user experiences



  





**Who You Are** 



* A builder with multiple personal projects — whether it’s an open-source npm module, contributions to an existing project, or a small side project, anything that shows your ability to take something from 0 to 1
* Expert in full-stack development with deep experience in modern TypeScript/Node.js backend systems and cloud infrastructure
* Proficient in Next.js, React, TypeScript, Node.js, and experienced with the Vercel ecosystem
* Strong experience with AI/ML systems, including AI agents, LLM integration, RAG architectures, and evaluation frameworks (Evals)
* Deep knowledge of cloud platforms and serverless architectures, database optimizations and security
* Experience with real-time systems, background job processing, and database design (Postgres/Neon)
* Track record of building and scaling systems from 0 to 1 at early-stage startups
* Obsessed with system reliability, performance optimization, and engineering excellence
* Experience with authentication systems (e.g., WorkOS), real-time collaboration, and high-throughput data processing



  





**Tech Stack** 




 Next.js, React, TypeScript, Node.js, Vercel Cloud, Vercel AI SDK, Inngest, Ably, Postgres Neon, WorkOS, AI Agents, LLMs, RAG, Evals, etc.
 



  





**Interview Process** 




 After submitting your application, the team reviews your technical portfolio and statement of exceptional work. If your application passes this stage, you will be invited to a 15-30 minute phone interview, during which a member of our team will discuss your technical philosophy and architectural approach. If you clear the phone interview, you will proceed to next steps:
 


* Deep dive system design and coding challenge
* Meet and greet with the wider team



 Our goal is to complete the process within one week. All interviews will be conducted remotely.
 



  





**Application Requirements** 




 Please include:
 


* Your resume
* GitHub profile
* Your personal projects or open source contributions
* A short note on a fullstack, infrastructure, or AI project you're proud of



  





**Compensation & Benefits** 



* Competitive salary, bonuses and equity
* Remote work with flexible schedule
* Team off-sites and other perks



  





**Location** 




 This role is fully remote. We welcome candidates from anywhere who are excited to build the future of knowledge work.

title: Senior .NET Backend Engineer – Cloud-based Solutions
description:
The client is looking for a Senior .NET Backend Engineer to join a greenfield initiative within their trading and investment area. This is a unique opportunity to be part of building a new solution from the ground up — one that will play a central role in how the client supports business-critical decision-making in real time.
   

  

 You will work closely with experienced engineers and architects, contributing not only with your technical skills but also with your perspective and ideas. The focus will be backend development in .NET Core, but you will also be part of shaping sustainable cloud-based solutions with modern practices in DevOps, observability, and security.
   

  

 The role is hybrid, with flexibility built in, and designed for someone who thrives in a collaborative, forward-looking environment.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Strong experience in backend development with .NET Core and C#
* Background in modern cloud-based development (GCP, Azure, or AWS)
* Experience with containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), CI/CD, observability
* Understanding of DevOps, security, and maintainability in production environments
* Ability to design and implement solutions with awareness of business context


**Meritorious Qualifications**
* Experience from order management or trading systems
* Knowledge of real-time workloads, GraphQL, pub/sub
* Familiarity with Terraform, gRPC, or in-memory caching technologies


**Soft Skills For Success In This Role**
* A collaborative mindset — you enjoy working with others to achieve impact
* T-shaped profile — deep backend expertise with curiosity for the surrounding tech landscape
* Business awareness — understanding how technology directly affects the customer experience
* Problem-solving attitude — motivated by challenges in a fast-moving greenfield setup
* Confidence and drive — delivering quality solutions while contributing your own perspective

title: Sr Acquisition Account Manager
description:
**Your role at Dynatrace**
 We are looking for a candidate to fill a newly created position as an Enterprise Acquisition Account Executive in Stockholm, Sweden. In this role, you will drive sales growth through targeted acquisition efforts across various industry segments. It’s all about a “land and expand” approach amongst enterprise-grade organizations.
   

  

 As part of your responsibilities, you’ll oversee 0 to 2 existing customer accounts. Your focus will be on nurturing these relationships and expanding partnerships.
   

  

 Additionally, you’ll engage with 35 to 40 potential customers, introducing them to our offerings. After successfully converting prospects, you’ll have the chance to maintain those accounts and explore opportunities for upselling and cross selling our solutions. Collaborating closely with our high-performing sales professionals, SDRs, and partners, you’ll be on the path toward achieving ultimate success.
   

  

* Execute on territory plans to deliver maximum revenue potential within a pool of broad, regionally focused accounts.
* Collaborative pre-defined SE support based on region. 0-2 customers, 35-40 prospects, with 40 total accounts.
* Drive new logo customers, focusing on landing and expanding Dynatrace usage.
* Consult with Vice President and C-level executives to develop and implement an effective enterprise-wide strategy that maximizes the value delivered by Dynatrace; position Dynatrace relative to the competition.
* Generate velocity by establishing Dynatrace in new markets through product demonstrations, in-market events and account specific initiatives.
* Develop a contact network within named accounts and channel partners to ensure Dynatrace can be sold broadly and effectively.
* Work closely with Dynatrace functional areas such as sales engineering, marketing, legal, finance and other lines of business to develop and execute a solution strategy to meet customer business needs.
* Ensure your customers’ implementations are wildly successful.


**What Will Help You Succeed**
**Minimum Requirements:**
* HS diploma or GED AND a minimum of one year of experience in closing enterprise software sales.


**Preferred Requirements:**
* You show a successful track record in Enterprise software sales across many business functions within the executive level of a customer.
* You can manage sales cycles within complex organizations, while compressing decision cycles. You have outstanding organizational and communication skills (written and oral, negotiation and presentations skills).
* You are confident in building a diverse territory plan and have familiarity in leveraging a sales ecosystem.
* You have proven experience in acquiring new business.
* You thrive in high-velocity situations and can think/act with a sense of urgency.
* You are a motivated and tenacious self-starter who consistently delivers high performance against quota, driven by VP- and C-level relationships.
* You know how to build and execute business plans and sales plays.
* You know how to collaborate and co-sell internally across all supporting resources to maximize your effectiveness and advance the sales process (familiar with MEDDPIC).
* You are familiar with the observability and modern application market.


**Why you will love being a Dynatracer**
* Dynatrace is a leader in unified observability and security.
* We provide a culture of excellence with competitive compensation packages designed to recognize and reward performance.
* Our employees work with the largest cloud providers, including AWS, Microsoft, and Google Cloud, and other leading partners worldwide to create strategic alliances.
* The Dynatrace platform uses cutting-edge technologies, including our own Davis hypermodal AI, to help our customers modernize and automate cloud operations, deliver software faster and more securely, and enable flawless digital experiences.
* Over 50% of the Fortune 100 companies are current customers of Dynatrace.


 Please review the Dynatrace privacy policy here: https://www.dynatrace.com/company/trust-center/policies/recruitment-privacy-notice

title: Project Planner/Engineer
description:
At Aquatech, we tackle the challenges of water scarcity and complexity by leveraging technology, expertise, and financing to deliver comprehensive solutions that reduce carbon and recycled water footprint. As a leading global provider of water and process technology solutions, we help the world's most recognized companies achieve their sustainability and operational goals by implementing innovative approaches for water reuse, desalination, minimal and zero liquid discharge, and critical minerals recovery. Our work catalyzes the transition toward a more sustainable future and showcases our commitment to addressing water's role in climate adaptation. Learn more at www.aquatech.com
  
Aquatech has an immediate need for a full-time Project Engineer/Planner to work on our site in Boden, Sweden.
  
The ideal candidate will be organized, have excellent math skills, applied creativity, mechanical skills, problem-solving skills, team-oriented, customer service driven, and have attention to detail. This candidate will also have experience in a project-related industry.
  
Job Description
  
Review of Project specifications
  
Preparation of Project Documents
  
Maintain the Project Master document list.
  
Lead project design coordination with internal engineering departments, external engineering agencies, and Site Contractors.
  
Coordinate engineering document submissions to customers & vendors.
  
Facilitate timely engineering reviews of vendor quotes.
  
Review vendor quotes and purchase requisitions for compliance with project specifications.
  
Responsible for accurately reporting engineering progress in the project schedule.
  
Coordinate the collection of necessary inputs to the 3D model and the resolution of issue tags.
  
Provide status, control, and progress reporting support services on projects.
  
Prepare project schedules per project requirements.
  
Verify the project progress & prepare the monthly progress report.
  
Vendor follow-up & expediting
  
Periodic vendor visits to monitor the progress.
  
Attend Customer meetings as required.
  
Support correspondence with customers via the Project manager.
  
Internal communication with all departments & AIC Assembly shop.
  
Track material status in SAP & update project status
  
Preparation of packing slips & related shipment documentation
  
Site visits during the construction phase
  
Coordinate engineering responses to RFI from subcontractors
  
Expedite critical engineering solutions during the construction phase.
  
Ensure design changes are properly communicated to the project team and incorporated into the 3D model.
  
Oversee as-built documentation for the project.
  
Work autonomously without constant guidance
  
10% International and Domestic travel will be required.
  
  

**Skill Requirements:**  

Able to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems.
  
Time management and organizational skills.
  
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret complex documents.
  
Ability to read and interpret AutoCAD engineering drawings and P&IDs.
  
Ability to communicate effectively with customers and maintain a positive attitude.
  
Ability to work with multiple disciplines on projects.
  
Ability to plan and manage multiple tasks or projects with attention to detail.
  
Ability to use MS Office software at a high level of proficiency.
  
Ability to use SAP.
  
Ability to use Primavera P6 preferred.
  
Experience using AutoCAD 2D and Plant 3D preferred.
  
  

**Essential Functions:**  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above and below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.
  
  

**Physical Job Demands:**  

Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time, limited walking, and standing.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering
  
Five (5) or more years of experience in a project-related industry
  
Prior experience with water/wastewater infrastructure projects preferred.
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: R&D Engineer ABB Robotics
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


R&D Team Lead **Your role and responsibilities**

ABB Robotics is seeking a talented and motivated R&D Software Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development and experience in robotics. This role involves working on cutting-edge projects that enhance our robotics solutions.


In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute significantly to successful project results in technology, software, product, and/or solution development, as well as associated Intellectual Property (IP). Each day, you will act as the first point of contact in Research and Development for specific product-related issues and maintenance. You will also showcase your expertise by identifying, proposing, and implementing innovative solutions.


You will be mainly accountable for:

* Develop high quality solutions in a specific area by integrating the latest developments in technologies, tools, and methodologies into your work.
* Finding new ways of solving problems by following your ideas, creating hypotheses, and defining ways to validate them.
* Documenting work results (like findings, designs, or software), allowing others to maintain and improve them.
* Build and share knowledge within your area of expertise.

**Qualifications for the role**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or a related field.
* Proficiency in programming languages: C, C++, Python.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Experience in agile software development methodologies.
* Knowledge of robotics hardware and software integration.
* Familiarity with version control systems such as Git

**What’s in it for you?**


We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.

**More about us**


Recruiting Manager: Johan Backlund. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Pia Sandström, +4672 525 90 30; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Roger L. Gustavsson, +46 730 30 30 36.


Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.


We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: iOS Engineer
description:
At Svea Solar, we have a clear vision – to fix the planet. As Sweden’s and one of Europe’s leading players in energy technology, we are driving the energy transition with solar power and smart energy solutions.
  

  

We’re now expanding our app team with an**iOS** **Engineer**. Are you ready to join the Power Shift?

### **About the role & the team**


As our iOS Engineer, you’ll help shape our new app and its extensions, including the Apple Watch app. The app already supports tens of thousands (soon hundreds of thousands ) customers in optimizing their energy use. Our iOS app is built with SwiftUI and Swift concurrency, connected to a newly developed backend, using Apple’s latest frameworks. The minimum iOS version is 16 (but is being bumped to 18 this fall).


You’ll work closely with our iOS Staff Engineer, Product Manager, and the rest of the app team to define and deliver on our roadmap, reporting to the Engineering Manager.  

*We follow a collaboration-first policy, working three days a week from our Alvik office.*

**Your key responsibilities:**

* Take part in defining the architecture, platform, and best practices for the development of our apps on iOS and watchOS
* Write, review, and test code in a collaborative environment with other software engineers
* Work closely with other engineers, designers, and product owners to explore new solutions to problems

Contribute to the development roadmap on how to best further us on our way to rid the planet of fossil fuels  
* 

### 
**Are we a match?**

**We’re looking for you who…**

  

* Values **team success** over personal success.
* Are fluent in English - our organizational language.
* Have extensive experience in **Swift**, with solid knowledge of **Swift concurrency** and **SwiftUI**.
* Write readable, idiomatic, and maintainable Swift, and are happy to follow established coding guidelines and workflows.
* Have released at least one app on the App Store, or you have a project in the works you can show us.

**Bonus points if you:**

  

* Stays up to date with advancements in Swift 6.

### **Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you**

 **The opportunity to make an impact** – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.

**A value-driven workplace** – read more about our values here.

**The chance to own your results** – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.

**Diversity and inclusivity** – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.

**Employment benefits** – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.

**Flexibility/ hybrid work** – work up to two days a week from home.  

  

Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar

### **Who are we**


As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it **The Power Shift**. And the ones driving it? **Power Shifters**.


#ILS

### **About our recruitment process**

* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.  

  

**Ready to become a Power Shifter?** We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!
company_addresses:
Svea Solar Deutschland GmbH 
Hülchrather Straße 23  
50670 Köln

title: Game Server Engineer
description:
**About Star Stable Entertainment**


Once upon a time in 2011, the founders of Star Stable Entertainment had a vision. They wanted to create a game that could make a difference. Although half of gamers are girls and women, they were under-represented in the gaming industry, both as characters and creators. We dreamed of an epic online world where tween and teen girls could share an amazing experience. And we wanted to challenge how things were done in a male-dominated industry. Fast forward to today, and our dream has come true tenfold - Star Stable Online stands as one of the most popular MMORPGs globally! At our HQ on Södermalm, our 130 employees are thrilled to continue to welcome players to the island of Jorvik, with its breathtaking scenery, beautiful horses, and magical quests. It’s wonderful to see that our dream resonates with so many players around the world, and we can’t wait to share more stories and experiences with them!

**The position**


As a Game Server Engineer you will be part of our server team, whose mission is to scale and maintain our game server to be fit for a larger player base. We are a passionate and diverse team who love to solve our problems together, often pair-program and have a knowledge sharing culture in the form of design and code reviews on a regular basis.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop, maintain and improve our existing code base.
* Contribute well-structured code that meets game design, testability and technical requirements.
* Optimize code and data for memory usage and performance.
* Designing database schemas, writing optimized SQL queries, and managing database migrations.
* Help to identify and solve development obstacles or risks.

 **We think you have**

* Thorough understanding of modern C++ as this will be the primary language of development.
* A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrable industry experience.
* An ability to work with a large existing codebase.
* Open to learning the tools, technologies and systems used by the team.
* Critical thinking for implementing robust systems.
* Understanding of asynchronous programming concepts and paradigms.
* Familiarity with SQL database engines.
* Cross platform development experience.
* Align with agile development.
* Knowledge of automated software testing.
* Experience working with Visual Studio and version control systems (Perforce, git etc).
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Experience working in cross-discipline teams.
* A passion for programming and game development.
* A valid work permit to work in Sweden.

 **Perks for joining us?**

* A pretty sweet mission. We are developing the world's best horse-riding game for girls and we take that vision very seriously. We strive to hit that mark every single day.
* 30 vacation days (+ 3 additional squeeze days).
* A pension and insurance plan that mimics ITP1 and a parental pay top-up @90%.
* Health allowance at 5000 SEK per year.
* Private healthcare insurance
* Hybrid working model - combine WFH and being together with the team at our new office located right amidst Södermalm GameDev cluster (Magnus Ladulåsgatan 65)
* Fitness discount of 18% at SATS gym + company workout classes.
* A dog room at the office! Bring your furry friend to work!


Are you ready to be a chapter on this magical journey? Apply now! We can’t wait to hear your story!

title: Head of Embedded på det medarbetarägda konsultbolaget!
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt scale-up-bolag med en tydlig mission: att rädda världen genom smart teknik, en kodrad åt gången. Vi kopplar ihop den fysiska och den digitala världen med hållbara IoT-, Edge- och Embedded-lösningar. Som delägare får du verkligt inflytande, full transparens och tar direkt del i bolagets värdeökning genom vårt aktieprogram och resultatbonus.


Vill du vara en del av en visionär resa där teknologiska innovationer förändrar världen, en kodrad i taget – och samtidigt bli delägare i företaget?


Nu fortsätter resan att etablera i TechSeed Things i Göteborg och vi söker dig som vill bli vår Head of Embedded – och samtidigt vara med och bygga upp hela TechSeed Things som en av våra första nyckelmedarbetare.
  

  

**Om oss**


På TechSeed Things Göteborg bygger vi expertis inom inbyggda system och hållbara IoT-lösningar. Vi utvecklar teknik som kopplar den fysiska världen till molnet genom intelligenta sensorer och embedded-system, där våra ingenjörer växer genom utmanande projekt och kontinuerligt lärande för att skapa lösningar som gör verklig skillnad.


Hos oss är du inte bara en anställd – du är delägare i företaget och som en av våra första medarbetare i Göteborg får du unik möjlighet att forma bolagets utveckling från grunden.

**Om rollen**


Som Head of Embedded Software kommer du:

* **Bygga och leda teamet** – rekrytera och coacha mjukvaruutvecklare inom embedded (C/C++, Rust, Linux/RTOS, säkerhetskritiska system, automotive-protokoll).
* **Sätta teknisk riktning** – definiera arkitektur, välja tekniker och metoder för allt från krav och hårdvarunära kod till CI/CD, testautomatisering och field updates.
* **Driva affären** – identifiera kundbehov och skapa erbjudanden som knyter ihop inbyggd intelligens med Edge- och molntjänster, särskilt inom automotive-sektorn där framtidens uppkopplade fordon kräver säkra och intelligenta embedded-lösningar.
* **Bygga kulturen** – skapa en lärande, öppen och inkluderande miljö där delägarskap och gemensam passion för teknik som gör skillnad genomsyrar vardagen.
* **Arbeta operativt med våra kunder** - i konsultuppdrag mot våra kunder fortsätta leverera värde inom ditt expertområde: embedded software.

**Vi söker dig med:**

* **Dokumenterad ledarskapserfarenhet** inom embedded- eller produktutveckling, gärna med automotive-bakgrund.
* **Automotive-erfarenhet** inom embedded-utveckling (CAN, LIN, Ethernet, ISO 26262, AUTOSAR eller liknande).
* **Djup** **teknisk kompetens** inom inbyggda system (C/C++, realtid, hardware bring-up, säkerhet) och systemintegration.
* **Van att driva affärsdialoger** och utveckla kundrelationer.
* **Obehindrade kunskaper i svenska och engelska,** både tal och skrift.
* **Entreprenöriell ådra** – du triggas av att ta något från idé till skalbar verksamhet och att vara med från början.

**Om TechSeed**


Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda **delägarskap** till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår **kultur** och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora **tekniska intresse** med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoren. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som **Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies** och **Smart Buildings**.


Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:

* Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
* En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
* Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
* Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
* Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.
* Bra pensioner, försäkringar och 5000kr i friskvård

title: Senior QA Engineer
description:
**Role:**  

* Develop and execute test plans and test cases based on product requirements and specifications.
* Perform manual and automated testing to identify bugs, usability issues, or performance bottlenecks.
* Report and track defects using bug tracking tools, ensuring clear documentation of issues for developers.
* Collaborate with development teams to understand features and technical implementations.
* Conduct regression, integration, and performance testing to ensure ongoing product stability.
* Ensure compliance with quality standards and best practices throughout the software development lifecycle.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of QA processes and tools.
**Essential requirements:**  

Senior Experience in QA & Test Automation  

* Proven track record as a QA Engineer with hands-on experience in automated testing, integration testing, and performance testing within complex IT environments.

Mentoring & Leadership in Testing Practices  

* Ability to mentor and guide system and acceptance testers, particularly in large-scale, multi-team programs.

  

Strong Communication & Stakeholder Management Skills  

* Comfortable working closely with roles such as Program Test Lead, Product Owners, Architects, and Tech Leads to ensure quality alignment.

  

Experience with Large, Complex Systems/Projects  

* Background in large-scale transformation initiatives, including systems with complex integrations.

  

Structured & Detail-Oriented with Problem-Solving Skills  

* Ability to define and organize testing efforts independently, even when initial requirements are vague or evolving.

  

Technical Background in QA or Development  

* Education or experience as a developer or technical tester, capable of understanding the technical landscape and test architecture.

  

**Meritorious:** **Experience with Migration Testing**


Background in supporting data or system migrations, particularly validating transitions between legacy and modern platforms.

 **Mainframe/AS-400 Knowledge**


Familiarity with mainframe systems (e.g. AS-400)

  


  

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Stockholm  

**Period**: 01-11-2025-01-12-2026  

**Last day to apply**: 19-09-2025  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Production Order Owner
description:
**We are looking for a Production Order Owner for a global company in Lund. Start ASAP, 3 months contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

  

You will be responsible for efficiently managing both sales and production orders to ensure smooth execution. This involves creating, tracking, and closing orders while effectively communicating any deviations or changes to stakeholders.

**Your main responsibilities:**

* Create, follow up and close Sales/production orders (cost control, missing parts, order changes, etc.)
* Follow up and coordinate changes/deviations on orders and secure communication towards stakeholders
* Take appropriate actions to secure production plans can be delivered OTIF ensuring production flows and deadlines are met as effective as possible
* Follow up on changes/deviations on orders and secure communication towards stakeholders

**Qualification:**

* Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, or similar experience
* Minimum of 4 years of experience in planning and scheduling within a manufacturing environment
* Solid understanding of make-to-stock, configure-to-order, and engineer-to-order production processes
* Proficiency in planning software and ERP systems (SAP as a plus).
* Basic knowledge of Power BI and data visualization tools.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Fluency in both English and Swedish

  

This is a full-time consultant position in Lund through Incluso. Start is ASAP, 3 months limited contract to begin with, possibility to extend after that. This role is 80% on-site in Lund.

  

Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.

title: Change Project Leader
description:
**Assignment Overview**


We are looking for an experienced **Change Project Leader** to drive large-scale transformation initiatives. This position requires full on-site presence and a strong background in technical leadership, combining change management expertise with a deep understanding of engineering and architecture.


You have a solid foundation in software development, system architecture, and modern engineering practices, having progressed from hands-on coding to leading teams and guiding significant technical transitions. Your credibility among engineers and architects allows you to engage in technical discussions while connecting strategic goals with practical execution. With clear and persuasive communication, you transform complex challenges into actionable plans. Your leadership is based on influence and collaboration, enabling cross-functional teams to deliver sustainable change and aligning stakeholders from development teams to senior executives.

**Qualifications**

* 8–15 years of experience within engineering and architecture, with a career path evolving from senior engineer or architect into leadership roles such as tech lead or transformation lead.
* Demonstrated experience in driving large-scale technology and product transformations, including organizational and cultural change.
* Background in roles focused on technical advisory, engineering enablement, or improving developer experience.
* Strong track record from dynamic, product-driven environments.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English, with the ability to engage both technical and executive audiences.
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively across all levels of an organization.

 **About** **Rasulson Consulting**  

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Senior QA Engineer

You will take ownership of structuring and driving testing activities across the program while collaborating closely with test leads, product owners, architects, tech leads, and other stakeholders.


A QA Engineer is responsible for ensuring that software solutions meet high quality standards before release, identifying potential risks and defects in close cooperation with developers and business representatives.

* Document and report defects clearly to facilitate efficient resolution.

* Uphold quality standards and contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes.
* Collaborate across teams in a dynamic environment while managing your own priorities and schedule.
* Foster a culture of knowledge sharing, teamwork, and proactive problem-solving.

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector.
